loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Mrs. Sin Y., 31, runs a stand at home selling a variety of food to the people in her area, making around $5 each day in revenue. Her husband works driving a motorcycle, with a trailer attached, for transporting passengers in his area, and he can generally make about $5 each day. Furthermore, Mrs. Sin Y. has four under school-aged children and would like a loan to expand her grocery stand by purchasing more products to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.use: To expand her grocery stand by purchasing more products to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan works at ISECA, which is a technology institute where he teaches programming and computer classes. His home is located in the Zona Sur of the city of La Paz. His mother works as a caretaker at a public school in the same area of the city.

Juan is single and is the only person his mother can count on. He supports his family.

This is the third time that he requests a loan from IMPRO. His record classifies him as a "cliente 1" which means that he follows the terms of his loan and pays it accordingly.

This loan will be used to help him complete his college education and to buy a computer.

His credit record and his job allow him to qualify for this loan. He has been an IMPRO client since 2004.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Juan trabaja en ISECA, es un instituto de aprendizaje de computación donde su labor es de docente y enseña paquetes de computación y programación.

Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Zona Sur de la ciudad de La Paz., ya que su madre es portera de un colegio fiscal de la zona sur.

Es soltero y el único apoyo de ayuda para su madre ya que el sustenta los gastos familiares de su casa. Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.

El crédito será destinado para realizar sus estudios universitarios y comprar una computadora.

Su antecedente crediticio y trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2004.

loans.use: Purchase of a computer

loans.name: Javid

texts.en: Javid R. is a 33-year-old farmer who has sold milk and yoghurt to the local people since 2006. He lives with his family in the small village of Imishli. He would like to develop his business and to purchase two additional cows for $600 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase two additional cows

loans.name: En

texts.en: En S. is 34 years old and lives with her husband and one child in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, where she and her spouse are construction workers. On average, both of them earn around $5 a day of profit. However, their transportation to the construction site costs them around one dollar each day for the motor-taxi driver, so to reduce those costs and allow them to save money in the future, they are  requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: La Resurrecion (The Resurection) Group

texts.en:
Luciana is a 31-year-old woman who lives in the suburb of Los Alcarrizzos on the outskirts of the capital of Santo Domingo.

She has a small business selling used and new shoes to her community members and is asking for this loan so that she can have the money available to buy a larger quantity of shoes and, as a result, both sell more shoes and make more money. In her community people are very poor, and so the demand for used shoes is high; but when people can, they always prefer to have new shoes so she likes to be able to offer both.

With the money she is able to generate from this loan, she hopes that her little business will continue to grow, attracting and retaining new customers. She hopes that the extra income will also help her go back to school and finish her high school education. One day she dreams of having her own home and her own vehicle so that she can travel around more easily and be able to visit her family and friends more often.

On behalf of Luciana and everyone here at Esperanza International, we thank you for supporting her dreams and goals!

loans.use: To increase the quantity of shoes she is able to buy and sell to her community members.

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Mrs. Long H., 42, makes and sells Cambodian noodles from her home. She earns approximately $1.43 per day from this activity. Her husband, Mr. Khe Kha, is 45-years-old. He drives a motorcycle-taxi, earning approximately $1.66 per day. They have four children, all of whom are young. One of their children helps Mrs. Long H. to make noodles during the day, and the other three attend school. Mrs. H. requests a loan of $150 to purchase rice, an ingredient used to make her noodles. She plans to use the remainder of her loan to purchase pigs, which she can raise and sell for profit at local markets. This loan will allow her to expand her business and help to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase rice, an ingredient used to make noodles

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Saodat T. lives in the Vahdat region. She is 45 years old, married and has four children. Saodat has been doing animal husbandry for more than fifteen years. She buys young calves at the local market, feeds them for about 45 days and then sells at a more profitable price. Her big and friendly family is helping her too. At this time Saodat wants to buy another calf for feeding and resale. She decided to apply for a loan with a 10 months term.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Тилакова Саодат жительница района Вахдат. Возраст 45 лет.Замужем , имеет 4 детей.Саодат более 15 лет занимается животноводством.Она покупает на месном рынке молодых бычков , откармливает их в течение 45 дней и продает по более выгодной ей цене.Помогают ей ее большая и дружная семья. В данный момент клиентка хочет купить очередного бычка для откормки и продажи.Для чего она решила взять кредит сроком на 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Vedith

texts.es:
Vedith is a member of the Sargento Lores ("Sargeant Lores") community bank. She lives in the "provincia" of San Martin and operates a business selling barbecued chicken. She owns the poultry that go on her menu. The business is located in her house and her customers include both locals and people from outside the neighborhood. She began with a tailoring business because she's a seamstress, but that business wasn't profitable and she decided to try something else. She saw that her house was in a good spot for a restaurant business so she set up the new business and it's gone very well.

With this loan of S/.2,000 (2,000 Peruvian soles), to be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy spoons, dishes, forks, knives, glasses, tables, ladles, etc. so that she can better arrange her business. She will also buy rice, sugar, soft drinks, etc. so that she has the supplies that she needs to provide her customers with the things that they want.

Vedith, 43, is a happy and enthusiastic woman who still has a strong desire to keep on growing. Things are going well because her charisma and attention attract customers. Her goal is to expand her restaurant because there are times when there's not enough space to serve everyone waiting. With the help of her children and the perseverance that she's demonstrated, she will surely succeed in meeting her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Vedith, es socia del Banco Comunal. “Sargento Lores”, vive en la Región y Provincia San Martín, distrito de Morales, se dedica a la venta de pollos a la brasa, tiene su polleria, también vende menú, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa en la Av. Perú No 120 - Morales a donde diariamente acuden sus comensales, que son moradores de la propia localidad o visitantes de otros lugares. Ella comenzó con el negocio de bazar por que ella es costurera pero no le fue muy bien, no era muy rentable, por eso decidió cambiar de negocio, vió que su casa esta ubicado en un buen lugar y además que tiene un local propio, emprendió este nuevo negocio y le esta yendo muy bien.

Con este crédito de S/ 2000.00 que pagará en 4 cuotas, comprará cucharas, platos, tenedores, cuchillos, vasos, mesas cucharones, para implementar mejor su negocio, también comprará arroz, azúcar, gaseosas de diferentes marcas, tamaños y sabores para la preparación del menú y tener los insumos necesarios para dar una buena atención a sus clientes.

Vedith, es una mujer entusiasta y alegre con sus 43 años aun tiene muchas ganas de seguir creciendo, le va muy bien por el trato y carisma que tiene al atender a sus clientes, su meta es ampliar su local por que hay tiempos en que no hay lugar para mas personas que van a consumir, con el apoyo de sus hijos y la perseverancia que tiene esta segura que lo va lograr.

loans.use: Buy supplies for restaurant business.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam S. lives in Pongro Village in Takeo Province. She is 26 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the remaining two are too young to work or study right now.

Mrs Sam is a poultry breeder who raises ducks for eggs. Since her business is doing well, she plans to expand it by buying another 200 ducks for breeding. Each duck costs $2.50, so she is requesting $500 to achieve this goal. 

Her husband, Mr. Vith Sao, is a farmer and also assists his wife with her business.

loans.use: To buy 200 ducks for breeding.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma is a 32 year old mother of two, ages 3 and 6.  From 8 am to 10 pm she sells firewood to supplement her family's income.  She earns $45 per month.  She hopes to expand into more profitable products.  This is her first loan from BRAC Tanzania.

loans.use: To buy more stock to improve her business

loans.name: Khuraman

texts.en: Khuraman was born in 1958 and is a mother of two children. She lives in Khachmaz in Azerbaijan. Seven years ago she started a sheep-breeding business. She needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy sheep and a calf.

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Jeykhun

texts.en:
Jeykhun H. is a good father, a hard-working farmer, and steadfast in his endeavor of raising animals. Thanks to his wife’s assistance, he is able to raise and feed the animals and prepare them for sale at both fairs and marketplaces in nearby towns.

Jeykhun has three childen. He buys calves for low prices, feeds them and after three-four months, sells them. Jeykhun would now like to increase the number of cattle he is raising and is requesting a loan in the amount of 1200 USD. He promises to be responsible and prompt in repaying it.

loans.use: purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị L. năm nay 50 tuổi, chị đang sống tại xã Tam Đồng huyện Mê Linh- Hà Nội . Năm 1995  chị L. tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Nhờ chăm chỉ làm ăn  nên công việc chăn nuôi ngày càng phát triển giúp cho kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng ổn định hơn. Hiện tại chị L. đang đầu tư vốn để chăn nuôi gà. Bên cạnh đó hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm sự hỗ trợ của các con nên hàng tháng thu nhập của gia đình chị luôn đạt 5.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị L. xin vay 13.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm gà và  thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi L. is 50 years old, she lives in Tam Dong commune, Me Linh district, Hanoi. In 1995, Mrs. L. participated in the TYM Fund and borrowed money to raise poultry. Thanks to hard-work, the business of raising poultry has been growing well and helping to improve her family's economic situation. Currently, Mrs. Loan invests money in raising chickens. In addition, her family receives financial support from her children, so the monthly income of her family always reaches VND5,000,000.

In this loan cycle, Mrs. Loan requests a loan of VND13,000,000 to buy more chicken and food for poultry.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising poultry

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa A. is forty five years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children, all of whom are girls. The first three children have completed school. Some are currently in the junior high school while others are in basic school. Theresa’s husband is a cocoa farmer. He cultivates food crops such as plantain, cassava, maize, etc. Theresa lives with her husband and children in a family house in Offinso. Offinso is a farming as well as a commercial community in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

She trades to support her husband with taking care of the family. She trades in tomatoes and other vegetables on a table top in the local market. She buys boxes of tomatoes, pepper, and other vegetables from farmers in the surrounding villages at affordable prices. She sells mostly to the food vendors in her community. Theresa has been in business for ten years. She wants a loan to buy vegetables in larger quantities so she can increase her profit margin. She is working hard to support her husband to providing their children's education.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in larger quantities for resale

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es: Isidora es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene una tienda su casa alquilada, a sus 35 años tiene muchas ganas de progresar en la vida y sabe que con mucho trabajo lo puede lograr. A 5400 m.s.n.m. en San Antonio de Putina (Provincia de la región de Puno), se encuentra el centro poblado La Mina Rinconada (Poblado predominantemente minero), en este pueblo Isidora a logrado poner un fructífero negocio, ella tiene una tienda donde vende de todo y con el cual abastece a los moradores de La mina Rinconada con víveres y demás artículos para el hogar. Son 14 años los que lleva negociando allí y lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que soportar el intenso frío que hace en este pueblo cercano a la Cordillera de los Andes, pero le gusta vender sus productos y sentir que ayuda al progreso de este centro poblado, para el futuro de su tienda quiere incrementar la cantidad de productos que vende para satisfacer mejor la demanda  de los numeroso pobladores de La Mina Rinconada. Isidora se encuentra en su tercer préstamo con MFP, y tiene pensado acceder a otros más, por lo cual quiere pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas y no traerle problemas a su banco comunal donde es muy querida, ya que es muy responsable. El dinero solicitado se invertirá en la comprar de mercadería para implementar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Isidora is a very hardworking 35-year-old woman who has a great desire to get ahead and knows that with dedication she will succeed. She has built a thriving business at over 17,000 feet above sea level in her rented home in the mining town of La Mina Rinconada, in the Puno region of Peru.

Isidora has a general store that supplies the population of La Mina Rinconada with groceries and other items for the home. She has had her business for 14 years, and the most difficult thing about living there is putting up with the intense cold of the Andes Mountains. But, she enjoys selling her merchandise and she feels that she is a part of the development of the town. She would like to increase the quantity of products she offers for sale, so that she can better meet the needs of the residents of her town.

This is Isidora's third loan with Kiva's partner Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she has plans for many more. She has been punctual in her loan repayments and has not had any problems with her community bank, where she is much beloved since she is very responsible. She will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of merchandise to improve her store.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Oeun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeun K. is a group leader of five people who all live in the Pech Entrea village in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field in which to cultivate rice. On this plantation, she has a problem because this field has infertile soil, which badly affects her crop. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Mak Noum, is a construction worker. Mrs. Oeun K. is 30 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study.

All the members in this group loan are utilizing end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Dirían Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Dirian V. actualmente se dedica a laborar mucho en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega ya que está buscando la manera de cómo salir adelante en el mejoramiento de su vivienda para brindarles las condiciones necesarias de vida a sus cuatro pequeños hijos.

Con mucho entusiasmo ella labora y la razón por la cual espera en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción para así llevar a cabo la reconstrucción de su vivienda. Es por esto que espera sabiendo que al obtener el dinero logrará llevar a cabo su tarea satisfactoriamente y mejorará las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Dirian V. currently dedicates herself to working a great deal in the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandenga given that she is looking for away to get ahead in the improvement of her home to be able to offer the necessary living conditions to her four small children. Dirian works with much enthusiasm, and the reason that she is seeking Ceprodel’s help is to be benefited with a credit to purchase construction materials and in that way carry out construction on her home. It is for this that she waits knowing that once she obtains the money will she will be able to carry out her task satisfactorily and improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en: Mr. Ronie T., 23, is a resident of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. He is married and has a one-year old child. He is striving hard to earn more income to support his family’s needs and his child's future. With HSPFI assistance, he was able to open up a mini grocery store, where he sells canned goods, noodles, snacks, soft drinks, candies, chocolates and other items. Ronie’s store has the advantage of being located near Lumbia International Airport. Ronie plans to leverage the proximity to the airport and thus increase his income from the business. He requests a loan of PHP 14,000 to purchase more goods to retail and to revovate and expand his store.

loans.use: To buy more grocery stocks to retail and for expanding store

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia E., 28, is married and has three children, one son and two daughters. According to her, all of her children are currently in the primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

She works to provide for the family. Emilia’s husband is a caterpillar operator. She is a trader who sells a local drink made from maize. She procures bags of maize from the local market. Emilia hawks to sell and also sells on a table top at the local market. Emilia has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: Procure bags of maize.

loans.name: Zalmi

texts.en:
The man pictured here is Zalmi, the son of A. R.. He lives in the eighth district of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has many responsibilities towards his family members.

The house in which he and his nine family members live is very small and needs repairs. He knows he must make these repairs to his home but he could not afford the expenses. When he heard that the microloan process exists in Afghanistan and that through AFS he can obtain a loan, he became very happy. He is now requesting a loan in the amount of $50,000 Afghani to buy the required construction materials for his house repairs.

He would like to say that this is a truly effective way to support people in need.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva L. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Eva is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Eva operates a business weaving and selling nipa (palm) products to local businesses and community members. Eva is just starting this business.

In 2008, Eva joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to expand her product offering. Eva is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials like nipa leaves to weave in order to expand her product offering. This will be the third loan taken out by Eva from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase nipa leaves to weave to expand her product offering

loans.name: Rabaka

texts.en:
Rabaka K. sells bread and sugar and is requesting a loan to puchase more bags of sugar to sell. Rabaka is 40 years old and married. Her husband is a peasant. She has four children and they are all attending school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of sugar to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita.
Gloria es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 2 hijos que son gemelos, Gloria se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como el cuy, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo, la venta de sus productos lo realiza en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuy para engordarlos.
Los sueños de Gloria son construir su casa, tener dinero suficiente para la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria is a partner of Santa Rita Community Bank. Gloria is a cohabitant, is 22 years old and has two sons who are twins. She is dedicated to the upbringing of small animals like the guinea pig, which is an activity she has achieved with the help of her husband. She sells her products in the markets of the city of Ayacucho. Gloria needs a loan of $275, money that will be invested in the purchase of guinea pigs to help them put on weight. Gloria's dreams are to build her house and to have enough money to educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of guinea pigs help them put on weight

loans.name: Erica Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora ERICA CECILIA S. N.   tiene 26  años de edad, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Mar y Cielo II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, tiene 2hijos de 3 años y 7 meses de edad , quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
Se dedica a la producción y venta de calzado .
Los fabrica en su domicilio y sale a venderlos de forma ambulatoria en la compañía de su esposo en el centro de Trujillo pero también tiene una vitrina en su casa  en donde los coloca en exhibición y los vende a sus vecinos .
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compro materiales para fabricar zapatos como plantillas, cuero, terocal,cuerina,etc
Este crédito de 1000  lo invertirá en la compra de productos cuero, hormas, zuelas, etc
ERICA  suena con alquilar un stand en un centro comercial de Trujillo y vender su calzado.
texts.en:
Erica Cecilia S. Narváez is 26 years old and lives in the district of Esperanza, in the province of Trujillo, in the La Libertad region of Peru.
She belongs to the Mar y Cielo II Bank.
This entrepreneur studied until the fifth year of secondary school. She has two dependent children aged three years and seven months old.
She makes and sells shoes.
She makes them in her home and goes out to sell them in the centre of Trujillo with her husband. She also displays some in her home and sells them to her neighbours.
With her first 300 PEN loan, she purchased materials to make shoes, like insoles, leather, glue, imitation leather, etc.
She will use this 1000 PEN loan to purchase leather, shoetrees, shoe soles etc.
Erica dreams of renting a stand in a Trujillo shopping centre to sell her shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase leather, shoetrees, shoe soles, etc.

loans.name: Ochgerel

texts.en:
Ochgerel B. is a 30-year-old single mother who lives with her three daughters in the Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. Her two oldest daughters currently attend secondary school and the youngest has not yet reached school age. Ochgerel, together with her sister, operates a mobile commodities-trade business in her town. By driving her vehicle through the Arkhangai countryside, she exchanges commodities and dairy products which she sells at markets in the province capital and Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city.
 
Ochgerel started her business in 2005 with capital of 300,000 tugrugs. Her business has found success and the profits have greatly improved her family's quality of life. As result of her hard work, today, her business capital exceeds 1,200,000 tugrugs (approximately $828). 

Ochgerel's ultimate goal is to provide a good education for her children. She is hoping to one day expand her business to help accomplish this goal. She says, “I hope (to) expand my business even more and own a permanent workspace.” She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.use: Purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Mirjavad

texts.en:
Mirjavad A. is 44 years old. He is married with two sons and helps his parents with the family expenses.

Mirjavad has been the owner of a small general store for more than 13 years. He sells foodstuffs for everyday use such as flour, sugar, macaroni, soft drinks, sweets (candies), etc. His motivation for requesting a loan is to be able to purchase more merchandise to stock his business. A larger selection of goods will attract more clients and generate a good monthly income to help his family.

Support this hardworking man of much strength and courage to keep working.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Business Future Group

texts.en:
Christine, the leader of this group, lives in the T. Taylor community in the Foyah district of Lofa County. She has a three-year-old child who attends daycare. For about three years, Christine has sold dry goods, and this is how she supports her son and pays for his school fees. She sells items such as salt, onions, cubes, and seasonings.

Her challenge has been lack of finances, but she is successful in attracting her customers through word of mouth and by offering affordable prices.

She dreams of a bigger business someday to adequately support her son.

loans.use: To improve her dry-goods sales business

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María del Carmen E. T. pertenece al municipio de Tisma en la zona rural conocida como Montañita 1. Esta comunidad es muy podre y carecen de muchos recursos y derechos básicos como la educación.

Pero a pesar de esto E. T. no se rinde y busco como salir adelante. Es así que  inicio hace cinco años con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y cosmético entre otros productos. Actualmente ella distribuye por mayor y tiene colaboradores que le ayudan en la comercialización y el cobro de dichos productos.

Esta señora de 49 años tiene como meta engrandecer su negocio pero para ello necesita invertir en la adquisición de estilos  de ropa de vestir y de cama, cosméticos y plásticos como vasos, platos y panas entre otros.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen E. T. belongs to the Tisma municipality in a rural zone know as Montañita 1. This is a very poor community and lacks many resources and basic rights, such as education. Despite this, E. T. would not give up and looked for a way to advance. This is how, 5 years ago, she stated a small business selling, among other products, clothing and cosmetics. Currently she is mostly the distributor and has partners who help her with the commercialization and invoicing of said products. The goal of this 49 year old woman is to expand her business, but in order to do this she needs to invest in acquiring different styles of clothing, bedclothes, comestics and plastic products such as cups, plates and tubs, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Adia

texts.en:
Adia A. is currently in the business of selling bread and tea at a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase more baking flour and sugar. Adia is 20 years old and is married to a bookkeeper. She has one child who does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to develop it into a hotel.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more baking flour and sugar

loans.name: Lusia M.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Lusia M. from Mbeya. She is widow with three children, who are between the ages of 9 and 14. She is also responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents are unable to care of them. Lusia has been running a crops-selling business since 1995. She purchases crops at wholesale prices and sells at retail to get more profit. She works at the business for twelve hours a day, six days a week. Lusia currently earns monthly profit of about $104 from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more crops in bulk. In the future, she plans to open the same business at another location. Lusia thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more crops in bulk

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba is a very diligent woman of 37 years. She is married with four children. Her husband is a farmer. Thanks to her dear parents' seeding skills, she is very familiar with agriculture work. Her loving father gave her fields to farm twelve years ago and she's been working them ever since. This activity has helped to pay the economic expenses of her family.

Nasiba's wishes to improve the quality of her products drove her to request a loan of 4500 TJS to acquire seeds and mineral fertilizers in order to obtain excellent products for this harvesting season. Please help make her request possible so that this hardworking mother can continue to sustain her work with a lot of satisfaction. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchaseing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta D. C. is from the village of San Pedro, Alicia, Isabela. She is 49 years old. Marietta is widowed and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Marietta owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale.

In 2008, Marietta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marietta is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Marietta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida D., 51 years old, is a resident of Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She has a farm and grows rice. She works from morning until sunset to ensure that she will have a very abundant harvest. She wants to earn more income to help her family buy food, clothes and other basic needs.

She is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner. The loan will go far in buying farm supplies to double the size of her harvest.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase drinks in bulk for resale

loans.name: Demba

texts.fr: Monsieur Demba G. est un tailleur de36 ans qui habite dans la banlieue de Guediawaye plus précisément dans le quartier de baye laye 447. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis septembre 2007 et a déjà bénéficié de  3 prêts antérieurs. Il est marie et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 4 et 6 ans. C’est depuis 1985 qu’il a commence a apprendre ce métier. En 1990 il dispose de son propre atelier de couture. Malgré ses performances dans le métier  il n’a jamais appris le français sinon le Coran. C’est un choix qui a été fait par amour. C’est un grand plaisir pour lui de confectionner de jolis boubous. Mais il se réjouit aussi de gagner beaucoup d’argent pendant les fêtes de tabaski de korite et de fin d’années. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000frs destine a l’achat d’une sixième machine a coudre dans le souci de renforcer son matériel. Il envisage dans le futur d’étendre son atelier car son activité commence a s’agrandir.
texts.en:
Monsieur Demba G. is a tailor, age 36, who lives on the outskirts of Guediawaye, more precisely in the Baye Laye 447 neighborhood. He has been a member of U-IMCEC since September 2007 and has already received three loans. He is married and the father of two children, 4 and 6 years old.

In 1985 he began to learn his trade. In 1990 he got his own tailor shop. Despite his performance in this trade, he never learned French, only the Koran. This is a choice he made freely and it is a great pleasure for him to sew beautiful boubous (traditional robes). But he is also very happy to earn a lot of money during the feast days at 'Tabaski', 'Korite' (Moslem holy days), and the New Year's holidays.

He is requesting a loan of 200,000 frs to use to buy a sixth sewing machine so that he can improve his equipment. In future, he foresees that he will need to enlarge his workshop since his business is beginning to grow.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying a 6th sewing machine for his workshop

loans.name: Mario Carlos

texts.es:
La Sr. Mario Carlos García Peña tiene 40 años de edad vive con su tia en y en casa de sus abuelos en el pueblo joven Sr de Luren – Ica el sr. tiene un hijo mayor de edad al cual apoya en todas necesidades, el le apoya en sus estudios ya que él es bien responsable con sus obligaciones y desea que su hijo sea cada dia mejor.
El cuenta con un carro propio el cual lo trabaja diariamente y cuenta con una mototaxi que la da a trabajar todo esto ha sido obtenido gracias a su esfuerzo.
El sr. desea que le apoyemos con un nuevo financiamiento para poder arreglar una de sus herramientas de trabajo como es la mototaxi ya que por motivos de mantenimiento no la puede dar a trabajar continuamente entonces desea seguir obteniendo ese segundo ingreso que le permite apoyar a su hijo.
El Sr. tiene buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos y su sueño es que mas adelante desea comprarse dos carros mas para seguir creciendo como microempresario.
texts.en:
Mario Carlos García Peña is 40 years old. He lives with his aunt in his grandparents’ house in Pueblo Joven Sr. de Luren in Ica. He has a grown son who he helps with all of the necessities. He helps his son with his education because he is very responsible with his obligations, and he wants his son to improve everyday. He has his own car, which he uses to work everyday. He also has a mototaxi (three wheeled motorized vehicle) which he puts to work. This has all been obtained thanks to his effort. He wants us to help him with a new loan to be able to fix one of his work tools, the mototaxi. He cannot put it to work continually due to maintenance issues. He wants to keep getting this second income that allows him to help his son. He has good references from his neighbors. His dream is to later buy two more cars in order to keep growing as a small businessman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in fixed assets

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a calf for fattening and reselling later

loans.name: Kamoliddin

texts.en:
Kamoliddin B. is 32 years old. He is married with two children. He raises and sells cattle at the market. This is a very profitable business, especially during the season of the celebrations. He has been in this business since 2000. Kamoliddin has a friendly family who always try to help each other. He is requesting a loan in order to be able to purchase more cows and feed for them. This is especially important for his commerce, because the price for them has declined. With your help, Kamoliddin can improve his family’s living conditions.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase small cattle for developing business.

loans.name: Foluke

texts.en: Foluke sells peppers and tomatoes in Lagos state, Nigeria, where she resides, and she also grinds them for additional income. She started this trade some years ago and has done well, using her income to support her household.  Fifty-years-old and married to a transporter, Foluke is the mother of four children, three girls and one boy.  She is now requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more fresh tomatoes and peppers to sell to her costumers to increase her profit. She is very happy with Kiva lenders for the financial assistance they offer.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh tomatoes and peppers to sell.

loans.name: Magno

texts.es:
Magno es un padre de familia de 52 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Pampas de la Aviación, perteneciente al distrito de Chochope, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde muy joven a trabajar en labores agrícolas, solía trabajar como peón agrícola en los campos de cultivo de la zona y hace quince años pudo adquirir su propio terreno de cultivo en el que viene sembrando maíz. El gusta mucho de la labor que realiza debido a que ha ido creciendo gracias a su propio esfuerzo y también porque gracias a esta actividad ha podido mantener a su familia durante todos estos años.

Magno tiene instalado actualmente un cultivo de maíz que ya se encuentra bastante desarrollado y próximo a dar fruto, el desea asegurarse una buena producción brindándole riegos y aplicándole fertilizantes, para cumplir con este objetivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Magno es un padre responsable y trabajador, todas las actividades que planea siempre tienen como meta sacar adelante a su familia, a quienes quiere brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona honorable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Magno is a father of a family and is 52 years old. He lives together with his wife and their children in the Pampas de la Aviación sector, which belongs to the Chochope district, an agricultural zone in the province of Lambayeque, an hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has been working in agriculture since he was very young. He usually worked as a farm worker in the fields of the area and fifteen years ago, he was able to acquire his own farmlands in which he is growing corn. He likes his work very much due to the fact that it has been increasing, thanks to his own effort. In addition, thanks to this business, he has been able to support his family during all of these years. Magno currently has a well-developed corn crop and it will soon bear fruit. He wants to assure that there will be good production by watering his crops and applying fertilizers. To be able to achieve this goal, he is applying for his first loan of 2000 PEN at Edpyme Alternativa. Magno is a responsible and hardworking father. With all of the work that he does, he always has has the goal of helping his family get ahead, to whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. His neighbors and acquaintances consider him to be an honorable and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and application of fertilizers to maintain his corn crops.

location.town: Pampas de la Aviación - Chochope - Lambayeque

loans.name: Assoumpta

texts.en:
Assoumpta was born in 1975 and is married with five children, aged between 6 and 15. She has a small shop, which sells various products such as cooking oil, soap, and so on. Her business is open from 6 in the morning to 9 in the evening every day except Saturday.

Assoumpta is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing her business through purchasing additional products such as: rice, sugar and so forth. This loan will be very important for her and her community simply because Assoumpta will be able to help satisfy the community's needs and employ some of them

loans.use: The purchase of a large quantity of goods such as rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Messan Kwami

texts.en:
Monsieur Messan Kwami Q. sells thread, ribbons, fabrics, and other products in his home town of Lomé, Togo. He has been in business since 2003. He and his wife, who is also an entrepreneur, have four children.

Messan has requested his first loan from WAGES of 500,000 CFA to purchase more merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche  comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). 
 

Vive en la  comunidad  de Ninachiri , sector Kallutaca de la Provincia  Los Andes  del departamento de La Paz, ubicado  a  tres   horas de la ciudad de La Paz. 

Vive junto a su esposa y dos de sus hijas las cuales colaboran  en el cuidado del ganado.


El crédito lo destinará a la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Francisco raises cattle. He sells his milk production to PIL Andina (Industrializad Milk Plant). He lives in the Ninachiri community, Kallutaca sector, Los Andes province, La Paz department. It is three hours from the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife and two of their daughters. They help take care of the cattle. The loan is to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production as well as his income. This is his first loan with Impro. The competed evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow to increase milk production

loans.name: Vilda

texts.es:
La Sra. Vilda B. tiene 50 años de edad, esta en pareja hace varios años, tiene 9 hijos, de los cuales solo dos son menores y en edad escolar, los demas trabajan y estudian en la universidad y otros algunas carreras técnicas.
La Sra. Vilda se dedica junto con su esposo y uno de sus hijos a la compra y venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 10 años aproximadamente, sus mercaderias los compra en forma diaria del mercado municipal de abasto en Asunción, luego se dividen las merdaderias en 3 partes para dirigirse a diferentes itinerarios durante el dia. 
Se inicio con unos pocos ahorros en forma ambulante y luego compro dos carros para aumentar su zona de trabajo, actualmente cuenta con ambos carros y accederieron a la compra de una camioneta.
La señora invirtio el crédito en la ampliación de frutas y verduras ya que con la compra de su camioneta pueden aumentar la cantidad de frutas a transportar
texts.en:
Vilda B., 50, has been in a relationship for several years; she has 9 children, two of whom are still school-aged minors, the rest work and go to the university, some have technical careers. Vilda, her husband and one of her sons have sold fruits and vegetables for about 10 years now. They buy their merchandise daily at Asunción’s wholesale foodstuffs market then split it into three parts to be distributed along different routes during the day. She started out as an itinerant merchant with just a few stock items but afterwards was able to buy two cars in order to expand their sales area; currently she still has the two cars and has upgraded to the purchase of a van too. She used the loan to buy larger amounts of fruits and vegetables because now that they have the van they are able to transport larger amounts.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Amna's Group

texts.en:
Amna lives in the city of Chichawatni in Pakistan with her husband who earns a very small income working in a cotton mill. She is the mother of three daughters and a son. She works very hard to afford their schooling. 

Amna operates a grocery store from her home; in fact, she has made her guest room her shop, which is currently running well. This is the first time she has applied for a loan from Asasah. She will utilize this loan to expand her grocery business by putting more items in it. She is sure that this will be a good investment and she will be able to repay the loan easily.

loans.use: Purchase groceries for her store

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn C. is from the village of Mozzozzin Norte. She is 26 years old and married with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn raises pigs for fattening to sell. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.  She has recently joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase baby livestock.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose A. is from the village of Bacnor East. She is 36 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Mary Rose owns and operates a business making and selling breads, cakes and cookies to the local community. Mary Rose has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Mary Rose joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Rose has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Mary Rose is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Mary Rose from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en:
Chhum K., age 51, owns and operates a handicraft business whose main activity is selling rattan cupboards. She sells rattan that she weaves herself or that she orders from other weavers who live in the village. 

She was married, but her husband died of senility years ago. She currently lives with a son who is skilled in repairing mobile phones; another one of her children has gotten married and lives separately. Chhum K. has requested a loan for son to use to increase his business capital.

loans.use: To increase the business capital

loans.name: Dinah Jepkoech

texts.en:
Dinah Jepkoech C. is a 42-year-old lady who is married with four children aged 27 years, 25 years, 22 years and 10 years. She and her family live in Kapsoya an area outside of Eldoret town.

Dinah has a cereals store where she earns her income. She has been in this business for the past twenty years with an income of Kshs 10,000 per month.

Dinah was introduced to KADET by a friend and is applying for her first loan of Kshs 20,000 with KADET. With this loan she plans to buy five bags of maize and four bags of beans.

Dinah hopes to operate a large cereal store where she will be able to supply foodstuffs to schools and sell the best quality to her customers. She also hopes, in the future, to extend the same services to the city centre.

loans.use: To purchase five bags of maize and four  bags of beans

loans.name: Yeanor

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Yeanor Sesay. She is married and has two children, aged 26 and 20 years. She has five additional dependents who live with her because they are her husband's relatives and need assistance for their schooling.   

In 1990, Yeanor Sesay established a business selling school bags, Coleman(Coolers), toys and suitcases. She began her business because of her desire to assist her husband in providing a livelihood for their family.  Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 2,668,600SLL every month from this business. 

She needs a loan of 4,000,000SLL. Yeanor Sesay requires a loan in order to buy more suitcases, school bags and toys for her stall. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 373,604SLL. In the future, Yeanor Sesay plans to build a permanent business structure. She is very hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more toys, suitcases, coolers and school bags

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie O. is from the village of Bagong Tanza. She is 38 years old. Rosalie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalie owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Rosalie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Rosalie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA UNION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Virginia; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artefactos y también trabaja en un snack cafetería, la socia compra diferentes artefactos y luego los lleva a diferentes lugares como Chumbivilcas y Quillabamba, la socia quiere mejorar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artefactos como radios pequeñas al por mayor.  


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Virginia belongs to "La Union" community bank in the district of Cusco, Peru. Virginia is 36 years old, has two children and lives with her common-law husband. She alternates her daily activities between selling electronic devices and running a snack stand. Virginia buys different devices and then takes them to different places such as Chumbivilcas and Quillabamba. She wants to improve her business and is requesting a loan to purchase more devices, such as small radios, at wholesale. Virginia is grateful to those who make this dream possible through this medium and promises to fulfill her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase devices like small radios at wholesale

loans.name: Marcelo Dario

texts.es: El Sr. Marcelo es un cliente nuevo de la institución el señor tiene dos hijos una pequeña de siete años la cual es de su primer matrimonio y con su segunda esposa  tiene un pequeño de dos meses, El Sr. Marcelo trabaja como transportista y en la noche esta estudiando contaduría publica en la universidad ya que quiere superarse para darles una vida mejor a su familia, la movilidad que esta manejando  la esta pagando a cuotas mensuales, su esposa le ayuda con un pequeño restaurant que tienen y que por motivo del embarazo lo tubo que dejar unos cuatro meses, el préstamo que solicitan es para terminar de pagar la movilidad y así poder tramitar los papeles de la movilidad a su nombre, su  esposa quieren comenzar la venta de pollos a broaster por la noche en el restaurante, y asi poder hacer realidad su sueño que es el de comprarse su propia casa. En la foto el Sr. Marcelo esta acompañado de su familia.
texts.en: Marcelo is a new client with the institution. He has two children: a little 7-year-old girl from his first marriage, and with his second wife he has a little boy who is two months old. Marcelo works in transportation and at night is studying public accounting, since he wants to better himself in order to give his family a better life.  He gets paid monthly for driving a taxi. His wife helps him with a small restaurant they have and that she had to leave for four months because of the pregnancy. The loan they are seeking is to finish paying off the taxi, and thus be able to process the paperwork for putting the taxi in his name, and his wife wants to start selling fried chicken at night in the restaurant, and so to be able to realize the dream of buying their own home. In the photo is Marcelo accompanied by his family.

loans.use: To finish paying off the taxi and also for an activity for his wife.

loans.name: Sophia Efua Tuaba

texts.en: Sophia Efua Tuaba E. sells materials, sandals and cosmetics at Abura. She is married and has five dependants. Her husband is a farmer. She has been in this business for 14 years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more cosmetics to sell. She hopes to build a shop from her additional profit.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Nanki

texts.en:
Nanki R. was born in 1970. She is married and the couple is blessed with three children, all under 15 years old.  She lives in a small house with three rooms with her family on Foncha Street, in a quarter in Bamenda, in the northwest region of Cameroon.

R. has faced some challenges in life: the inability to meet the basic necessities of her family -- like clothing, food, and transportation, the inability to educate herself and her children, and difficulties in raising capital to start up a small business.   

To sustain herself and her family, she plans to invest this loan into a phone booth business.  With this loan she is going to buy two phones and transfer the credit and related bonus in the two phones which she sells to her customers. She believes the business will succeed because the previous loan she took was repaid by the income raised from an old phone of hers.  Therefore, she concludes that she is sure the business will succeed. She is certain that this business will succeed because the services she renders are in high demand in the market. The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford food ingredients.

R. will plough part of the profit back into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her children’s school fees and cater for the family. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE:

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy two phones and phone credits for business

loans.name: Maria Socorro

texts.en:
Maria is forty-seven years old.  She lives in the district of Tambogrande.  Tambogrande is a semi-tropical zone which is populated primarily by farmers.  Many residents have small fruit plantations or raise animals.  Maria shares her home with her husband, who is a field laborer with permanent work on a large local farm.  Between the two of them, they manage to maintain a stable lifestyle and a happy home.

Maria raises and cares for sheep and cattle.  The cattle are dairy producers; Maria harvests their milk regularly and sells it to her neighbors or for further processing.  The sheep are raised for their meat; Maria cares for the sheep until they reach the appropriate size and weight for sale in local markets.  In total, the family has five dairy cows and sixteen sheep.  The animals play an integral role in the local culinary tradition and nutrition.

This will be Maria’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa, although she has worked with other financial institutions in the past.  She appreciates the access to a reduced interest rate that is provided as a result of the funding through Kiva.  She plans to use the loan to purchase more balanced feed for her animals and hopes that the investment will improve their general health and productivity.  By improving productivity, she expects to further improve and stabilize her family’s income, providing greater opportunity and stability for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more balanced feed

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer K. is from the village of Nagrumbuan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 38 years old. Jennifer is separated from her spouse and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jennifer owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Jennifer has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jennifer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennifer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory to and use as working capital. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jennifer from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline L. is from the town of Banga. She is 50 years old. Evangeline is married and has three children aged 27, 22 and 19. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Evangeline works hard to provide her family's needs.

Evangeline joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Lorain

texts.en:
Lorain C. is from the village of Eastern Pob., Lopez Jaena. She is 32 years old, married and has 1 infant. Lorain owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling a variety of food products in the local community. Lorain has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Lorain joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorain is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Lorain from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar J. is from the village of Brgy. Model Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 27 years old. Maricar is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Maricar owns & operates a store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal products, such as perfume, lotion, cosmetics and clothes. Maricar has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maricar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Maricar is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Maricar from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Brgy. Model Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcay

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra R., age 44, is from the village of Quezon San Isidro. Myra and her husband have four school-aged children. Myra earns her living by operating a clothing business. She provides general clothing services to local community members. Myra has been engaged in her business for over 23 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Myra joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Myra has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Myra is requesting a second loan of 6,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina, 42, is a married mother of five school-aged children who all attend school. She is a farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley Kenya where she has been farming for 15 years. She employs one farmhand and sells her milk to the local market.

Angelina has requested for this loan of 30,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to start poultry farming. She will use this loan to buy chickens, to build a poultry shed and to buy poultry feeds. The extra income from this project will help her pay school fees for her children. She faces the challenge of diseases and lack of a stable market for her products.

loans.use: to start poultry farming

loans.name: Nino Salvador Group

texts.en: The communal bank "Nino Salvador" (Child Savior) is in its first loan cycle at FINCA Peru. Members of the bank have various businesses in Ayacucho, selling livestock (pigs and roosters), sweets, and groceries. Berta is the President of the bank. She is 37 years old and has three children who are all studying. She sells groceries at a small store here in Ayacucho. She used to sell groceries in the jungle outsiD. of the city, but recently moved. She will be using her loan of 1,000 PEN to purchase supplies to stock her store, such as sugar and rice. She has been a member of FINCA Peru, on and off, for ten years.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for grocery store, such as sugar and rice

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is currently in the business of selling soft drinks. She is 25 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom go to school. Paulina took out a loan to stock more soft drinks to sell. She hopes to pay her children's school fees in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Henry

texts.es: El señor Henry se dedica a la confección y venta de blusas juveniles y calzas de tela lycra,  tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio, por las mañanas vende en su puesto fijo de la calle comercio y por las tardes se dedica a la confección de ropa a pedido y para cubrir los requerimientos de su puesto de venta, vive en casa de sus papás con sus dos hijos, por quienes trabaja todos los días sin descanso, poco a poco logro comprar las máquinas para tener un taller donde puede elaborar sus diseños en los colores y tallas que el mercado le exige, el crédito que solicito el Sr. Henry es para utilizarlo en la compra de tela lycra puesto que en primavera los costos de esta tela se elevan por tanto el prefiere comprarla cuando su precio es bajo, el Sr. Henry solicita crédito en la institución por recomendación de una cliente antigua y responsable.
texts.en:
Señor Henry earns a living making and selling children's blouses and Lycra stockings. He has a small workshop in his home. Mornings he staffs his regular stand in the business district, and afternoons he makes clothing to order and to meet the needs of his stand. He lives in his mom and dad's home with his two children, for whom he works every day without rest. Little by little he was able to buy the machines needed to have a workshop where he may make his designs in the colors and sizes that are in demand. 

The loan requested by Señor Henry is to be used for purchasing Lycra cloth, since in the springtime the cost of this fabric goes up and he prefers to buy it when its price is low. Señor Henry seeks a loan with the institution at the recommendation of a long-time, responsible client.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Letesia

texts.en:
Letesia is from the village of Cawayan, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old. Letesia is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Letesia operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling cauliflower and broccoli in the local community. Letesia has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Letesia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letesia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional cauliflower and broccoli. This loan will be the first taken out by Letesia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional cauliflower and broccoli.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 61-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two children. He has owned a vegetable and fruit shop since 1995. Because of his older age, he hired a full-time employee to help him with the work. His story illustrates the day-to-day challenges many people are facing in trying to take care of household, health-related, and all other family expenses and at the same time run a business. 
Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his business and increase his purchases of fruit and vegetables. In the future, he is planning to open a juice shop.

loans.use: to improve his business and increase his inventory of fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
