Hamida is a married woman with two children; one attends school, while one is still too young for school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and transport expenses. 

She has operated a clothes-selling business for the past five years, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She also sells window curtains, which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase cloth materials for making window curtains for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials for making window curtains for sale.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La Señora Francisca tiene 61 años. Hace más de 26 años que se dedica  a venta y elaboración de atoles. Ella siempre ha buscado la forma de ganarse el alimento diario. Es una Señora con espíritu emprendedor y cada uno de sus clientes disfruta del buen humor de Francisca. En negocio lo inicio desde joven, ya que anteriormente su mama se hacía cargo de la actividad, fue con el paso del tiempo que le enseño a Francisca para que ella pudiera obtener un trabajo, fue así que ella salió adelante. El motivo del crédito es para la compra leche, queso, arroz, vasos plásticos, cucharas y tasas.  El mayor sueño que ella tiene es satisfacer la demanda de cada uno de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Francisca is 61 years old. For more than 26 years, she has been preparing and selling “atol” (a hot beverage made from corn). She is always looking for ways to provide for her daily needs. Sra. Francisca has an enterprising spirit and each of her customers enjoys her good humor. She started working as a young woman since her mother previously was in charge of the business. As time passed, Francisca’s mother was able to teach her until she was ready to take over the business and move forward.

She is requesting this loan so that she can buy milk, cheese, rice, plastic cups, spoons, and bowls. Her greatest wish is to satisfy the demand of each of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase milk, cheese, rice, plastic cups, spoons, and bowls.

loans.name: Nsindika Njake Women's Group

texts.en:
Retailing was his business of choice 4 years ago. Before this business took root, however, Champkin was mostly inclined to farm. The happily married father of 5 still does farming, albeit on a much smaller scale now. Farming is not, however, as lucrative in Kayunga as it is in other parts of Uganda (for example, in Western Uganda). It may only be 4 years down the road in his retail trade, but Champkin says he envisages better prospects for his business in the near future. The fact that he is an optimist and a hard worker, in a broad sense, helps his cause a great deal.

Champkin restocks his business with an array of general merchandise retail commodities on a weekly basis. Demand for the commodities he keeps repurchasing is high, yet at times he always runs short of the most basic of commodities like soap and sugar. The fact that his shop is doing great business is a good indicator of a great future in business. His shop appeals to most rank-and-file people in his village.

This is the third time that Champkin's group is taking a loan from Pearl microfinance and their track record in repaying their loans, despite some setbacks, has been up to the mark. Weekly, this business's sales returns total up to 150,000 shillings.

Champkin says he is requesting this Kiva loan to purchase more retail commodities such as sugar, salt, toothpaste, cooking oil, maize flour, beans, rice, plastic cups, etc. to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities such as sugar, salt, toothpaste, cooking oil, maize flour, beans, rice, plastic cups, etc. to resell

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 30-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four school-aged children. In 2000, she started running her business; she owns a female beauty salon. She provides her customers with the top hairdressing services. She is very talented and knows how to satisfy women's demand. Her income is important to help with her household expenses and to pay her children’s school fees. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new hairdressing equipment and supplies. In the future, she hopes to further expand her business by adding new beauty services in her salon.

loans.use: to purchase new hairdressing equipment and supplies.

loans.name: C4916 Abanyamurava Group

texts.en:
Christophe is 54 years old and is married with four children aged between 3 and 25 years old. He is also the leader of this group which is called "ABANYAMURAVA". The group contains six men. 

Christophe employs three people to help him and he has five years of experience. His business is open from 6am to 9pm every day.

Christophe and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses. Once their businesses are expanded, they hope to satisfy their customers and earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as sugar, cooking oil, soap, etc. for sale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a businesswoman running a grocery store in the city of Hato Mayor. This is a rural area where agricultural activities are common. She has had her business for around 4 years, this will be her 8th loan with Esperanza Internacional. After successfully repaying her previous loans, she is able to receive another one and will invest it all in her business.

She is dedicated to selling groceries, candies, snacks, and meal ingredients (rice, beans, meat, canned food, and vegetables) as well as many other goods in her little Colmado (small grocery store in the neighborhood). Rosa will use this loan to expand her business inventory by purchasing all these goods. 

Rosa lives with her long-term partner and her child. She said her most difficult challenge is to take care of her family. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, canned food, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Julia Emperatriz

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, departamento de León, la Señora Julia Emperatriz se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora debido a que ha sabido llevar el bienestar a su casa y ha logrado mantener a su familia que tanto ama y aprecia en mejores condiciones. Ella se caracteriza por ser una excelente trabajadora y con buenos valores morales ha hecho que se gane el aprecio de muchas personas de su municipio. 
Actual mente se presentó a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, para ello está solicitando el crédito, para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como hierro y perlines ya que esto le permitirá mejorar el techo de su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia Emperatriz M. M. is notable in the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón, León Department, for being a very hardworking person who has known how to provide wellbeing for her home and managed to keep her family that she so loves and is fond of in the best possible living conditions.  She is noted for being an excellent worker with high moral standards that have led to her being held in high regard by many people in her town.

She came by Ceprodel-El Sauce to request a home improvement loan.  This is the reason she’s asking for the loan: to buy building materials and supplies like: iron rods and purlines to start repairing the roof on her house.

loans.use: to buy iron rods, purlines and sand.

loans.name: Nzai

texts.en:
Nzai is a married man with eight children: six boys and two girls, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past 10 years, he has operated a butcher shop, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He faces the major challenge of his products spoiling,  leading to losses. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the KSHS 10,000, he wants to purchase six goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase six goats for resale.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée mère d'une fille et d'un garçon.Depuis 2002, elle fait du commerce de produits ménagers ainsi que des chaussures et des sacs.ses revenus sont essentiellement destinés à ses besoins personnels et à l'entretien de ses deux enfants.Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000f pour acheter 10 sacs, 20 assiettes et 15 pairs de chaussures.Son ambition est d'ouvrir un grand magasin au bord de la route nationale numéro 1 qui traverse sa localité.
texts.en: This borrower is married and is the mother of one girl and one boy.  Since 2002, she has been in the business of selling household products along with shoes and bags.  Her income goes mostly toward personal needs and caring for her two children.  She is requesting a loan of 150,000f  to buy 10 bags, 20 plates, and 15 pairs of shoes.  Her goal is to open a large store on the national highway 1 which runs through her town.

loans.use: tu buy 10 bags, 20 plates and 15 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 45 years old. She supports five children who are all going to school. She has a tailoring shop. She has been in the business for the past four years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 5,000.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan amount to buy spools of fabric for her business and also to pay school fees. 

The anticipated profits will help her pay school fees for her children. Her hope is to have a large tailoring shop that can help her support her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase spools of fabric and pay school fees

loans.name: Sector Los Olivos (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Sector los Olivos está formado por nueve socias y un socio quienes son personas trabajadoras, amables y solidarias ya que en el banco comunal se apoyan mutuamente para salir adelante, trabajan en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten apoyar económicamente a sus familias. Viven por una comunidad que pertenece a la parroquia Turi de Cuenca, este lugar es considerado el balcón de la ciudad ya que desde allí se observa gran parte de la ciudad. Su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, son personas que mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Elvia, este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su sobrina. Tiene 37 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 16, 14, 9 y 7 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en el colegio y los dos últimos en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es un profesional en la mecánica y laborando en su taller propio.

Doña Elvia se dedica a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas y también cría animales pequeños como conejos, cuyes y chanchos a los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.
 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de conejos, cuyes, chanchos y en alimento para animales.

Su meta es  criar más animales para la venta.
texts.en:
In Los Olivos Community Bank there are ten members, nine of them women, and one man. They are hardworking people, friendly and committed to helping each other get ahead. They have a variety of ways of earning a living so as to support their families financially. Their community is part of Cuenca’s Turi parish and has a view over a large part of the city. The local people have businesses, raise animals, or are famers. They are people who maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Sra Elvia is one of the members of this group. This is her first loan with the community bank; she was invited to join by her niece. Elvia is 37 years old, married, and has four children aged 16, 14, 9, and 7. The two oldest attend high school, and the two youngest go to a school in the city. Elvia’s husband is a trained mechanic and has his own workshop.

Elvia grows vegetables and also raises young animals such as rabbits, guinea pigs, and pigs which she sells whenever the family needs some money.

The loan will be used to buy rabbits, guinea pigs, pigs and food for them. Elvia’s goal is to raise more animals to sell.

loans.use: to buy rabbits, guinea pigs, pigs, and animal feed

loans.name: Furaha B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Furaha B Group in Western Kenya! Protus is the facilitator of the Furaha B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Protus takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Protus had a very good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Protus was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Protus and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Protus will educate his children and invest in livestock.

In 2012, the members of Furaha B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

He is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: la señora Mónica se dedica a la venta de comida, es hermana de una cliente antigua de la agencia, su hermana es muy puntual y responsable, la señora Mónica siempre fue garante pero ahora se decidió a sacar un crédito, la señora Mónica se dedica a la venta de comida en un anaquel hace ya varios años, su puesto esta ubicado en la zona Tejada Sorsano, su puesto esta alquilado y la señora quiere agarrar el puesto en anticrético por este motivo solicito el crédito para el anticrético de su puesto de venta, su deseo es poder algún día comprarse ese puesto de venta,  la señora tiene una hija que tiene 17 años ella esta estudiando en colegio, la señora esta actualmente separada, sola saca adelante a su hija y se siente feliz por la oportunidad que se le brindo en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Mónica sells food.  She’s the sister of a longstanding agency client; her sister is very punctual and responsible.

Mónica had always acted as loan guarantor but now wants to take out a loan.  She has sold food in a stand for several years now.  Her stand is located in the Tejada Sorsano zone and she rents it.  She now wants to acquire the stand through the ‘anticrético’ modality [a transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you] and this is why she’s requesting the loan.  Her wish is to someday be able to buy the stand.

She has a 17-year-old daughter going to high school and she is currently separated.  She raises her daughter by herself and feels happy for the opportunity she’s been given through the granted loan.

loans.use: to pay rental contract for her stand.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Саломат жительница района Хамадони. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Двое ее сыновей уехали на заработки в Россию. Сама она имеет среднее образование. Уже два года как она занимается выращиванием овощей. Целью получения кредита является приобретение топлива для вспашки земли с помощью трактора.
texts.en: Salomat is a resident of the Hamadoni region. She is 47 years old, married with five children. Two of her sons left to work in Russia. She herself has a secondary education. For two years already she has been growing vegetables. The purpose of her loan is to procure fuel to till the land with a tractor.

loans.use: purchase fuel

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina de 30 años de edad vive en el barrio Los Ángeles de la ciudad de Barranquilla, allí ofrece los servicios de telecomunicaciones a través de llamadas a celulares. Desde el año 2001 comenzó esta actividad con dos planes a celulares a nombre de su madre, quien la apoya en el sostenimiento de sus dos hijos, por quienes Catalina trabaja fuertemente para hacer de ellos unas personas exitosas y poder brindarles cada día más un mayor bienestar. En la actualidad posee 5 planes de celulares, su deseo de crecimiento es muy significativo, y desea tener una carpa, para mejorar la imagen de su negocio, pues en la actualidad cuenta con un parasol  ya deteriorado, que no la protege a ella y a sus clientes de la lluvia. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a asu credkiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Su meta, más adelante es adecuar un café internet donde amplié su oferta de servicios, en un local bien ubicado en una avenida transitable
texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Catalina lives in the Los Angeles neighborhood of the city of Barranquilla, where she offers telecommunication services via cell phone calls. She began this activity in 2001 with two cell phone plans in her mother’s name. Catalina’s mother helps her support her two children. Catalina works hard for her children, to help them grow into successful adults and to continually improve her ability to provide for their well-being. 

She currently has five cell phone plans, and she has a great desire to grow her business. She would like to have an awning to improve its image; at the moment she has a shade that is worn out and does not protect her and her customers from the rain. This is why she is requesting a Kiva loan, her first one with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Her goal for the future is to establish an Internet café where she can expand her service offerings in a good location on a well-trafficked street.

loans.use: to buy a new awning.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 27 years old, a single woman with three children. All of them are in school. She has had a business selling bread in Yambio, South Sudan for three years.

Lucia is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bread for sale.

loans.name: Mayshell

texts.en:
Mayshell is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She is 21 years old and married. Mayshell primarily grows rice crops to sell. She does her best to keep her farm productive.

Mayshell has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and tractor spare parts and to pay for labor. Mayshell hopes for her income to improve so she could save more.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and tractor spare parts and pay for labor

loans.name: Chuchi

texts.en:
Chuchi is 46 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Chuchi works very hard to provide for her family.
Chuchi runs a variety store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, detergent and other groceries. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy more items to sell and for repairs to her variety store.
In the future, Chuchi would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell and for repairs to her variety store.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 6 children. 

Fatima has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages.  She has had this business for 5 years.  She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Fatima has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Fatima hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Shirmoh

texts.en:
Shirmoh is a cheerful woman. She was born in 1964, and she is living in a remote district. She is married with two children. She is a hardworking, bright and kind woman.

For about ten years Shirmoh has been a seller in their central market selling rice. She is an experienced person in this field of business. She has a great number of satisfied client and is well known among sellers. She wants to be useful and help her husband with finance. 

Shirmoh needs the financial support of 1,000 for family expenditures to buy consumer goods. Shirmoh awaits Kiva project mercy.

loans.use: To spend for family expenditures to buy cunsumer goods

loans.name: Mosoc Runa Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MOSOC RUNA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la señora Patricia, la socia sigue dedicándose al  negocio de venta de plantas, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua  vendiendo diferentes tipos de plantas para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para  dé esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de plantas entre otros.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo y salud, los socios se comprometen salir todos juntos en la foto para la próxima reunión.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the Mosoc Runa communal bank. The bank is located in Cusco district, Cusco province, and Cusco department.

The borrower is Patricia, she continues working in her plant business. The borrower has had this business for a good while, which is going well for her thanks to the dedication that she puts each day into her business. The borrower continues selling different types of plants for all the customers who ask for them. The borrower wants to be able to continue working so that in this way to continue supporting her family.

The borrower asks for the loan to purchase plants and more.

The borrowers who are in the attached photos asked permission to arrive late to the reason due to work and health. The borrowers promise to all be in the same photo at the next meeting.

loans.use: to purchase plants and more.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah is a single woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a farm where she grows tea and also keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a productive place and her primary customers are tea factories. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have increased income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
She is 50 years old widow with 5 children, 2 are in a technical college and the other in High School.

Grace has been in farming for 26 years and this has been the source of income. She has been able to educate her children up to college level. She has 3 hectares of land with coffee trees and 3 Dairy cows which in aggregate brings a net income of USD180 per month. The milk market has improved and there are better terms of payment of dairy products offered by cooperative societies. She wants to replace in phases her dairy cows which on average produce 8 litres of milk per day with a better breed that can produce approximately 18 litres per day. Once this project is fully implemented she will increase her earnings more than double.

loans.use: She would like to buy an improved breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en:
Zakir is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin. He is 46 and has one child. He works as the chauffeur. He works in public transport. He began his business 26 years ago, since he was 20 years old.  This minibus allows him to support his family. His minibus is old. Therefore he plans to sell it and to buy a new minibus.
Zakir applies for a loan amount of $1000 to buy a new minibus.

loans.use: To sell his old car and to buy a new minibus

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is a single mom who supports herself and her 18-year-old daughter with a small business selling women’s denim clothing. She has been in business for 10 years and has gained much experience as an entrepreneur and as a sales person. One of the things she enjoys the most about her business is the opportunity to help her customers look their best. She tries to have a variety of clothing on hand so that she is able to offer a range of choices and meet each customer’s needs.

Financial support from Nadiya Ukraine has been instrumental in the success of Olga’s business. She has been able to take out several loans and has established herself as one of the best clients with our loan office in Melitopol. Olga’s goal is to continue to learn and improve her business.

She has requested a loan for $1200 so that she can purchase some additional inventory. Springtime is a very busy season for many market vendors in Ukraine. This loan will enable Olga to be prepared for increased demand and earn some additional income that will help herself and her family.

Ольга самостійно виховує 18-річну доньку. В неї є невеличкий бізнес з продажу джинсового одягу для жінок. Вона займається цим бізнесом вже 10 років, за цей час набула багатого досвіду в підприємницькій діяльності та торгівлі. Ольга отримує неабияке задоволення від роботи, вона завжди намагається допомогти своїм покупцям виглядати на всі сто. В неї можна знайти широкий вибір одягу, який задовольнить найвибагливіший смак. Фінансова допомога від „Надії України” сприяла успіху бізнесу Ольги. Вона сплатила усі позики, які отримала в нашій організації, зарекомендувала себе як одна за найкращих клієнток офісу м. Мелітополь. Ольга хоче й надалі вчитися та розвивати власний бізнес. Вона просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб закупити додатковий товар. Навесні на ринках багато покупців, а, отже, це дуже напружений час для багатьох підприємців. Позика допоможе Ользі придбати достатньо товару для того, щоб задовольнити зростаючий попит та отримати додатковий прибуток, який дасть їй можливість забезпечити рідних усім необхідним.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy another motorbicycle

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Señora Francisca is 23 years old. She is married to Augusto Barrios. They have a 7 year-old daughter. Augusto has his own mechanic shop.

She weaves/sews blankets and hammocks since she was very young. She used to help her mother. Francisca was very young when she got married. She was only 16 years old when she met her life companion. They lived with her mother not so long ago, but now with their hard work, they live in their own house which they built on their own. They moved to their new home about 8 months ago. They only have a few things they need to do to finish the house. Francisca has always been motivated to move ahead in life and she sees no obstacles. In her free time, she does manicures to the ladies in the barrio, since she is well-known for that as well.

She sells her products in the stores located in the city. Her business is part of the many business that form Microempresas Mujeres en Desarrollo (Mini businesses Helping Women).There are a total of 15 women. They work together and save 10% of their sales. She is requesting a loan to purchase mutl-color threads.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Francisca tiene 23 años, está casada con Augusto Barrios, con quién tiene una hija de 7 años; el señor trabaja de forma independiente como chapista de automóviles en su propio taller. Ella teje frazadas y hamacas desde joven, ya que ayudaba a su madre que también era artesana y realizaba este tipo de tejido. Francisca se casó muy joven, solo tenía 16 años de edad cuando encontró al compañero de su vida y contrajeron matrimonio. Hasta hace poco vivían con su mamá, y ahora gracias al esfuerzo de ambos lograron construir su propia casa, hace 8 meses se mudaron allí y ahora su deseo es terminar los últimos detalles de la casa. Francisca siempre ha buscado progresar y para ella no hay obstáculos, en sus ratos libres también hace trabajos de manicura a las señoras del barrio; ya que también es conocida por esta actividad. Sus productos los vende a las tiendas ubicadas en el centro de la ciudad. Su negocio forma parte del grupo de microempresas Mujeres en Desarrollo, conformada por 15 mujeres, trabajan todas juntas, y generan un ahorro del 10% de sus cuotas, la responsabilidad del crédito es solidario. Hoy, ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos de algodón de diferentes colores.

loans.use: To purchase mutl-color thread

loans.name: Monsa

texts.en:
Monsa, 44-year-old mother of three children, is a very hard-working and dynamic person. Three years ago, Monsa opened a bar where only beer was sold. She offers the principal and best Dominican beers like Presidente, Bohemia and also Brahma (made by a Brasilian company that is producing beer in this country).

Currently, Monsa doesn´t have a refrigerator to keep the drinks cold, so she is obliged to purchase many ice packs every day, in order to serve iced beverages to her customers. To remedy that uncomfortable situation, the entrepreneur is requesting a loan to buy a used refrigerator, so that she can handily satisfy her clientele´s needs.

loans.use: To purchase a used refrigerator in order to keep drinks cold and satisfy her customers´ needs

loans.name: Merita

texts.es:
Merita belongs to the "Luz y Paz" community bank, located in the district of Manatay, province of Ucayali. She is 42 years old and the mother of 3. Her husband works transporting merchandise to Lima, but his income is not enough to cover household expenses. With Merita´s first loan from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, she put up a small stand to sell shoes.

Currently, with her husband´s support, she sells mens and childrens shoes to the area's construction workers, motocar drivers and young people.

With her next loan from Manuel Ramos which will be paid back in 4 months, she will expand her business premises and buy 100 pairs of mens shoes, 40 pairs of childrens shoes and 20 pairs of slippers.

Merita is very happy to work with her husband and to be able to educate her childen so they can all get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Merita pertenece al Banco Comunal Luz y Paz, del Jr. Francia 370 del A. H. Antunez de Mayolo del Distrito de Manantay del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo se dedica a traer mercadería de Lima, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos del hogar, es así que Merita, con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300.00 soles decide poner un puesto de venta de zapatos (calzado).

En la actualidad, se dedica a la venta de calzado para caballeros y niños, los mismos que vende a obreros de construcción civil, motocarristas y jóvenes de la zona. La señora Merita cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos el cual será pagado en 4 meses, ampliará el local del negocio y comprará 100 pares de zapatos para caballeros, 40 pares de zapatos para niños y 20 pares de zapatillas.

Merita está muy contenta de trabajar junto a su esposo y así educar a sus hijos y salir adelante juntos.

loans.use: Purchase of footwear.  Expansion of business premises.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Selling vegetables in the city of Leon is a very important business for the simple reason that every household needs them. Cristina, having 20 years in the vegetable-selling business in Leon started with C$500 that she saved over a long period of time with the idea of investing in this business. She started selling in the Estacion market with small stocks of vegetables before going on to grow, little by little, until she had her own market stall there.

Now she owns a stall with a zinc ceiling, enclosed with mesh, and is one of the largest sellers, all because she decided to invest in her business. It should be noted, too, that Mrs. F. is a single mother with 2 school-age children for whom she struggles to provide a better quality of life and the chance to have professional careers.

Ceprodel has provided Cristina with important financial help for three years with 34 loans, all repaid on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La venta de verduras en la ciudad de León es un negocio muy importante por la sencilla razón de que en cada hogar se consumen estos productos. La señora Cristina teniendo 20 años de tener un negocio de verduras en León inició con un capital de C$500.00 que fueron ahorrados por largo tiempo con la idea de invertir en este negocio. Ella inicia vendiendo en el mercado de la Estación con poca cantidad de verduras hasta ir incrementando poco a poco sus productos hasta conseguir un puesto fijo en el mercado.

Hoy en día posee un puesto fijo con techo de zinc y cerrado con malla, siendo una de las mejores vendedoras por haber decidido invertir en su negocio. Es necesario señalar que la señora F. es madre soltera que tiene 2 hijos estudiando en la secundaria por quienes lucha para brindarles un mejor nivel de vida y así puedan profesionalizarse.

Ceprodel le ha brindado un gran apoyo financieramente desde hace tres años con 34 créditos otorgados y pagados en tiempo y forma por lo que hoy en día esta contemplando un avance en el negocio de las verduras.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Kawaala Cb(A) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Margret is 50 years old and married with 4 children. She sells and distributes water to earn a living. With the extra business profits, she intends to pay school fees for the children. Milly has a beauty salon and wants to use the loan to buy more salon equipment. Jennifer offers tailoring services while Hadija sells used clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a plastic water tank

loans.name: Zainabu Maelwano Group

texts.en:
Zainabu A., age 32, is married and has 2 children (ages 11 and 2). She has a salon, which she began 2 years ago. She works from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM daily, and she has been able to make a monthly profit of about US$44.

Zainabu has taken out 2 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her capital. She hopes for a new loan to buy a dryer. Zainabu will share this loan with her subgroup members, who deal in selling food and running shops.

In the picture Zainabu is second from the left.

loans.use: To buy a dryer

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru:
Zafar Sulaymonov lives in the region Rudaki in the village Teppa. He is 38 years old, is married, and has 3 children. He has a Bachelor's Degree and works as a teacher in the middle school in Rudaki. Apart from working in school, he owns a business where he sells food products. He has his own store near his home. He imports the inventory from Dushanbe and resells it in his store. This business helps Zafar to maintain his family. Moreover, this business helps local residents who can purchase the needed goods without going to the city and spending additional time. Zafar is asking for a loan to increase his inventory. After purchasing additional goods, he will be able to attract more customers and provide local residents with needed products. He is planning to pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Сулаймонов Зафар проживает в районе Рудаки в поселке Теппа . Ему 38 лет , он женат и имеет 3 детей. Образование высшее. По профессии учитель средней школы. Работает в школе _ учителем, района Рудаки. Кроме работы в школе , Зафар зарабатывает на жизнь путем торговли продуктами питания . Имеет небольшой магазинчик рядом с домом. Привозит товар из города Душанбе , покупая у оптовых продавцов и продает у себя в магазине. Этот бизнес помогает обеспечить семью необходимым доходом. Кроме того товар продаваемый им в его магазине, товары первой необходимости помогают населению покупают продукты, не выезжая из района, не тратя на дорогу денег и не тратя время. Но клиент не хватает денег , для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Поэтому он обратился к нам за помощью. Увеличив ассортимент товара клиент сможет привлечь новых клиентов, а так же обеспечить население продуктами первой необходимости. Погасить кредит клиент сможет в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the inventory

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah N. is a hairdresser. She is a single parent of 3 children. Her income is not sufficient to meet the needs of her family. She wants to improve her services to attract more customers, but she lacks adequate capital.

She is asking for $325 as additional capital to buy hairdressing materials for her salon.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy hairdressing materials for her salon

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Đào Thị Sáu, 47 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2001. In the last 7 years she has been through many business avenues. Sometimes, she has more than one at the time but her main activity still remains livestock. The income is 200USD monthly in average. Her husband, a construction worker, helps her to pay the weekly repayments. The total amount of loans, up to today, is 2000USD. All is paid off. She raises her two children well. They both attend college now. This time she is applying for a loan of 625USD to buy some cattle.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Đào Thị Sáu, 47 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2001. Trong 7 năm qua chị đã làm rất nhiều việc như chăn nuôi, trồng trọt và làm một số nghề phụ khác để có thêm nguồn thu nhập cho gia đình. Tuy nhiên công việc chính của chị vẫn là chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng từ hoạt động này khoảng 200USD. Chồng chị lại đi xây hỗ trợ cho vợ trong việc hoàn trả tuần nên việc tham gia Quỹ của chị rất thuận lợi. Tính đến nay chị Sáu đã vay từ Quỹ số vốn là 2000USD. Nhờ đồng vốn vay và sự chịu khó của mình, chị Sáu đã có tiền cho con ăn học chu đáo. Hiện nay 2 con chị đều đang học đại học và cao đẳng. Vòng vốn này chị Sáu xin vay 625USD mua trâu bò về chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Buy cattle

loans.name: Shirin

texts.ru:
Shirin T. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 48 years old, is married and has 4 children. Shirin has a high school education. She purchases and resells footwear and has a sales location at the market. Shirin has 15 years of experience in this business and her business allows her to support her family. Shirin’s husband is a construction worker and his job is seasonal and temporary.

Shirin will use this loan to purchase footwear from wholesale suppliers. She has applied for a 12 month loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Тагирова Ширин жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 48 лет, замужем , имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Ширин занимается куплей продажей обуви. Она имеет торговую точку на рынке.Имеет опыт в бизнесе 15 лет.Торговля позволяет ей содержать свою семью.Муж клиентки работает строителем,работа сезонная непостоянная. Сейчас Ширин хочет закупить летнюю обувь у оптовых поставщиков.Для чего ей нужны деньги ,поэтому она решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal footwear

loans.name: Zulpha

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Zulpha S.. She is married and In 2000, Zulpha established her grocery business. Zulpha requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, beans, and vegetables. In the future, Zulpha plans to increase the quantity and range of her inventory. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of beans, rice, and vegetables

loans.name: Rita Beatriz

texts.es:
When she was very young, Rita learned to make hammocks, and now that it is necessary to help her husband with the expenses of raising their three children, she makes and sells the same. Her business provides them with a good income, as they sell them not only in their village, but also in other nearby towns.

She needs a loan of US$250, which she will repay in 3 months, to buy thread to make the hammocks, and to bring them to sell at the town market.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Desde muy pequeña la señora Rita aprendió a elaborar hamacas, ahora con el tiempo ante la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de sus 3 hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de las mismas, negocio que le deja muy buenas ganancias, ya que no solo en su pueblo las vende, si no que las lleva a otras poblaciones cercanas.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar hilos para elaborar mas hamacas, y llevarlas a vender a la feria del pueblo.

loans.use: To purchase thread

loans.name: Oria S.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 50-year-old Oria S..  She is not married and has no children. In 2005, Oria began selling cosmetics. She opens her business 7 days a week, 9-12 hours a day. Oria requires a loan to buy more inventory. She thanks you for your support.  

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment Ð a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics inventory

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth has been seling kanga and vitenge in her shop in Dodoma, Tanzania for 10 years. She is hoping to use her first loan to buy greater quantities of the two local fabrics so that she may sell more and increase her profit. Kanga and vitenge are large pieces of fabric in bright colors that contain an elaborate pattern and often have a local adage printed in Swahili. They are used for everything from clothing to table cloths to baby-carriers.

Ruth is 46 years old, married, and has 7 children, including two sets of twins. She also cares for two additional dependents. She currently earns approximately $85 per month and works for 12 hours every day. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Saada, Zabibu, Zubeda, and Fatuma.

loans.use: To buy more local fabrics for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en: Mrs. Sumitra T. lives in Sainbu Bhashipati with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Raju T., is a land broker. Both sons are now in primary school. Mrs. Sumitra T. opened her vegetable shop two years ago. She specializes in potatoes, onions, and green vegetables of her own farm. Mrs. Sumitra T. requests a loand of $200 to buy different types of vegetables for her shop.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Dy, 53, is a widow with two daughters, one married and living outside the family home and the other a weaver. The family lives on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

A silk weaver since 1979, a skill she learned from her mother, C. sells her finished products to the middleman who then sells them in Phnom Penh. She is now requesting a loan of $600 to purchase more silk material to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Chign

texts.en:
Chign C. is 23 years old and has one young lovely child. The family lives in Siem Reap Province. She currently grows vegetables for sale, and her husband is a photographer for wedding parties and other ceremonies. She has taken a loan four times with KHL and now, this is the second time with Kiva's loans.

She repaid her first loan from Kiva on time, which was used for her husband's business. With doing business well, her husband can earn the money to support the family's expenses adequately. With her first loan paid off, and to improve her husband's business a little more, Chign C. would like to apply for a second loan of $200 for her husband to purchase a new camera to replace his existing old one.

loans.use: To purchase a new camera

loans.name: Munisakhon

texts.en:
Munisakhon is a very shy woman, but also very hardworking as a farmer and as a mother of 4 young children. She and her husband cultivate potatoes and corn. At the same time they are engaged in raising cattle. What they urgently need right now are fertilizers and other chemicals for the care of their crops so that they can produce a product that is in line with the demands of the market. She needs your help to buy the fertilizers, which are the most expensive and most necessary inputs for the cultivation of her crops. Her goal is to achieve better profits and benefits in the market. Munisakhon doesn’t just need good land; she also needs a friendly hand to help her out.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Lucia Lidia

texts.es: El señora Lidia se dedica a la venta de desayunos (Té, café, café con leche y sándwiches de toda clase) en un mercado de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja arduamente desde la 06:00 de la mañana hasta las 16:00 de la tarde, vive en la ciudad de El Alto en la casa de su suegros, tiene 4 hijos que están en edad escolar con los que tiene que salir de su casa a esa hora, tiene un niño de 3 años que tiene problemas de en la vista, no cuenta con la ayuda del esposo el cual le maltrataba físicamente y desde hace unos años se separó, es por eso que  trabaja sola para mantener a su familia, el niño de 14 años que es el mayor le ayuda trabajando en una tienda con una señora en la misma zona. La señora es muy cumplida con sus cuotas trabaja con nosotros desde el 2007.
texts.en:
Lidia sells breakfasts (tea, coffee, café con leche [coffee with scalded milk] and all sorts of sandwiches) at a market in La Paz. She works very hard from 6:00 A.M. to 4:00 P.M.. She lives in El Alto in her in-laws home. She has four school-aged children with whom she must leave the house in the early hours every morning. One of her children, her three-year-old son, has vision problems. She cannot count on her husband's help: he abused her physically and they separated a number of years ago. Because of this, she is the sole support for her family. Her eldest child, her 14-year-old son, helps her by working in a store with a woman in the same neighbourhood. Lidia has always been punctual with her repayments; she has been working with us since 2007.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Tem

texts.en: Tem Y., 45, is married and lives with her husband in the Siem Reap province. She works in a grocery store, making about US$5 per day. Her husband is a village chief and earns US$20 per month. This couple has six children; three are in school and one is a construction worker. Tem Y. is asking for a loan to add more products to her grocery store to meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: El Señor José Francisco M. P. tiene la edad de 41 años, su estado civil es casado. La actividad económica de Don José es la venta de pan. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues Don Jose inicio este negocio por mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y así empezó a vender el pan de manera ambulante. El propósito de Don Francisco para su negocio es de mantener este negocio por lo que es el único medio de ingreso que obtiene. Y es así como decide realizar un financiamiento por medio de Fundación León 2000 para que sea utilizado en capital de trabajo y proporcionarles mejoras a su vehiculo ya que este es el que utiliza para realizar la venta de pan. Los deseos de Don Francisco son de obtener un local para vender sus productos. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 4.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
José Francisco M. P. is 41 years old and married. He has been in the business of selling bread for more than 15 years. José started the business in order to improve his family's quality of life and in the beginning he was a traveling salesman. He hopes to keep this business, as it is his only source of income, and so he decided to obtain financing from the León 2000 Foundation in order to have working capital and make improvements to the vehicle he uses to sell bread. José's wish is to acquire a shop where he can sell his products. He is requesting 4,000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth P. is managing a small parcel of land as a rice farm. She is 38 years old and has four children. She also raises hogs which she thinks has supplemented their income. Rice and pigs are their only source of income to feed and clothe her family well. She started her rice farm four years ago. Until now, she still has her farm growing an abundant harvest.

She is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer. She will also use some of the loan to buy ducklings and start a duck business as well. The loan will truly help Elizabeth increase her yield and get her duck farm started.


CEVI is reaching out to more people to help them start and have their own business. CEVI provides every poor family with a chance to have a livelihood. CEVI gives not only credit assistance, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and ducklings

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Beatriz es socia del Banco Manuela Ramos  del Distrito de Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 3 hijos, vive en el Jr. José Antonio Chambilla y cuenta con estudios superiores de técnica de enfermería incompleta.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramis desde hace 5 años e inició su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió comprar zapatillas.
En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de 2000.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá comprar zapatillas por docenas y así poder agrandar su negocio.
Su mayor deseo es poner un bazar o su propia fábrica de zapatillas.
texts.en:
Señora Beatriz is a member of the Manuela Ramos Bank in the Mazocruz District, Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 29 years old, married and has three children. She lives on José Antonio Chambilla Avenue and has some upper level education in nursing but has not finished. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last five years and she started out with a loan for 300 New Sols with which she was able to buy sneakers. Currently she requires a new loan which she is requesting in the amount of 2,000 New Sols. This will allow her to buy sneakers by the dozen and thus be able to build up her business. Her greatest desire is to have a store or her own shoe factory.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy footwear

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Kosar baji is the wife of Mr. Z.. They have been living in Yadgar, a historical place near the city of Lahore, Pakistan, for ten years. Kosar baji and her husband run a cloth selling business. He sells clothing in different shops and Kosar baji sells them in the community. Both earn a good income from this business. They buy clothes from their native city of Lahore. They have had their business for five years.

Kosar baji is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Mrs. Fe B. has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since April 24, 2009. She is 47 years old, married and blessed with three children who are in school.  She is a bonafide resident of Barangay Del Pilar, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She's also a Barangay Councilor in their Barangay. Currently, she's requesting her loan in the amount of 30,000.00 for the purpose of educational expenses for her son. She wishes that her son will finish school and find a decent and stable job someday.

loans.use: For educational expenses for her son

loans.name: Bassem

texts.en:
Bassem is a 45-year-old man who lives with his wife and their child in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon.

Bassem has owned a dry cleaning shop for twelve years. He has requested a loan of $700 from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance on his machines. This is his third loan and he has always repaid on time.

Bassem decided on his business because he wanted to have independent work. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To do some maintenance on his machines

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora  Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Totoritas”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Chimu, el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 39 años de edad, estado civil casada, y es madre de 3 hijos.  Tiene estudios de primaria completa, vive en La Comunidad de Chimu Central.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi 7 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con el cual compró materiales para la elaboración de artesanías. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de material (quesana y chillihua), para la fabricación de quesanas, para vender el las ferias regionales.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando y poder educar a sus hijos y verlos profesionales.
A ella le gustan las facilidades de los préstamos
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa belongs to the community bank "Las Totoritas", located in the town of Chimu, in the district of Puno, in the province of Puno, in the region of Puno. She is 39 years old, married, and is the mother of 3 children. She was educated through 6th grade, and lives in the central part of town. Mrs. Rosa has worked for the Operations of Manuela Ramos for almost 7 years. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to buy raw materials for her handicrafts. She is currently seeking a loan of 3000 soles for the purchase of raw materials for the production of quesanas, which she sells at regional fairs. Her wish is to continue working and to be able to provide her children with an education and to see them become professionals someday. She greatly appreciates the resources provided by these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy responsable, vive con el padre de sus 6 hijos, de los cuales, los 2 mayores viven en Lima y los menores vive en junto a ella en su casa propia (de la que aun no cuenta con su titulo de propiedad). Su siembra mayoritaria es la papa, por ser muy rentable, pero también muy costosa, debido a la inversión de fertilizantes químicos, por ello le dedica todo su tiempo. Cuando está en sus chacras primero contempla minuciosamente sus plantas con la finalidad de detectar los males que pudieran acechar a sus cultivos y de ese modo tratar de contrarrestar en su debido momento con los funguicidas. Sus productos los comercializa en el mercado más grande y concurrido de la ciudad de Tarma denominado “El Mayorista”. La mayoría de sus ventas le han dejado muy buenas ganancias, con las que vienen educando a sus hijos y solventando los gastos familiares. Francisca trabaja armoniosamente con su esposo y eso logra que no sienta cansancio. Ella está muy contenta con MFP, este es su quinto crédito y durante los 4 periodos anteriores demostró ser una cliente muy responsable, asimismo muy entregada a las responsabilidades de su banco comunal, al que le tiene mucho aprecio. El dinero solicitado lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Francisco is 41 years old, is a very responsible woman, and lives with the father of her 6 children, of whom the 2 oldest live in Lima and the younger ones live with her in her own house (for which she doesn’t have the deed). The majority of her harvest is the potato because it is very profitable, but it is also very costly because she has to invest in chemical fertilizers. As a result, it takes up all of her time. When she is in her fields, she first thoroughly considers her plants with the goal of detecting the problems that could affect her crops. She tries to resist the problems by using pesticides. She sells her products in a very large and busy market in the city of Tarma called “The Wholesale” (“El Mayorista”). Most of her sales leave her with very good earnings, with which she educates her children and takes care of the family’s expenses. Francisca works well with her husband and does not get tired of it. She is very happy with MFP; this is her fifth loan and during the 4 previous cycles, she showed that she is a very responsible client. She is also very involved in the responsibilities of her community bank, to which she is very thankful. She plans to invest the money requested in the purchase of chemical fertilizers for her potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en: Lucrecia P., at age 53, is a tireless entrepreneur. Her husband, Leticio, (seen with Lucrecia in the photo), also 53 years old, is a carpenter and also farms root crops. They have six children. Lucrecia and Leticio have no idle time. They make a living from almost anything they touch. While Leticio attends to their cassava plantation, Lucrecia takes care of their hogs until they are ready for slaughter and the meat is sold to their neighbors. Lucrecia also cooks home-made rice cakes and native delicacies which she sells in the streets every day. They earn P25,000 per month from these combined business activities. Lucrecia joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007. She loves the camaraderie of the women entrepreneurs. She is applying for a new loan of P16,000 which she will use to fund her rice cake business. She also plans to buy additional swine and stock-up on feed for the pigs. Lucrecia has been praying for her own stall in the nearby market. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To fund her rice cake business and to buy additional pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 21 year old man who lives in the Bekaa. Husein has been selling used shoes since 2007. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase more used shoes to sell. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 

Husein is special in his work because he has competitive prices and sells good quality used shoes. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business he didn’t face difficulties. Husein decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving this business.

loans.use: To purchase used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Binita

texts.en:
Mrs. Binita S. is a resident of Chetrapati, which is located in Kathmandu district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small business.

Mrs. S. lives with her husband and three children: one son and two daughters. Both of her daughters are studying in grade 5 and her son studies in grade 2.

Mrs. S. opened her cosmetics shop a few years ago to uplift the living standard of her family. In her shop she sells different types of cosmetics such as make-up tools, lipsticks, glass bangles, etc. She uses her earnings to pay household expenses.

Now, Mrs. S. is requesting her first loan of Rs 10,000 to invest in her cosmetics shop.

loans.use: To buy make-up tools for her shop

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es: Deisy es una mujer creativa y emprendedora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali , se dedica a la confección de carteras y manteles, esta actividad lo realiza en su casa. Ella ayuda a sus padres en la economía del hogar. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres con Futuro “ desde hace dos años, El primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles lo cual invirtió en materiales como piedras y adornos para carteras, en la actualidad necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado para comprar telas, hilos para bordar, piedras, etc para confeccionar las carteras. La meta de Deysi es tener una tienda de piñatas y  artículos para cumpleaños.

loans.use: Invertirá su crédito para comprar telas, hilos para bordar, piedras, etc para confeccionar las carteras.

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden is 25-years old and is single. She has no children. Kiden V. is sells charcoal at her home. She is requesting a loan of $200 to expand her business and to earn enough income to begin selling various items like beans, rice, and pulses. Expanding in this way will help her improve her living conditions.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a maize curing machine

loans.name: Firmino Afonso

texts.pt:
Fermino C. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Capital de Moçambique, tem 57 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos de 28, 26, 23, 19, e 15 anos de idade, destes os 3 mais de velhos vão a escola. Fez 1º ano no Instituto Industrial, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família no bairro Luís Cabral e sustenta 2 pessoas, neto e sobrinho que vivem com ele.

Nunca mudou de residência é comerciante dono do seu negócio e trabalha na SEMOC (sementes de Moçambique) como chefe dos recursos humanos a mais de 9 anos. Na empresa onde trabalha tem um salário mensal de 9.750.00mt e no negócio ganha ate 3.000.00mt por semana e poupa algum na sua conta bancária. Vende mais carne, farinha, bebidas secas e outros. 

Já teve empréstimos na cooperativa de créditos TCHUMA e mais tarde conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus colegas tendo decidido solicitar o seu 1º empréstimo. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos para vender (farinha, bebidas, carnes e outros) no seu estabelecimento. O empréstimo anterior foi de 15.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.

Futuramente pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para poder expandir o seu negócio e ainda com perspectiva criar frangos de corte
texts.en:
Fermino C. was born in the city of Maputo, the capital of Mozambique. He is 57; married; and the father of 5 children who are 28, 26, 23, 19, and 15. His 3 oldest children go to school. He studied for one year at the Industrial Institute and didn't continue due to the lack of financial resources. He lives in his own home with his family in the Luís Cabral neighborhood and also supports his grandson and nephew who live with him. He has never moved to another home. He is a merchant and owner of his own business and has also worked at SEMOC (which stands for Seeds of Mozambique) as the head of human resources for 9 years. At the company where he works, he earns a monthly salary of 9,750 meticais and at his business, he earns 3,000 meticais per week. He saves some of it in his bank account. He sells meat, flour, beverages, and other items. He has had loans with another credit organization known as TCHUMA and later became familiar with Hluvuku through his colleagues, so he decided to request his first loan. This is his 2nd loan with Hluvuku. His previous loan was for 15,000 meticais and was used for the same purpose. In the future he hopes to request more loans to be able to expand his business, which he plans to do by raising chickens to butcher.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell drinks, meat, and soft drinks

loans.name: Julife

texts.en:
Julife G. is from the village of Migpange Bonifacio, Misamis Occ. She is 42 years old. Julife is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Julife owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products and selling seafood products like fish and shrimp in the local community. Julife has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Julife joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julife has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Julife is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Julife from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Madiore

texts.en:
Madiore T., 45 years old, is a rice grower. Aside from rice, she also plants vegetables in her farm. She really enjoys farming. She says that her life is really in the farm that she tills. Currently, she is busy preparing the soil. She will plant rice seedlings again.

She will need additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to buy all the farm supplies she needs to grow her crops. The loan will really help in ensuring a quality harvest.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks in bulk

loans.name: Tropical Group

texts.es: El grupo “Tropical” esta representado por el señora EriK Mauricio  y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales van cursando su tercer ciclo demostrando puntualidad, responsabilidad y muchas ganas D. trabajar. Una gran mayoría D. los socios posee negocios comerciales como la venta D. comida, empanadas, abarrotes, ropa y al transporte público D. pasajeros, por ejemplo el presidente se dedica a la elaboración y distracción D. pan el trabaja desD. las tres D. la madrugada debido a que solo tiene un vehiculo repartidor y debe madrugar para elaborar el pan y lograr distribuir a todas las tiendas con las que tienen contratos fijos ya que la mejor forma D. fidelizar con lo clientes es no fallar con el producto el señor Erik Mauricio tiene cuatro hijos pequeños a los cuales deben mantener y es ayudado por su esposa que venD. masitas en la puerta D. la panadería para ayudar a suspendo D. su hogar. En el mercado existe una amplia gama D. panaderos por lo que la competencia es alta pero el presidente indica que nunca falta el pan D. la casa si uno trabaja por salir adelante siempre, el resto D. los socios también tienen mucha competencia pero tratan D. salir adelante con esfuerzo trabajo y gracias  a la experiencia que poseen. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. insumos como por ejemplo en el caso del presidente será destinado a la compra D. Harina y garrafas industriales D. gas para que sea menos pesado el estar cargando y cambiando las garrafas D. gas a cada momento ya que su zona no cuenta con gas domiciliario por tuberías y también para prevenir la escasez D. garrafas; el resto D. los socios desea ampliar mas sus negocios con mas mercadería, insumos y materiales la señora Nilda que se dedica a la venta D. comida insiste en ampliar y modernizar su negocio para que sea mas atractivo para los clientes que la frecuentan, el señora Walter desea chapear la pintura D. sus  vehiculo ya que es su fuente D. ingresos y con los años que tiene su vehículo ya le hace falta una mano D. pintura. Todas las expectativas D. los socios son para agrandar sus negocios y así poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida con esfuerzo y trabajo honesto.
texts.en:
The group "Tropical" is represented by Mrs. Erik Mauricio and maD. up of 12 members, who are in their third loan cycle, demonstrating punctuality, responsibility, and a great desire to work. The great majority of the partners own commercial businesses, in food sales, empanadas, groceries, clothing, and public transportation. For example, the president earns a living by making and distributing bread. He starts working at 3:00 in the morning, since he only has one delivery vehicle and must wake up early to make the bread and manage to distribute it to all of the stores with which he has set contracts. The best way to make your clients loyal is to make sure your products never fail. Mr. Erik Mauricio has four small children whom he must support, and he is helped by his wife, who sells pastries at the entrance of the bakery to help with the domestic expensese. In the market, there exists an ample amount of bakers, therefore the competition is high, but the president states that bread is never lacking at home if one always works hard to get ahead. The rest of the members also have a lot of competition, but they try to get ahead in life with effort, work, and appreciation for the experience that they have. This loan will be used for the purchase of supplies. For example, in the case of the president it will be used for buying flour and industrial gas cylinders, so that it is less difficult to carry and change the cylinders at any moment, since his zone does not have domestic gas through tubing. Also, this will prevent the scarcity of gas cylinders. The rest of the members desire to expand their businesses with more merchandise, supplies, and materials. Mrs. Nilda, who makes a living selling food, insists in expanding and modernizing her business so that it is more attractive for her clients that frequent it. Mrs. Walter wishes to paint her vehicle, since it is her source of income and with the age of her car, a new coat of paint is necessary. All of the expectations of these partners are for expanding their businesses and to therefore give their families a better quality of life, with effort and honest work.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Torn

texts.en:
Mrs. Torn E. and her husband, Mr. Korn Kim, live in a small village along National Road Number 5, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1969 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. Two of their sons are married and live outside the family home, one is a farmer and the other son attends school. Their daughter is a garment factory worker. Torn is not in the photo, her husband was available instead. 

Torn is a farmer; she grows rice on her farmland. Mr. Korn Kim has been a fisherman since 1979. He catches fish in the river near his house and sells the fish in his village. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a rice threshing machine to use when harvesting season comes.

loans.use: To purchase a rice threshing machine.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita comes from Antipolo, Rizal province, in the Philippines. She is a 51-year-old woman, is married, and is the mother of three children. All of her children are finished degree holders. 

Isabelita operates a passenger jeepney (a small bus) and tends a home for rent at the same time. She started these businesses only when ASHI gave her an opportunity to obtain a loan. The businesses are a big help for the family in covering their expenses and to set aside savings for the future.

The couple is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to pay for a general overhaul of the jeepney, permit, and other spare parts for the jeepney. The proceeds of her business give her money to support the immediate and basic needs of her family. 

Isabelita hopes that her business will become successful someday. She still dreams of having a durable and concrete house of her own and to save for her family’s future.

Isabelita wants to thank ASHI and Kiva lenders who are sponsoring this loan. That is one of the greatest opportunities for her to start reaching for her goals.

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To pay for a general overhaul of jeepney, permit, and other spare parts for the jeepney.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph sells electronics to earn a living in Ibadan. He hopes to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of N70,000 to purchase more electronics to sell. He is 42 years old, and married with 3 children. His children are doing well in school. His wife sells electrical materials to support their home. Joseph hopes to lift his business and family above poverty.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell.

loans.name: Flikissilou

texts.en: Flikissilou I. is 35 years-old and married with two children. Mr. I. lives and works in the Agoé district of Lomé, Togo. He sells fabric and cloth used to make clothing. Mr. I. purchases his supply from the Grand Marché in Lomé and then sells his products in a smaller, local market. He began this business in 1999 and is now asking for his first loan from Kiva partner WAGES. He will use this loan to add more stock to his inventory by purchasing 100 new sheets of quality fabric. It is hoped that that this loan will help Mr. I.’s business to flourish.

loans.use: To purchase fabric.

loans.name: Ober

texts.es:
Ober tiene 28 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su pareja Noemí (27) y de sus 2 menores hijos.
Desde muy joven se dedica a la siembra, conoce muy bien las técnicas necesarias para aprovechar las bondades de la naturaleza y lograr que la tierra produzca sin problemas. 
En la actualidad siembra papa, olluco, alverja y habas en sus chacras que son propias, comenta que le gusta mucho la agricultura pues es un trabajo tranquilo, aunque algo arriesgado por los diversos factores – como las plagas y los cambios climáticos - que amenazan constantemente la siembra. La venta de toda su producción la hace a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona, lo cual le genera buenas ganancias que le permiten vivir cómodamente. 
Además de esta actividad, se dedica también a la crianza de ganado vacuno y vende leche a diario a una planta industrial ubicada en su comunidad. Y como es un hombre muy emprendedor, para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad y adquirir algunas cabezas de ganado para aumentar su producción láctea.
