Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Asimismo, está muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su banco comunal, pues todos los integrantes han demostrado ser muy puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas. 

Ober tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono e insecticidas para asegurar sus tierras para las próximas siembras.
texts.en:
Ober, 28, lives in his own house with his partner, Noemí, 27, and their two minor children. He has been a farmer since a very young age; he is very knowledgeable of techniques needed to take advantage of nature’s bounty and get the land to produce problem free. He currently farms potato, olluco (an Andean tuber), peas and broad beans on his own farmlands. He tells us that he enjoys farming quite a bit because it’s peaceful work although it can be troublesome sometimes due to pests and climate changes that constantly threaten the crops. He sells his entire crop to wholesalers in the area which produces sufficient profits for him to live comfortably. In addition to this activity, he also raises cattle and sells the daily milk production to an industrial plant located in his community. As he is an enterprising man, he plans in the future to plant larger amounts and acquire additional heads of cattle to increase milk production. This is his 2nd loan with MFP and he is very grateful with all the people that made the loan, which will allow him to continue working, possible. Also, he is very satisfied with his communal bank’s work because all the members have been very punctual with their payments. Ober will invest the requested funds in the purchase of manure and insecticides to assure his fields for the next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticide.

loans.name: Risper

texts.en: Risper K. N. is 25 years old. Her husband is a teacher and they have one child who is eighteen months old to whom they hope to give a quality education. Risper's business is located in Kakamega town by the the roadside and it is well known by the name 'Ro-Safi Traders'. She sells clothes, cosmetics, shoes and even computer accessories to local people. She has been in this business for the last three years and she says that business is good although she does face a lot of competition. Risper hopes to expand her business and stock other items such as umbrellas and suitcases. She also hopes that her business will grow and provide employment to other people. She says that she is hardworking and never gives up on her goals.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Ayawovi

texts.en: Madame Ayawovi T., 49, has been selling maize and coal out of her home in the Kegue District of Lomé, Togo since 2000.  She and her husband, who is retired, have three children. Madame T. is requesting her first loan with WAGES in the amount of 400,000 CFA to purchase charcoal, maize, and other items to sell.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and maize

loans.name: Yakelin

texts.es:
Yakelin vive en alquiler en un edificio de la zona central de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo e hija; la actividad que realiza es la venta de ferretería como ser urinarios, tinas, lava manos, etc. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar más mercadería y de esta manera mantener su fuente de ingreso.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO, y por el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Yakelin lives in a rented unit in a building in central La Paz. She lives with her husband and daughter. She sells hardware items like urinals, tubs, sinks, etc. The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital, buy more merchandise, and thus maintain her source of income. This is the first time that she is requesting a loan from IMPRO. Because of her character, she is able to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase hardware like tubs, sinks, and urinals

loans.name: Mario Arturo

texts.es:
Mario de 41 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (perímetro urbano, la mayoría de los habitantes son de clase baja). Empezó hace 4 años con el Cyber-cabinas, después que lo liquidaron en la empresa que trabajaba. 

Con esfuerzo y dedicación el pudo comprar computadoras y una cabina en el local. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora el tiene su Cyber el cual es su primer ingreso económico para mantener a su familia, Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días. Con el préstamo quiere arreglar el local y comprar una computadora para su local.  

En el futuro quiere tener su casa propia, y tener un numero mas elevado de clientes.
texts.en:
Mario is 41 and lives in the Guasmo de Guayaquil (a built-up area where most of the residents are lower class). He began working with a computer cafe after the business where he worked was liquidated. With effort and dedication he was able to buy computers and a booth in a stand. From that time on he has had his Cyber business which is the main economic support for his family. He works from 7 am to 7 pm every day. With the loan he would like to fix up the stand and to buy a computer for it. In the future he wants his own house and to have a greater number of customers.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Computers and to set up his stand

loans.name: San

texts.en: Mrs. San N. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she also assists her husband in the cultivation of crops from her own farmland. The couple has a child who is already married and lives at home. San N. has raised a lot of piglets and she had hoped to sell them to buyers four months after she began raising them. Unfortunately, the pigs are not big enough, due to the lack of food. To help solve this problem, San N. has requested a loan of $1100 that she will use to buy many sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs. She will use rest of the loan towards purchasing farm supplies to use on her field.

loans.use: To buy many sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth M. is from the village of Brgy. Nagcuartelan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 34 years old. Elizabeth is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2007, Elizabeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to expand the business. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Elizabeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to expand the business

loans.name: Koulossama I Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOULOSSAMA I  est  composé  de dix  femmes mariées du village de Nènèsso dans l’ex l’arrondissement de Kimparana, du cercle de SAN, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et au moins 5 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide et du maïs. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  il y’a trois ans.
MAMOU D., qui est la présidente du groupe, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de Kimparana. 
Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 25 000 à 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Koulossama I est made up of 10 married women of the Nènèsso village in the former Kimparana arrondissement, in the San circle, in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families. They have an average age of 35 and at least 5 children. They grow peanuts and corn. In order to make their agricultural business more profitable, the group members have worked with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for the past three years. Mamou D., the group's president, plans on using the loan to purchase a sufficient supply of peanut seeds, small farming implements, and fertilizer at the Kimparana Grand Market. After the rainy season, the harvests are stored for a certain amount of time so they can become more valuable before being sold retail (often wholesale) at the Kimparana Grand Market and surrounding markets, for cash to a client base generally from large cities. After selling their good, the group members each hope to make a profit of 25,000 to 35,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay interest on the loan and to take care of their families.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer, seeds, and small farming implements

loans.name: Knarik

texts.en:
Knarik M. lives in the village of Arapi in the Shirak region of Armenia.  Even though Knarik has a college education, economic opportunities were very limited and she chose agriculture for self employment.  For the past 22 years, Knarik has been engaged in livestock production and wheat production.

She is married with two sons aged 20 and 22 years old.  As she values education, she is particularly keen to have her children continue their studies.  She is seeking a loan to purchase fuel and to rent equipment to organize the wheat harvest.  With the loan she expects the family income to increase by 20%.  These funds will be dedicated to her children’s college tuition and repairing their house.  Knarik enjoys working on the land and especially enjoys living so close to nature.

loans.use: fuel and rental equipment

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Industrious, disciplined and hardworking are qualities that best describe Jocelyn B., a 42 year old. She is married to Rolando, a fisherman, and they were blessed with three children whose ages are 17, 9 and 8, a high school student and two elementary students.

It was the year 2004 when she became a member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. a partner micro-finance institution of KIVA in the Philippines. She is one of the good performing members of ASHI. Though she is active, she only borrows capital that she thinks she can regularly repay.  The family income is only enough for their daily needs and school expenses for their children. 

After seven long years she has gained confidence and is now applying for a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy additional fishing gear, nets and a canoe or wooden boat for her husband to use. She will also buy additional piglets for her hog raising business. Fishing and hog raising have been their primary sources of income for the past seven years, and they have really benefited from it. Their future plan is to develop these businesses more and make them stable so as to be able to sustain the education of their children. They also plan to renovate their current house and buy additional appliances.

Jocelyn is so glad that she became a member of ASHI and KIVA because their life has improved since then and their dream is now at hand. She hopes and prays that the two institutions will continue to support her goals for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets, fishing gears, nets and a canoe/wooden boat

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos fue cliente anteriormente el trabajo con el grupo solidario "19 de marzo" el cual por motivos internos se disolvió,  después de dos años el retorna para sacar un crédito individual.  El vive en anticrético juntamente con la Sra.  Luisa su esposa la cual trabaja en una pastelería, y el Sr. Carlos se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de pan y sus dos hijos uno de ellos ya es independiente, trabaja en un laboratorios y el otro todavía esta en etapa escolar. Don Carlos en su afán de darles a sus hijos mayor comodidad solicito este crédito para regalarle a su hijo mayor un juego de dormitorio, el Sr. Es muy trabajador y esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en otorgación del  crédito.
texts.en:
Carlos used to be a member of the “19 de Marzo” communal bank which, for internal reasons, disbanded. After two years he has returned to request an individual loan. He lives under the anticrético modality with his wife Luisa who works in a pastry shop (Anticrético: transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you). Carlos is a baker. He hast two sons. One of them is independent and works in a laboratory, the other is still in school. In his effort to provide his children with the most comfort, he has requested this loan in order to give his oldest son a bedroom set. Carlos is very hard working and is very grateful to the institution for the support given by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bedroom set for his son.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 50 years old and a member of Tumaini Rongai under Faulu Kenya.  She rents out houses and she runs the business with four employees.  She has been engaged in this business for ten years.  She hopes to construct more rental houses in the future.  For this reason, she has requested 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). In five years, she hopes to build apartments for renting.

loans.use: To construct rental houses

loans.name: Nocturnal Group

texts.es: El grupo nocturnal, se llama así porque en una noche de reunión de amigas decidieron formar el grupo para poder obtener crédito con CrediComún, el grupo está formado por nueve personas y todas se conocen entre sí.La señora Irma O. V.: está en unión libre con Alfredo Nicolás Blas, tienen tres hijos uno de seis, otro de cinco, y uno de dos, la señora se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y tortillas hechas a mano y el mismo local tiene un poco de mercancía de abarrotes. En la colonia todos la conocen por que hace unas tortillas muy ricas, dice estar muy agradecida con el crédito ya que es una posibilidad de crecimiento en su negocio para poder superarse y sacar adelante a su familia ya que en este tiempo es muy difícil que solo trabaje un sólo miembro de la familia porque a veces no les alcanzaba para la comida.Sin embargo quiere invertir en su negocio y hacerlo crecer, con las ganancias piensa comprar unos utensilios para poder vender antojitos mexicanos.
texts.en:
The group's name is Nocturnal. It was called this because it was one night that a group of friends decided to get together to be able to apply for a loan from CrediComun (Kiva Field Partner). The group is made up of nine members and they are all known to each other.

Mrs. Irma O. V. lives with her partner Alfredo Nicolas Blas and they have three children together: one is six years old, the other is five, and the last is 2 years old. She sells cosmetics and hand made tortillas; she also has a stand from where she sells groceries. In her community everyone knows her because she makes very delicious tortillas. She is very thankful for the loan because it is an opportunity for the development of her business. She wants to develop her business and she wants to support her family, especially at this time when there is only one source of income. Sometimes they do not have enough money for food. She wants to invest in her business and expand it. With her profits she hopes to purchase utensils to sell authentic Mexican snacks.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Sonia Cristina

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” ubicado en el distrito Azángaro,  provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente y con 04 hijos, la señora  llegó a estudiar hasta 4to de educación primaria.

Sonia viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio venta de carne, animales menores y queso.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar ganados para su negocio.

Su sueño es tener más capital para el negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the “Punta Sahuacasi” community bank which is located in Azángaro district, in Azángaro province, in the department of Puno.  She is 42 years old and lives with her partner and 4 children.  She studied up to the fourth year of her primary education.

Sonia has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 2 years.  She used her first loan for 300 nuevos soles to increase the capital of her business selling meat, young animals and cheese.

She is now requesting a new loan for 1,500 nuevos soles which she will use to buy livestock for her business.

Her dream is to have more capital for her business.  What she likes most about her community bank is what she earns from her savings.

loans.use: To buy livestock to increase her business profits

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN SONCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 55 años de edad, es viuda  y tiene 01 hijo ; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz,aceite,azúcar,leche entre otros,la socia lo vende de forma ambulatoria en el   mercado San Pedro. 

La  socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas productos para su negocio.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a member of the “Hatun Soncco” communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Rosa is 55 years old, is a widow and has one son. 

She sells primary need products, such as rice, cooking oil, sugar, milk, among other things, on foot in the San Pedro market.  She is asking for this loan so that she can buy more items for her business.

She is grateful to those who help make this dream possible through this means and she is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Natividad Del Jesus

texts.es:
Natividad de 35 años, ha trabajado como costurera muchos años para poder mantener a sus hijos y poder ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Su primera costura fue cuando empezó a trabajar haciendo almohadas en un taller de costura pero como tenía que trabajar todo el día y su sueldo era muy bajo. Decidió con sus ahorros comprar una máquina de coser y promocionar sus costuras a sus vecinos y amigos.   

Viviendo con su esposo y dos hijos de 12 y 13 años ha convertido una parte de la casa en su taller de costura y confección. Se levanta a las 06h00am hacer los pedidos de ropa que tiene pendiente del día siguiente. Ella hace camisas, pantalones, blusas de hombres, mujeres o niños.

Para seguir operando con su máquina de coser ella quiere comprar con el préstamo telas e hilos para su taller. En el futuro quiere tener su taller bien espacioso para darles una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Natividad, age 35, has worked as a seamstress for several years in order to support her children and help her husband with the household expenses. Her first sewing job involved making pillows at a sewing workshop, but her she had to work all day and her salary was very low. With her savings, she decided to buy a sewing machine and sell her creations to neighbors and friends.

Natividad lives with her husband and two children, ages 12 and 13. She converted part of her house into a sewing and dressmaking shop. Natividad wakes up at 6am in order to complete the clothing orders that are due the following day. She makes women’s blouses, men’s and children’s shirts, and trousers.

In order to keep her sewing workshop in operation, Natividad wants to use this loan to buy fabrics and thread. In the future, she wants to have a spacious workshop so that she can provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics & thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more shoes for his shop

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is twenty-five years old and married with two children, ages 5 and 10, who both attend school. She has been in the farming business for five years now. She sells her milk, maize and wheat to the local market.

She has requested this loan of 31,200 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that her family will then be assured of enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. In the next five years she plans to acquire three dairy cows, a chuff cutter and a posho mill (a machine that grinds maize into maize flour).

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Renaldo

texts.en: Renaldo B. is from the village of Dalig Viejo. He is 40 years old. Renaldo is married. To make a living, Renaldo raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Renaldo has been engaged in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Renaldo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Renaldo is requesting a new loan of 21,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Renaldo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie M. is from the village of Salimpono, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old, married and has 2 adult-aged children. Tessie owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily goats, for sale. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Tessie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Tessie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang M., 37, resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. M. sells groceries, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a police officer, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 60 on food and USD 10 on the other necessary expenses. 

M. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase chickens and ducks to raise for sale. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy chickens and ducks to raise for sale

loans.name: Umujima

texts.en: Umujima is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and onions. She is 20 years old and married to a businessman with one child. Her child does not go to school. Umujima borrowed a loan to stock more tomatoes and onions to sell. She hopes to expand with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa is a 39-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a fishing/fish vending business. She lives in Victorias, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing/fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,500. Luisa is borrowing PHP 26,000 so that she can repair her fishing boat and purchase net and copper for fishing. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Luisa aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat and purchase net and copper for fishing

loans.name: Samorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Samorn S. (pictured at her loom) is 50 years old.  Her husband, Mr. Duon Dem, is 51 years old.  They live in a village by the Mekong River approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Samorn is a weaver and her husband is a fisherman.   They have been married since 1987 and have four children: three sons and one daughter --  one is a construction worker, one weaves silk at home, and the other two are in school.  

Samorn is asking for a loan of $800 to repair her family's house.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor has been selling coffee by going past shops in his region and serving them his hot, well done coffee since 2000. He is a 43-year-old married man, the father of six children. Khodor lives with his family in Saida. Khodor lived through a miserable financiA. situation with his family, and he doesn't want his kids to face what he faced. That's why he wants to improve his business with his eighth loan from A. Majmoua. He will buy a car and widen his selling zone.

Khodor is a good borrower. His previous loans helped him a lot socially and financially. Most of his clients are neighbors and friends. He hopes to provide his family a healthy and secure life.

loans.use: to buy a car to improve his coffee business.

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es:
Leandro es un agricultor de 59 años de edad que vive en la provincia de Olmos – departamento de Lambayeque. Leandro goza de muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su comunidad rural.

Desde hace 20 años él se dedica a cosechar y vender maíz, especialmente en el mercado de su zona donde es muy conocido por la buena calidad de su maíz y el precio justo al que lo vende. 
	 
Leandro solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que los destinará en la compra de urea y otros insumos que le servirán para la buena cosecha de su maíz. Con el paso del tiempo la calidad del producto de Leandro le ha permitido mejorar su estilo de vida y él espera que esto siga continuando. 

Leandro es una persona responsable que ha cumplido sus pagos, con otras entidades,  de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Leandro is farmer, who is 59 years old and lives in the province of Olmos in the department of Lambayeque. Leandro has many good references from people and workers in his rural community.

For 20 years, he has been dedicated to growing and selling corn in a market in his area, where he is well-known for his high-quality corn and fair prices. 

Leandro is requesting a loan for 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and other supplies that will help him have a good corn harvest. Over time, selling corn has permitted Leandro to improve his quality of life, and he hopes that this will continue. 

Leandro is a responsible person, and he has made his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for growing corn

loans.name: Jennyline

texts.en:
Jennyline is from the village of Kulasihan, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 33 years old. Jennyline is widowed and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Jennyline owns and operates a food stall, serving a variety of viands like afritada, caldereta and bulalo. Jennyline has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jennyline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Jennyline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients and for working capital. 

Jennyline is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables and spices. This will be the second loan taken out by Jennyline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables and spices.

loans.name: Groupe 3 De Benkadi  Ii

texts.fr:
Le Groupe 3 de l’association BENKADI  II est composé de huit femmes  qui toutes mariées. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 31  ans, ont en moyenne  3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles polygames à MEMISSALA, situé à environ 30 km de la ville de NIENA région de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur cinquième cycle de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés avec satisfaction. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du maïs, du riz, d’arachide, de gombo etc et  les rentabilités   de ces spéculations dans cette zone sont  bien reconnues.
KADIA compte acheter   1 sac d’urée 1/2 sac de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 10 000 à 15 000 FCFA qui sera utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Group 3 of the BENKADI II association is composed of eight women who are all married. They have an average age of 31, have an average of three children and all live in polygamous families in Memissala, which is located about 30 km from the city of Nien in Sikasso region, the third administrative region of Mali. 
This group is applying for its fifth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet their needs to support their agricultural production. The previous loans were all fully repaid. 
This group of women is growing corn, rice, groundnut, okra, etc., and the profitability of these products in this regiion is considerable. 
Kadia plans to buy a bag of urea, 1 / 2 a bag of grain complex and use the rest to cover the costs of plowing and weeding. She expects to make an average profit of 10 000 to 15 000 FCFA which will be used for daily expenses of her family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural products and cover the costs of plowing and weeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Raul Vinicio

texts.es:
Raul Vinicio tiene 27 años, es soltero vive con  los padres y los hermanos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  BELLAVISTA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Papauco Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 11 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y otras actividades.

Raul  se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas, trigo, maíz, además tiene 3 cabezas de ganado y tiene un taxi. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas. Su sueño es comprar terrenos.

Le gusta hacer deporte y las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Raul Vinicio is 27 years old.  He is single, and lives with his parents and brothers in the Guaranda canton in Bolivar province.

The BELLAVISTA community bank is located in the Papauco Pucara community in Guanujo province, which is in the Guaranda province 15 minutes from the cooperative office.  This group is made up of 11 members who work in agriculture, raising animals, and other activities.

Raul works farming products such as potatoes, wheat, and corn.  He also has 3 head of cattle and has a taxi.  He makes purchases in Guaranda market, and sells in the wholesale market in the same city.

He is requesting the loan to buy supplies and animal feed.  With the help of the loan, it will help him financially to cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as pests.  His dream is to buy land.  He enjoys playing sports and the carnival fiestas.

loans.use: to buy supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Serafin

texts.en: Forty-five-year-old Serafin. a married father of six, lives in the Philippines where, for the past five years, he has operated a shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. A new member of HSPFI, he is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, beverages and snacks. In the future, Serafin hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Dativa

texts.en:
Dativa is a 41-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with one child who is 18 years old and in school.  She is a widow and for the past nine years has been running her own business selling foodstuffs such as peanuts and beans.

She requires a loan to purchase foodstuffs that she will sell for a profit. She hopes to use the profits to purchase a house in the future.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en:
Fatema is a 27-year-old woman who is married and has one son and three daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee who earns a decent salary. 

Fatema wants to purchase bedroom furniture for her three daughters, as they are growing up and need to have their own room, but with the salary her husband makes she can't pay the entire amount at once, therefore she borrowed $3,000 from FATEN. 

Fatema is a conservative religious woman, so her husband is photographed instead at FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Yajaira tiene 25 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa interior y es miembro del Banco Comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras, es casada y su esposo se dedica a cultivar en pequeña escala maíz y frijoles, tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos son niñas, es una persona muy luchadora y desde que nació reside en la Aldea San Nicolas. Yajaira inició a vender ropa interior con un poquito dinero que tenía ahorrado porque necesitaba ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que el costo de la canasta básica cada día es mas alto. Su negocio no tiene nombre porque realiza las ventas de forma ambulante, visita las casas de sus vecinos para enseñarles la mercaderia y si les gusta y no tienen dinero para pagarle inmediatamente se las deja al credito. Su horario para realizar las ventas es de lunes a viernes por las tardes y asi le queda tiempo para atender los quehaceres de su hogar pero los fines de semana sale desde muy temprano, aunque su mayor dificultad es cuando llueve no puede salir de su casa. El prestamo que solicita Yajaira lo necesita para comprar brazieres, blumeres, bikinis, boxers, entre otros. Con el apoyo del prestamo podra seguir adelante con su negocio y eso le permitirá seguir obteniendo ganancias para ayudar a su esposo y sus hijos. Su meta es instalar una pequeña en su casa. Yajaira tiene seis ciclos en FAMA y ha sido muy puntual con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Yajaira, age 25, is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Women Entrepreneurs). She sells undergarments while her husband is a small-scale farmer, growing corn and beans. They have three children, which includes two daughters. Yajaira is a determined individual who was born in the neighborhood of San Nicolas. She started selling undergarments with a little bit of money that she had saved because she needed to help her husband with the household expenses since the cost of food keeps increasing each day. Her business does not have a formal name because she sells as a traveling vendor. She visits the homes of her neighbors so that she can show them the merchandise. If they like the products and do not have money to pay immediately, then Yajaira will extend credit to her customers. Her schedule for making sales is from Monday through Friday in the afternoons. This gives her time to take care of the household chores, but on the weekends she leaves very early. Her greatest difficulty is when it rains because she is not able to leave the house.

The loan Yajaira is requesting will be used to buy bras, bloomers, bikinis, boxers, and other items. With the support of this loan, she will able to move forward with her business. This enables her to generate income so that she can help her husband and children. Her goal is to establish a small shop in her home. Yajaira has participated in six loan cycles with FAMA and has submitted her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy various types of undergarments.

loans.name: Abasangirakiyago Group

texts.fr:
Mathieu est un commerçant âgé de 53ans qui habite  la localité de Nyamugari au centre du pays dans la Province de Gitega. Il  fait le commerce de haricots depuis 13ans. Il fut Boulanger avant de commencer le metier actuel. Il a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 6e année des études primaires. Il est marié a Philote et père de 4 enfants qui n’ont pas encore commence l’ecole. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 250,000 francs burundais qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital en achetant une  plus grande quantite de haricots a revendre afin de  réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« ABASANGIRAKIYAGO».
texts.en:
Mathieu, age 53, is a merchant who lives in Nyamugari, Gitega Province, in the center of the country. He's been selling beans for 13 years. Before that, he was a baker. He attended elementary school up to the sixth year. He's married to Philote, and the father of four children. None of them attends school yet.

His part of the Kiva loan amounts to 250'000 BIF and will enable him to bolster his working capital and purchase a larger quantity of bean to resell, in order to turn a bigger profit. He's a member of the community group ABASANGIRAKIYAGO.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of beans to resell

loans.name: Kabaka 11 Group

texts.en: Eliza is a 28-year-old married woman with four children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in bar business for two years. She started with 50,000 shillings and now has 1,000,000 shillings as her working capital. Her hardship is price fluctuations and her visions are a well-established bar and educating her children. Eliza needs a loan to buy beer to sell.

loans.use: To buy beer to sell

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader is a 25-year-old single man who manufactures plastic bags and paper. He started this business three years ago. Nader used to work as a barber, but he decided to turn to this kind of business because he liked it a lot. He states that it can open a wide market in front of him.

Nader is a hard-working man. He is ambitious and seeks perfection. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to buy necessary raw materials at good prices. Nader loves his business a lot and seeks to expand it as much as he can in the future.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Wanyoike

texts.en:
Wanyoike is 43 years old, married and has three children in school. To earn a living, he does welding.  He mainly makes metallic doors and windows.  He has been in the business for five years. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business, and therefore improved his standard of living. He also does farming to supplement his income.

Wanyoike hopes to expand his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow and animal feed.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and animal feed

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is 65 years old and is married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Edwina is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock and feed.

Edwina has been raising livestock for two years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and a welding shop.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and feed.

loans.name: Farm Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Farm Group in Western Kenya! Kennedy is the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Kennedy is a father of two children. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and educate his children. In the recent 2011 season, Kennedy had an excellent maize yield harvesting 32 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Kennedy was only able to harvest 17 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Kennedy and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Kennedy will educate his children and ensure food security for his family.

In 2012, the members of Farm group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

He is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, son 15 mujeres, que se pusieron como objetivo principal obtener mayores ingresos, para que de esa forma puedan ayudar a sus familias e hijos, pues no quieren que pasen por ningún tipo de privaciones. 
Una de ellas es la señora Gladys, quien se dedica a la costura, trabajo gracias al cual ha logrado mantener a su familia y a mantener su casa. Comenta que le va muy bien en su trabajo ya que siempre tiene muchos pedidos con los cuales cumplir, es por ello que solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, agujas y otros, los cuales son indispensables en su trabajo.
Ella al igual que las demás miembros agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan, pues el crédito les será de mucha ayuda en sus objetivos.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of San Lorenzo.  They are a group of 15 women who set themselves a main goal of making more income so that they are able to help their families and children as they don't want them to suffer any hardships.  

One of the members of the group is Gladys.  Her business is sewing.  Thanks to her work, she has managed to support her family and her household.  She says that her work is going very well as she always has a lot of orders to fill.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy fabric, threads, needles and other items which are essential to her work.

In common with the other members of the group, Gladys thanks Fundacón Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity that they are providing as the loan will be very helpful to them in achieving their goals.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, needles, etc.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en: Dickson is a 28-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. His family goal is to buy a motorcycle. He has a retail business, which he has been running for two years. The main hardship is  insufficient power supply, and his dream is to expand his business into new markets. Dickson needs a loan to buy soft drinks, sugar and salt for his business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sugar and salt for resale.

loans.name: Victoria Yadira

texts.es:
La Señora. Victoria es socia del banco comunal Esmeraldeñas, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que tiene una gran riqueza cultural, natural y gastronómica, es desde Diciembre de 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es amable y gentil.

La Señora. Victoria tiene 30 años, vive en unión libre y no tiene hijos. Su esposo trabaja en la venta de mariscos, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, trabaja 4 días de la semana y para vender sus productos tiene una carreta y vende recorriendo la ciudad.

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra  víveres para su negocio.
 
Su meta es terminar su casa ya que se encuentra en construcción.
texts.en:
Señora Victoria is a member of the communal bank Esmeraldeñas. She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city that is rich in culture, gastronomy and natural delights which since December 1999 has been a cultural heritage site. Its people are friendly and polite.

Señora Victoria is 30 years old and is in a common-law marriage. She has no children. Her husband works selling seafood. Thye do not own their own house and live in rented accomodation. She makes and sells food. She works 4 days a week and she uses a handcart from which to sell her products as she travels around the city.

She has been a member of the communal bank for the last year and she will use her new loan to invest in the purchase of food supplies for her business. Her goal is to finish building her house which is currently under construction.

loans.use: to buy food supplies.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis has been a farmer for three years. He is 34 years old, married, and has one kid.

He learned about KADET from marketing done by the KADET staff in his area. He has been a good client who repaid his previous loans well. This is his third loan which he plans to use to purchase farm supplies such as maize seeds and fertilizer and to hire casual workers to work on the farm. He intends to use the returns from the loan to reinvest in farming and buy a bigger farm.

His dreams are to be the best and most well-known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies such as maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en: Otgonjargal is 72 years old and lives with his wife in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Arhangai province, Mongolia. His wife runs his business. He started his second hand garment retailing business in 2006. Over the years he has gained many customers and trusted suppliers. He is known for his quality garments which he sterilizes himself. He is also a part time driver. He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy more used garments. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says "Now that holiday season is here, my products are not quite enough to run my business".

loans.use: To buy more used garments

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a dry goods retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like blouses, pants, bags, slippers and ready-to-wear clothing for her dry goods business.

Gertrude has been in this business for 10 years. Gertrude earns more income from auto supply and a general store.

Gertrude has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her auto supply business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like blouses, pants, bags, slippers and ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les huit  membres du groupe DJIGUISSEME III sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Werekela, un des villages de la région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, BARRO première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,75 hectare de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 120.000F CFA environs par campagne.

loans.use: Labour, semence, engrais, herbicide, sarclage et petits équipements

loans.name: Adèle

texts.fr: Adèle est âgée de 37 ans et ne vit plus avec son mari. Adèle est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Adèle vit avec ses enfants, et assure leurs différents besoins grâce aux revenus de son activité. Adèle n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a une dizaine d'année que Adèle mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (savons, conserves de tomate) et aussi des tissus et des produits de beauté par le système de distribution. Adèle achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Adèle sollicite un sixième crédit. Ce crédit lui servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de sa clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus et des produits de beauté.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Mourice is 40 years old. He is married with 5 children aged between 2 and 22 years, 2 of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 8 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
From Ormoc City, Leyte,  Juditha, a 64-year-old mother to four adult children. 
She is already a widow and has been raising hogs for a long time to support herself.
She has requested a loan to buy additional piglets, feed and supplements for her hogs. This way, she can better take care of her animals.
In the future, Juditha would like to expand to her business so she can save for her future needs.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and supplements

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita, a 32 year-old originally from Manabi, Ecuador, has three children, two of whom study at the colegio. Unfortunately, her third son who is 14 years of age does attend school because Anita and her husband cannot afford it. Sra. C.’s husband works as a cabinet maker and makes $120 every month. Anita has always had an entrepreneurial spirit, and once she married, she wanted to pursue her dream of opening a breakfast restaurant with her husband.  They began by running the small restaurant out of their home, but they realized 5 years ago that they would need a larger location to accommodate the growing number of customers that frequented their place. This husband-wife team has been able to improve their home which is in an area of Guayaquil called Isla Trinitaria. With the profits from business, Anita and her husband have been able to re-do the structure of their house to brick. She wants to borrow $585 so that she can put in new flooring in her house. The way things are right now, her family is very susceptible to flu and other throat sicknesses because the flooring is just dirt. Also, Anita would like to buy more utensils for her restaurant.

loans.use: Repair Floor, Buy Tools for cabinet-making

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: START A GROCERY STORE

loans.name: Seadat

texts.en: Seadat was born and raised in Aghsu in Azerbaijan. She is married with one child. Seadat and her husband, Qudrat, own and operate a small food market in the city. They started the business nine years ago out of a small location. A few years later they started renting the location where they are currently. The business has been growing well and they want to further expand their store. Seadat is asking for a loan to increase their stock as well as to expand the variety of goods by providing items not previously provided at most stores in the region. (Seadat's husband, Qudrat, is shown pictured.)

loans.use: to expand the variety of goods offered

loans.name: Nga

texts.en: T. T. T. Nga is 30 and her husband Do Van Bao is 33. They have a son who is  in the first grade of a public school. Nga's husband grows green dragon bushes. Nga works as a clerk in a shop. Their elderly mother also lives with the family; she is 74. Their average income is US$13 per month per person. They want T. borrow US$75 T. invest in their green dragon garden so that they will get more profit from it. They will pay back the loan during the term.

loans.use: Plant green dragon bushes

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Señor Aníbal Fernández is 39 years old and happily married to Stela, who is 32 years old. She is the lady of the house and has dedicated herself to raising and educating their five children. Their children are 17, 15, 12, 8, and 3 years old. The three older children are enrolled in a high school in the city and the other two are attending primary school.

Seven years ago Aníbal, after realizing how profitable motorcycles garages could be, opened up his own garage with some savings and already has his own business of repairing motorcycles and bicycles. In the city of Carapeguá, the people travel mostly by motorcycle or bicycle, which is what makes the business so profitable.

The requested loan is going to be used to buy replacement parts for the motorcycles, such as pistons, piston rings, gaskets, washers, and brake cables. This way his clients won't have to raise the capital to buy the replacement parts because he will already have them, and this will increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

El señor Aníbal Fernández de 39 años de edad está felizmente casado con Stela de 32 años, ella es ama de casa y se dedica al cuidado y educación de sus hijos cinco hijos. Ellos tienen 17, 15, 12, 8 y 3 años de edad respectivamente; de los cuales los tres hijos mayores se encuentran cursando actualmente la etapa secundaria en un colegio de la ciudad y los otros dos cursando la primaria. Hace 7 años atrás, Aníbal, al darse cuenta de la rentabilidad que daba los talleres de motos, abrió su propio taller con un poco de ahorro con el que contaba y actualmente ya cuenta no solo con un taller sino también con su propio negocio de ventas de repuestos para motos y bicicletas. En la ciudad de Carapeguá las personas se movilizan en motos y bicicletas, lo que hace rentable el negocio. El préstamo solicitado lo va a utilizar en la compra de repuestos para motos como Pistón, aros, junta, reten y fibra de frenos, de esta forma evitará que sus clientes vayan hasta la capital a comprar los repuestos y también aumentará sus ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase replacement parts for motorcycles such as pistons, piston rings, gaskets, washers, and brake cables.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto makes artisan crafts and works with straw manufacturing baskets, hats, place mats, etc. He also sells cow milk, from which he supplements his earnings in order to support his wife and three children. He lives in Comunidad de Batallas – Caluyo (two hours away from La Paz). He will use the loan for buying a milking cow of medium breed in order to increase milk production. This is his second credit through Impro and his good payment records qualify him for obtaining another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Alberto es artesano y realiza trabajo manual en paja como ser cestería, sombreros e individuales de comedor, etc. También es productor de leche de vaca con cuyas ventas complementa sus ingresos y así mantiene a sus tres hijos y esposa. Vive en la Comunidad de Batallas - Caluyo (A dos horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el segundo crédito con Impro y el buen historial de pagos le permite acceder a otro préstamo.

loans.use: Buying a milking cow

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Mrs. U. Lay was married in 1983 and has five children, three sons and two daughters. She learned to weave silk from her mother in 1980. She began her silk weaving business in the same year. She has finished primary school. Her husband, Mr. Uth Thorn, is working at the AKIMEX Company as chief of the warehouse. He has finished high school.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA five times already. Now she is asking a loan in the amount of $500. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Rosa Jacinta

texts.es:
Rosa C. is a very hard working mother that has been selling clothes for 20 years. She started this business with C$1,000.00, which she got from a loan.

She started selling clothes with a lot of effort and help from her three kids. She fights hard, so her kids can enjoy good health, decent education, good clothing and a solid moral foundation. We do have to mention that Rosa is a single mother and therefore her sales are the only income for the family.

Ceprodel has worked with her, on the last year and a half, they have helped her with 9 loans, these loans have served to strengthen her business and improve the quality of her house. Do to better earnings she had the opportunity of investing in her house and live happily with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa C. es una madre muy esforzada que se dedica a la venta de ropa que tiene desde hace 20 años el cual inició con un total de C$1.000.00 producto de un préstamo que realizó.

La venta de ropa la inicia con mucho esfuerzo con el apoyo de sus tres hijos que lucha al día a día para darles las condiciones necesarias de estudio, salud, ropa y respaldo moral. Cabe señalar que la señora Rosa es madre soltera y por tal motivo es el único sustento en su familia.

Ceprodel le ha brindado la mano en otorgarle créditos (9 créditos) desde hace año y medio que le han fortalecido su negocio y han mejorado la situación de su vivienda ya que obtiene mejores utilidades para reinvertir en su casita y vivir dignamente.

loans.use: Purchase Clothes

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
"I am Zahida A.. I have lived all my life in Multan, a historic city in Pakistan. I live in a one-room brick house here in Multan. I have been embroidering since my teens. Now, I want to start my own embroidery business. With the increase in income, I plan to repair my house.

My group members also need financial assistance; therefore we are requesting a loan for our group.

Salma B. wants to buy a yarn machine. Khadija B. wants a loan for their cloth manufacturing business. Sadika B. will use the loan to buy cloth for her little business.

I feel very proud that I am able to help these women and myself."

loans.use: Start up an embroidery business

loans.name: María De Los Angeles

texts.en:
María is a young and promising entrepreneur who lives in the Café community of Santo Domingo. She has been selling sneakers and shoes by catalogue for over a year. María explains that she doesn’t have a large stock of goods in her house. Instead, she buys products after her customers order them, which requires her to travel outside her community once a week.

María will use her loan to buy a large quantity of products ordered by her customers. She’ll also purchase some fashionable shoes and sneakers that she thinks people will love and buy.

María’s business supports the education of her two children.

loans.use: Purchase of a collection of sneakers and shoes for a small business.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is married and has two children, ages16 and 7. She is a cloth and timber seller. Lilian started her sales business in 1998. Every day, she works from 6 am to 8 pm, and can earn a monthly profit of about US$350.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of items for sale

loans.name: Muon

texts.en:
Muon Y. is 37 years old. She and her husband raise pigs as livestock from their family home and sell them in the surrounding villages. Their combined income only amounts to 2 US$ per day. Despite their extremely low income, they still manage to send all four of their children to school. This is impressive and no doubt difficult to maintain as most families of the same economic standing often require their children to stay home to avoid education costs, or to work with their parents in the family business.

She wants to purchase more piglets to breed with the ones she is already raising. She will then sell the older pigs to the local butcher where the majority of her profit comes from. It takes four to five months for the piglets to mature and be capable of reproducing.

loans.use: To buy piglets.

loans.name: Aenid Selessy

texts.es:
Aenid C. was born on June 1975. She is 32 years old, married and has 3 children, who have all attended primary school. She currently lives at Asentamiento Humano, Alberto Fujimori, Salaverry, Perú.

She is a member of the Banco Comunal Las Empesarias al Éxito II. Three years ago she opened a small shop, selling porcelein, glass and plastic, made possible by her ordering and delivery system.

With this loan of $625, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy plates, jars, pots etc.

Aenid has high expectations from her business, expecting it to grow daily from the hard work of her and her husband. Thus they hope to be able to support their children and hope to see them grow healthy and successful in their working lives.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy goods for her shop.

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr:
Eya D. is 37 years old, married, and the mother of four. She has been a retail seller of 'pagnes' cloth (colorful print fabrics) for over seven years in Avetonou, a small village located about 100 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She wishes to use this loan to buy three bolts of pagnes to resell in order to meet customer demands and to use the gains, which will come from her business, to help meet household needs.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Eya D. est âgée de 37 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle revendeuse de pagnes de puis plus de 7 ans à Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit, acheter 3 balles de pages pour la revente afin de satisfaire la demande de la clientèle et d’utiliser les gains qui seront issus de son activité pour la participation de la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.

loans.use: To buy 3 bolts of 'pagnes' for retail sale

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana is 24 year old woman with a lot of desire to get ahead. She works in a commercial establishment that she owns with her family and contains a place where she offers typing and photocopying services, which are in high demand in the area. Diana's goal is that family and her grow the project, opening branches in other areas. This mentality of getting ahead is what carries her to improve every day and only one year after having started she can already see the benefits. This time Diana is requesting a loan to increase her work capital and promote her business with the purchase of necessary materials as well as maintainence for her machines. Support this young woman so that she can work independently for a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Diana es una joven de 24 años con muchos deseos de superación, día a día está dedicada a trabajar en un establecimiento comercial que posee con su familia, se trata de una bodega donde ella ofrece el servicio de mecanografiado y fotocopiado, servicios que son muy solicitados en su localidad. La meta de Diana es crecer junto con su familia con este proyecto, abrir sucursales en otras zonas, esta mentalidad de superación es la lleva a mejorar cada día en su establecimiento, y con sólo un año de haber iniciado, ya se pueden ver los frutos. En esta ocasión Diana solicita un préstamo para incrementar su capital de trabajo e impulsar su negocio con la compra de los materiales necesarios y el mantenimiento de sus máquinas. Apoya a esta joven que trabaja de manera independiente por un futuro mejor.

loans.use: Purchase of necessary materials and maintainence for the machines in  her business of typing and photocopying.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
For five years, Nora has sold natural products. She was sick and was invited to try these products, which worked very well. In this way, she began to recommend them and now she goes looking for new customers and people who are interested in selling these products.

Nora worked as a cleaner in a hospital, but when she had her daughter, she decided to leave that job. Nevertheless, twice a week, she cleans houses.

The loans that she has received have been invested in the purchase of more natrual products and to improve her home's infrastructure. Nora would like to have a stall in the market from which to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Nora vende productos naturistas desde hace 5 años. Ella estuvo enferma, por lo que le invitaron a probar estos productos y le funcionaron muy bien. Fue así que empezó a recomendarlos y ahora sale a buscar nuevos clientes y personas que se interesen en vender este producto. Nora trabajaba haciendo limpieza en un hospital, pero luego tuvo su hija, por lo que decidió dejar esta actividad. Sin embargo, 2 veces a la semana ella trabaja haciendo limpieza en casas particulares. Los préstamos recibidos han sido invertidos en la compra de más productos naturistas y para mejorar la infraestructura de su casa. Nora quisiera tener un puesto en el mercado y vender sus productos.

loans.use: To purchase more natural products and improve her home.

loans.name: Lydia J.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 46-year-old Lydia M..  She is married and has four children between the ages of 11 and 26. In 1998, Lydia established her rice-selling business. Lydia has already received and successfully repaid four loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more inventory of rice. She thanks you for your support.  

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment Ð a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Helen's Group

texts.en:
Helen has been cooking and selling food in Dodoma, Tanzania, for 2 years. She is now seeking a loan so that she may purchase more cooking ingredients, particularly sugar and oil, so that she may produce more food to sell. She works for 11 hours every day and earns a profit of approximately $35 each month. With the increased profit from her greater sales following this loan, Helen hopes to reinvest in her business so it continues to grow.

Helen is 50 years old, married and has 7 children, ages 12, 17, 18, 21, 25, 28, and 32. In addition to her 7 children, she also cares for 5 dependants. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Vumilia, Hadija, Vaileth and Pili.

loans.use: To buy a basket of sugar and a bucket of oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase medical equipment and make clinic renovations.

loans.name: Moul

texts.en:
Moul K., 39, is married and resides with her husband in the Siem Reap, Cambodia.  This couple has four children and all of them are students. To support her family, she sells rice and other food in the village, and is able to make $5 of profit a day. Besides, selling rice and other food she also grows vegetables on a plot of land behind her house. Her husband, pictured above, is a cow dealer. He purchases and sells cows and makes $5 a day, too. 

Moul K. would like to take out a loan of $1000 to purchase more cows for her husband’s business and expand her cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase more cows and to cultivate more vegetables.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha B. is twenty eight years old. She is single with no children. She owns and operates a beauty and Rasta hairdo salon in her neighborhood. 
Martha is a very skillful and talented hair dresser who adds a lot of beauty to the hair of her many customers and that is her secret. Martha uses weavons and meshes to plait her clients' hair to add beauty to them. She has been doing this for four years now.  
She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service and therefore she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, mesh, threads etc. to avoid shortage and poor servicing. 
She is in a community group called By His Grace. Training was organized for her so that when your help is given, she would be able to use it to achieve her business goal of increased efficiency and profitability.
Her picture was taken when she was busily plaiting her customer’s hair.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, thread, needle etc.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.es:
La Sra. Iluminada vive en un barrio bajo de la capital, denominada barrio de la Chacarita, allí cuenta con una despensa la cual es su fuente de ingresos económicos. La despensa esta surtida con varios tipos de mercaderías, siendo especialmente su punto fuerte la venta de bebidas bien frías. 
 
Empezó con un pequeño Kiosco, después gracias a sus ganancias empezó a crecer y se animo a quitar créditos con nuestra entidad. El crédito actual es para la compra de más mercaderías, tales como frutas, verduras, carne, pollos, productos no perecederos y otros tipos de mercaderías.

Vale la pena destacar que ha crecido mucho comercialmente, con ayuda de la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
Mrs. Illumindada lives in a neighborhood below the capital, a neighborhood named La Chacarita, where she relies on her provisions shop for economic improvement. The provisions shop has a selection of various types of merchandise, of which the strong point is the sales of well-chilled drinks. She began with a small kiosk, after which, thanks to her earnings, the shop began to grow, and she was encouraged to take out a loan for the shop. The actual loan is for buying more merchandise, things like fruits, vegetables, meat, chickens, nonperishables, and other types of merchandise. She thinks it worthwhile to point out that the shop has been growing with the help of the Paraguayan Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Misty McNally, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to resell such as: meat, chicken, cheese, flour, canned food, drinks, rice, etc.

loans.name: Kerly

texts.es: Kerly es una jovencita de 21 años, muy alegre y trabajadora, vive sola en su casa propia y tiene muchos deseos de progresar y salir adelante. Todavía es muy joven pero sabe que tiene que trabajar mucho para mejorar su vida, ella atiende en su pequeña bodega todo el día, y cuando llegan los clientes los atiende con una sonrisa y los trata muy bien. A ella le gusta mucho vender y conversar con sus clientes, espera mejorar su tienda incrementando la cantidad de productos que vende. Lo que menos le gusta de su negocio es permanecer todo el día dentro, ya que es muy frígido, pero eso no le es un impedimento para luchar por alcanzar sus sueños de tener una mejor calidad de vida. Kerly se encuentra en su primer préstamo con MFP, tiene muchas ganas de pagarlo puntualmente, ya que no quiere causar problemas en su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por las demás socias. Con el dinero que solicita incrementará su capital de trabajo, con lo cual comprará más productos para implementar mejor su bodega.
texts.en:
Kerly, 21, is a happy and hard-working young woman. She lives in her own house and has a strong drive to get ahead. Even though she's very young, she knows that she has to work hard to improve her life. She tends her small grocery all day and when customers come she helps them with a smile and treats them well. She very much likes selling and talking with her customers. She hopes to improve her store by increasing the quantity of products she sells. The part of her work that she likes least is being inside all day because it's very cold. That doesn't stop her, though, from striving toward her dream of having a better quality of life. This is Kerly's first MFP loan. She very much wants to repay it on time because she doesn't want to cause problems at her community bank where she is very dear to the other members. With the loan, she will buy more products to better stock her grocery.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase supply of merchandise for grocery business.

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru: Шарипова Робия проживает в районе Гиссар. Разведена и имеет двоих детей. Возраст 33 года. Для того, чтобы обеспечивать детей ей приходится много работать. Имеет столик где торгует продуктами питания. За кредитом обратилась с целью пристроить навес, который спасет ее товар от солнца . Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Robiya S. lives in the Gissar region. She is divorced and has two children. She is 33 years old. She has a work a lot to support her children. She has a table where she sells food. She is asking for a loan to build a cover for her vendor space to protect her merchandise from the sun. She can pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a cover

loans.name: Claudia Araceli

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Araceli vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, ella trabaja en una fabrica desde hace 3 años, y a parte obtienen otro ingreso mediante la venta de quesos y chorizo. Su esposo el señor Ramón labora para una panadería con una antigüedad de 8 años. 
Como una familia responsable, trabajadora y unida, están solicitando este crédito para comprar más mercancía.
texts.en:
Mrs. Claudia Araceli lives with her husband and three children. She has worked in a factory for the past 3 years. She also makes money by selling cheeses and chorizo. Her husband Mr. Ramon has worked in a bakery for the past 8 years. As a responsible family they work hard and they are close. They are asking for a loan so that they will be able to buy more merchandise.

(Translated by Ryan of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cheeses and chorizo to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of charcoal for re-sale

loans.name: Claber Jasinta

texts.es:
