La señora Claber Jasinta C. H. tiene 57 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen del Carmen, vive en la calle Alfonso Ugarte del sector Cochaya caserío de Salpo, de la provincia de Otuzco departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta cuarto grado de educación primaria, pero no continuó estudiando porque no tenía apoyo de sus padres.
Se casó a los 19 años y tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 dependen de ella.
Su actividad económica consiste en la cria de animales, fabricación de queso y quesillo.
El primer crédito recibido fue de 300 soles los que canceló en 4 cuotas, recuerda con mucha alegría que con el primer préstamo compró queso, carne de cerdo y carnero, los que volvió a vender a muy buen precio.
Con este crédito de 500 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en medicina (fertilizantes) para la chacra.
Claber sueña con tener un buen capital para poder invertir en negocios diversos.
texts.en:
Señora Claber Jasinta C. H. is 57 and belongs to the Virgen del Carmen communal bank. She lives in the town of Salpo, in the province of Otuzco, in the department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied through fourth grade but didn't continue studying because she didn't have the support of her parents. She got married at 19 and has 5 children, 3 of whom still depend on her economically. She raises animals and makes cheese. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she paid off in 4 months. She remembers her first loan fondly and used it to buy cheese, pork, and mutton, which she resold for a good price. With this credit of 500 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in fertilizers for her farm. Claber dreams about having a good amount of capital to be able to invest in diverse businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
GLORIA DEL CARMEN R. V. DE LIMA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “LORETO” con domicilio en el Jr. LORETO N° 241, del distrito de Callería, tiene 35 años, 02 hijos, y su esposo es empleado público.

Tenía un negocio de venta de ropas y la primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compro algunas prendas más y afianzo su negocio, pero por algunos inconvenientes que tuvo dejo por un tiempo el negocio y hoy se encuentra alquilando su moto taxis.

Hoy continùa con el negocio del alquiler de mototaxi y con el préstamo  de S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en la compra de gaseosas y  repuestos, que son necesarios para que trabajen tranquilos, sin ningún inconveniente.

Gloria se siente realizada y contenta por que el negocio que actualmente viene ejerciendo, le ayuda a cubrir todas las necesidades de la casa.
texts.en:
GLORIA DEL CARMEN R. V. OF LIMA, belongs to the “LORETO” Community Bank. She lives at 241 LOTETO St., in the Callería district. She is 35 years old, has two children and her husband is a civil servant.

She had a business selling clothes and received a loan of 300.00 PEN the first time. She bought some more clothes and strengthened her business but had to leave it for a while due to some inconveniences she had. Today she rents her motorcycle taxi.

Today she continues with her business renting her motorcycle taxi. She will invest the loan for 1,200.00 PEN in the purchase of sodas and spare parts which are necessary to work without worrying about inconveniences.

Gloria feels fulfilled and happy because the business she is currently running helps cover all household necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sodas and spare parts for motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Mary Lyn

texts.en: Mrs. Mary Lyn E. has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since November 30, 2007. She is a bonafide resident of Rizal, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is married and has two children who are in school. She is a Public School Teacher earning 5,000 pesos a month. Her other source of income comes from a motorcycle with a daily income of 150 to 200. Recently, she's requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000.00 for the purpose of housing repair. She's thankful to the Paglaum Coop because she has been given the chance to avail the programs and services of the Cooperative. And it helps them a lot especially when it comes to financial problems. And for her children, she hopes that they will be able to finish their studies and continue support until college and find a decent and stable job someday.

loans.use: For house repair

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of goods

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Zenaida es casada, tiene 38 años y 1 hijo, Zenaida culmino sus estudios de educación, Zenaida tiene una tienda en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde brinda el servicio de fotocopiado y también vende repuestos de fotocopiadoras. Además junto a su mama tienen un puesto de venta de especerías.
Zenaida necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ají colorado.
Los sueños de Zenaida son sacar su titulo profesional y ampliar su tienda.
texts.en:
Zenaida is a member of the Amor Divino Microfinance Institute.

Zenaida is a 38-year-old married mother with 1 son. She completed her education. She owns a store in downtown Ayacucho where she provides copy services and sells spare parts for copy machines. Additionally, she and her mother run a spice stand.

Zenaida needs a 600.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing red hot peppers.

Zenaida dreams of getting her degree and of expanding her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase red hot peppers

loans.name: Eddy Enrique

texts.es: Eddy Enrique D. P. tiene 40 años. Su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de materiales de construcción. A Eddy siempre le ha gustado el trabajo, este negocio lo obtuvo por su Papa ya que anteriormente era él quien se hacía cargo. Pero debido a su edad no pudo continuar y el enseño a Eddy a manejar el negocio, a él le gusta mucho esta humilde actividad porque es una buena manera de sacar a su hijo adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima como cemento, arena, palas y otras herramientas para la elaboración de los bloques. Su deseo es obtener una maquinaria industrializada para facilitar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Eddy Enrique D. P. is 40 years old. He produces and sells construction materials. Eddy has always enjoyed his work, a business that he took over from his father. Due to his age, Eddy’s father could not continue managing the business.

Eddy says his work is the best way for him to help his son get ahead. He will designate his loan as operating capital to buy raw materials such as cement, sand, shovels and other tools needed to make blocks. He hopes to obtain industrial machinery to facilitate his work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Mamor Agha Jan Group

texts.en:
Mamor Agha jan is the group leader of Mamor Agha Jan group. There are three members in this group and they each want to take a loan to progress their business and make it larger. So they are requesting a group loan of 30,000 Afghani.
pary Jan  wants to take a loan for her son’s business of general store.
Mamor Agha Jan wants to take a loan for his business mechanic shop. Also Nor Rabkhan wants to take a loan for his business of repallring car. 
They are very thankful to Kiva lenders who are able to support the whole world.

loans.use: they are support their families

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua is thirty years old. She is divorced and has given birth to one son and one daughter, both of whom currently attend school. Akosua works hard to provide for her family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. 

Akosua trades in printed textiles—fancy, java and wax prints. She sells them in the community market and treks to other towns to hawk her goods as well. Akosua procures her goods from textile depots in Kumasi, a nearby city. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Ena Marisol

texts.es: Ena Marisol H. D. H. D. 31 años D. edad, resiD. en Colon en el departamento D. La Libertad., vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos aun menores D. edad y estudiantes. Ena  ha fabricado su propio horno a base D. ladrillos y cementos, el cual hoy le permite manejar su propia negocio una panadería  donD. se elaboran variedades D. pan, el crédito que solita Ena es para compra D. insumos que le permitan seguir solidificando su negocio .
texts.en:
Ena Marisol H. D. H., 31, lives in Colon in the La Libertad department. She lives with her husband and their two children. The children are minors who go to school. Ena has maD. her own oven from bricks and cement. The oven allows her to manage her own business, a bakery. She makes a variety of breads. The loan that Ena is asking for is to buy supplies that will allow her to keep solidifying her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to make bread

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es: María Lourdes es una mujer emprendedora y entusiasta, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali , tiene 54 años y es madre de cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, se dedica a la costura actividad que lo desarrolla en su casa, es viuda, pero sus hijos la apoyan. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Activas” desde hace cuatro años, el primer préstamo fue de 300 soles que invirtió en  telas, en la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que le permitirá renovar su pequeño taller de costura. El sueño de María Lourdes es construir cuartos para alquilarlos y seguir trabajando  para salir adelante.
texts.en:
María Lourdes is an enterprising and enthusiastic woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa which is in the Ucayali region. María Lourdes is 54 years old and the mother of four adult children. She is a seamstress by trade and works out of her home. She is a widow and her children help support her.

María Lourdes joined the Communal Bank “Las Activas” four years ago. Her first loan was for 300 soles and she used it to buy fabric. She now needs a loan of 1000 soles to renovate her small sewing workshop. Her future plans include constructing rooms for rent and continuing to work to stay ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make renovations to her sewing workshop

loans.name: Malamanu

texts.en: Malamuna is a 50-year-old local restaurant operator, who is married and has seven children. She started her operations seven years ago. She prepares and sells local foods like omotuo (rice balls), banku and other local dishes. Omotuo is prepared from rice, taken with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. With her tasty meals she has attracted lots of customers in the area where she serves, therefore it has become necessary to employ additional hands to assist her in food delivery service. She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditure. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, rice, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare the meals. She would be grateful for the loan assistance.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Ylda Gabina

texts.es:
La señora Gabina es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 45 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 7 hijos, vive en Ccotos, estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora esta trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace varios años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de pescado.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, comprará una máquina tejedora para facilitar su trabajo, puesto que ahora se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías tales como prendas de vestir, también elabora bordados en bayeta.

Su mayor deseo es poder poner una casa para hospedaje en Ccotos.

A ella le  gustan  las facilidades, los préstamos y las charlas.
texts.en:
Gabina, 45, is a member of the “Juchuy Niño” communal bank located in the Capachica district, Puno province, Puno district. She is married, has 7 children, and lives in Ccotos. She finished secondary school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past several years; her initial 300 sol loan was used to increase her working capital in her fish sales business. Currently, she needs a new loan of 3000 new soles to buy a knitting machine to facilitate her work since now she is involved in making handicrafts such as articles of clothing. She also does embroidery on flannel. Her greatest wish is to set up a boarding house in Ccotos. She likes the terms, the loans, and the talks.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Ziyad

texts.en:
Ziyad is a Palestinian man living in the Al-Shiekh Radwan neighborhood in Gaza City. He is married with five children and the eldest is studying in the university.

Ziyad is an employee in the Palestinian National Authority in addition to owning this grocery store. He bought this store from his brother last year since he wanted to increase his income as he has a big family and most of them are still very young. In addition, his eldest son could help him in managing the store.

Ziyad requested 2,000 USD to buy more goods for his shop in order to have a variety of products to meet his customers’ requirements. He also wants to fix the motor of the freezer he has in the shop.

Ziyad appears in the photo at his store.

loans.use: To purchase more products for his grocery store

loans.name: Risel

texts.en:
Risel L. is from the city of Santa Cruz Tangub City. She is 23 years old. Risel is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Risel owns & operates a single motor transport service. Risel has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Risel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Risel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Risel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa V. is 30 years old and has three children. Her eldest is only 8 years old and is currently studying in the elementary grades. She is a farmer who owns a small parcel of farmland in Santa Josefa, Agusan del Sur. 

Now she is busy preparing the soil for another planting season. She would like to request a loan of Php 15,000 to buy the farm supplies she needs. The loan will truly help her sustain her business and ensure the healthy growth of her crops. With this loan, she will have a better harvest and income to support her family.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El banco D. Emprendimiento " RENACER "  se encuentra en su cuarto  ciclo  todas las integrantes han demostrado ser personas responsables, cumplidas  y trabajadoras, este grupo esta representada por las siguientes socias:
Como Presidenta esta la Sra. Daysi quien es la lider y fundadora del grupo, tiene el negocio D. venta D. shampu y  ambula en la cancha los dìas D. feria, Esta casada  y tiene 3 hijos con esta actividad ella mantiene el hogar y el estudio D. sus hijos. 

Como Tesorera esta la  Sra.Donata esta casada y tiene 3 hijos su negocio es  venta D. verduras  quien demostrò ser  una persona muy responsable y puntual con sus cuotas.

La secretaria es la Sra. Mirian quien es casada y  tiene un hijo,  tiene el negocio D. venta verduras,  y es una persona  activa y motivadora.

Estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The "RENACER" communal bank is in its fourth loan cycle; all of its members have shown themselves to be responsible, hard-working people. The group is represented by the following: Daysi, president, is the leader and founding member; she sells shampoo and, on feast days, she peddles her wares in the square. She is married and has three children. Her work supports the household and provides education for her children. Donata, treasurer, is married and has three children. She sells vegetables and has demonstrated being a very responsible and punctual person with regard to repayments. Mirian, secretary, is married and has one son. She sells vegetables and is an active and motivating person. They are grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for trusting them enough to grant the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase.

loans.name: Nialing

texts.fr: Nialing B. est une femme de 57 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 6 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 8 ans et a eu 16 expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait la transformation et vente de jus de fruits, elle vend également une bouillie à base de céréales locales. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Nialing B. is a 57-year-old woman. She is a widow and the mother of six children whom she cares for. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois for eight years and has had 16 experiences with loans. Nialing makes fruit juice and sells it. She also sells porridge made from a base of local grains. Her profits allow her to take care of her children and provide for their personal needs.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her commercial activity

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion B., age 37, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Aladino B. Jr., an electrician, and they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She manages her own ukay-ukay (second-hand imported clothing) business.

Concepcion has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow five times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her ukay-ukay business.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 12,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business. She will use her loan to buy more clothing to sell.

She dreams about having a modest-sized place to sell her products. This will improve her income so she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida D. is from the village of Brgy. Lactawan, Solano, Neuva Vizcaya. She is 59 years old. Leonida is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Leonida owns & operates a tricycle transport service. Leonida has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Leonida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase tires and other accessories. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Leonida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
Anzhela is married with two children. She runs a small men's clothing store in the local marketplace in Beregovo, Western Ukraine. She has had this business for 14 years and currently has an inventory worth 10,000 Grivnyas. Her monthly profit amounts to 3,000 Grivnyas. 

Anzhela is seeking a 6,500 Grivnya loan to re-stock her seasonal inventory. Better selection of merchandise will help her increase her sales and her income as a result. She is a skilled and experienced market vendor who has built up a loyal clientele.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her mama lishe

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: Don Gustavo  de 60 años de edad es casado con la Sra. Maria Auxiliadora Valverde y es padre de familia de 3 hijos, uno trabaja y estan estudiando secundaria y la universidad.  Gustavo labora como guarda de seguridad para MINSA Juigalpa  desde hace 3 años, esta solicitando su 3er credito para levantar una pared interna de 10 mts y hacer la division de los dormitorios de su casa para de esta manera contar con mayor privacidad. Su mayor anhelo es mejorar su vivienda poco a poco y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia para asi brindarles mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Don Gustavo is 60 years old and married to Maria Auxiliadora Valverde. He is the father of three children one who works and the others who are attending high school and university. Gustavo works as a security guard for MINSA (the Ministry of Health) in Juigalpa which he has been doing for three years. He is asking for his third loan to erect a wall inside his house to divide two rooms to achieve greater privacy. His main goal is to improve his home little by little and improve the quality of life for his family and offer them greater security.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: erect a wall between two rooms

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en: Ebenezer has a grinding machine that he uses to grind foodstuffs for his customers.  Ebenezer has been in this business for long.Ebenezer hopes to grow his business to become bigger and stronger in the future.  He is 59 years old, married with 4 children. He is requesting for a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase a grinding machine. He says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding machine

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur is 41 years old, married, and has children aged between 3 and 17 years old. All of the children, except one, attend school. Arthur is a farmer from near Kitale town, Western Kenya, where he has been farming for 17 years. His main produce is tomatoes and vegetables, which he sells to the local market. Arthur is also a mason and earns income from the services he provides to the local market.
Arthur recently completed his second loan from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, for 33,000 KES. He has requested a new loan of 34,320 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says this loan will enable him to purchase a dairy cow that will produce enough milk for consumption and sale. He faces the challenge of market research and animal diseases. In future, he would like to supply his milk to the Kenya Cooperative Creameries.
Arthur says that the loan he has been given has helped him to be a dairy farmer and he appreciates the support he has been given by Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Masedonia

texts.es: Masedonia, de 47 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su hijo, que es mayor.Desde hace 6 años, se dedica a la venta de enseres, golosinas y regalos en general, en un puesto que tiene en un mercado muy concurrido, que esta ubicado por la zona donde  vive. Ella  se siente muy contenta con su trabajo, pues con sus vecinas de puesto ha hecho buena amistad y además realiza su trabajo tranquilamente, ofreciendo la variedad de sus productos a sus clientes. Las ventas son buenas, porque su puesto esta muy bien ubicado, además su carisma y buen trato a la clientela han hecho que su negocio sea visitado frecuentemente, es por eso que le pone todo el empeño a su trabajo y en el futuro espera verlo mas amplio y mejor implementado.Es el primer préstamo con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual en los pagos de todas sus cuotas.Masedonia tiene planeado invertir el dinero del crédito en comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Masedonia is 47 years old and lives in her own home with her adult son. For the past six years, she has been selling personal accessories, candy, and gifts from a vending post at a well-known market in the district where she lives. She is very happy with her work because it has allowed her to develop good friendships with other vendors in the market. Masedonia is able to work peacefully and offers a variety of products to her customers. Her sales are good because her post is in a good location. Due to her charisma and the good service she provides her customers, her business is visited frequently. She invests all of her efforts into her work and in the future she hopes expand and improve her business.

This is her first loan with MFP. Masedonia promises to be prompt with all of her payments. She plans to invest the funds from her loan in a large quantity of merchandise to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make home improvements, adding brick and plastering the walls of his house

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: ce monsieur exerce comme activité généartrice de revenu le commerce de téléphones portables, des cartes de recharges et des accessoires, il exerce ce commerce à akodessewa qui est un quartier dynamique. il a commencé ce commerce en 2003. il veut gonfler son stock pour accroître ses recettes, il sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour compléter ses économies et acheter  des téléphones portables, des cartes de recharge, de même que les accessoires. il est marié et père d'un enfant c'est avec le revenu de son commerce qu'il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This gentleman makes his living selling mobile phones, prepaid cards and accessories. His business is based in Akodessewa, a bustling neighborhood; he started it in 2003. To increase turnover, he wants to build his inventory, and so is asking WAGES for a loan to buy phones, cards and accessories. He is married and has one child. With his income he is able to pay for his family's needs.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy mobile phones, prepaid cards and accessories

loans.name: Zamira's Group

texts.en:
Many people have given up their regular occupations and started to engage in trade and commerce. The heroes of our story are also making their efforts towards improving their standard of living by trading in different things. Zamira S. is the leader of this group. She is 38, divorced and has raised her daughter by herself. To make a living and provide for herself and her daughter, she sells pants and women’s clothes in “Kyial” market. She has been doing this job for the last sixteen years and has been able to build a house. Now her monthly income averages about 20,000 KGS. She started in business by selling vegetables and then switched to clothes. Zamira is very active and does her job with passion and enthusiasm. She hopes to get married again and have a son. At this moment, Zamira needs a loan in order to purchase goods.

Zamira’s partners:

Sulaika S., 50, is a mother of three children. She sells secondhand clothes in a small shop. Eight years ago she sold her cow and purchased clothes in a shop. She then took these clothes to a big market and resold them, thus starting her business. Now she needs a loan to purchase children’s clothes.

Almabubu M., 47, is a widow and has raised her three children herself. Almabubu makes her living by selling jeans. She manages to earn 28,000 KGS a month. Almabubu hopes to obtain this loan and purchase clothes for the fall season. After selling clothes, she plans to save money to pay for her son’s college education.

Jyldyzbek K., 36, is single. He sells men’s clothes. Due to his business, he has been able to buy a flat and a car. Now Jyldyzbek needs a loan to purchase goods. He hopes to save enough money and get married.

Burulsun A., 33, is single. She is involved in selling clothes in the market. She has been doing this job for six years and has bought a one room flat. Now Burulsun needs a loan in order to purchase men’s and women’s clothes. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase goods

loans.name: Baktylu's Group

texts.en:
Baktylu S. is the leader of the group. She is 38, married and has four children who all attend school. Ten years ago, with the initial investment of 15,000 soms, Baktylu started to sell shoes at the market. In this way she makes 10,000 soms per month. That profit has made it possible for her to save money and start building a new house. She will use the loan to purchase more shoes to increase the turnover of her business. In the future, she wants to finish building her house and then purchase a vehicle.

Samara T. K., 33, is married.  She has two children who are both at school. Samara sells national Kyrgyz drinks (maksym shoro). With the loan, she wants to purchase a variety of shoes and start her own business. In the future she wants to build a house in Bishkek.

Kuljamila A., 61, is a widow.  She has raised four children: three of them are married and live separately with their families. Kuljamila sells shoes at the market; she has been doing this for 30 years. She earns 10,000 soms per month. With the loan, she wants to purchase shoes to increase the turnover of her business. 

Jyrgal B. is the treasurer of the group. She is 40 and divorced. She has a six-year-old daughter. Two years ago, with the initial investment of 15,000 soms, Jyrgal started to sell convenience goods at the market. She earns 20,000 soms per month. With the loan, she wants to increase the turnover of her business. In the future she plans to start repairing her flat. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: 041008-Giang Son- Hoang Truong Group

texts.en:
Sen N. T. (91) is a 23-year-old woman living in the town of Hoang Hoa.  Sen is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 041008-Giang Son- Hoang Truong (041008-Giang Son- Hoang Truong).

Sen is singL. and does not have any chlidren.  To make a living, Sen operates a family member's fishing business.  The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling wild-caught fish in the local community.  Sen has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, Sen joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Sen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  She is now requesting a new loan of 4,248,000 VND which will also be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Sen plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Chinh N. T. (108) is a 37-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

2.  Mao P. T. (128) is a 48-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

3.  Yen L. T. (129) is a 19-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her fishing business.

4.  Huyen L. T. (130) is a 27-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her fishing business.

5.  Thuan P. T. (107) is a 31-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

6.  Tinh N. T. (131) is a 59-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her  fishing business.

7.  Thuc N. T. (104) is a 40-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

8.  Hien P. T. (132) is a 34-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her fishing business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Sen N. T. (91) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa.  Sen là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 9 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 041008-Giang Son- Hoang Truong (041008-Giang Son- Hoang Truong).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở biển trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Sen thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Sen kiếm được khoảng 1,500,000 VND.  Vào 2009, Sen đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Sen đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua T.ết bị đánh cá bao gồm lưỡi câu & lưới.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,248,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Chinh N. T. (108) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


2.  Mao P. T. (128) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


3.  Yen L. T. (129) là 19 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


4.  Huyen L. T. (130) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


5.  Thuan P. T. (107) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


6.  Tinh N. T. (131) là 59 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


7.  Thuc N. T. (104) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


8.  Hien P. T. (132) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda B. is 49 years old and married to Emelian, 67 years old - a farmer. They have two children, age 32 and 30 respectively. The family sources of income are farming and selling “taho” a vitamin-rich snack. It is a delicious snack with the following ingredients: processed soy beans, jelly and syrup. The family prepares and sells it to the community and in other localities. 

Erlinda is a member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. a partner micro-finance institution of KIVA in the Philippines since 2000. She’s been a very dedicated and active member of the institution. She joined ASHI to have access to capital to develop their food production business. She is applying for another loan of Php 25,000 to finance this business. The demand for their products starting this month is high that is why she needs more capital to buy raw materials for the production and additional aluminum basins for their vendors to use. Her dream is to construct an appropriate preparation area and increase their production. She believes that her business can also provide employment in their community and not just sustain their family needs.  She hopes that ASHI and KIVA will support her in these aspirations.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as soy beans, sugar, jelly and aluminum basins

loans.name: Sobeh Association Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Sobeh Association” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 for each of them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Rugiatu T.. Rugiatu is 35 years old and was born in a place called Komrabai in northern Sierra Leone. She is married with four children. Her husband is a teacher and her children are attending primary and secondary schools.  For 15 years now, Rugiatu has been selling palm oil and firewood. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying palm oil and firewood in large quantity.

loans.use: To buy palm oil and firewood in large quantity

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda D. is a 59-year-old married woman who supports her family by farming and fishing. She lives in Purok Sampaguita, Brgy. Talacagay, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental. Luzminda has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her farming and fishing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Luzminda is now borrowing PHP 12,000 so that she can continue to fund the operations of her farmland. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey towards economic freedom. Luzminda aspires to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund operations

loans.name: Mitzy

texts.es: Mitzy, de 31 años, vive a lado de su esposo Juan de 32 años, que es confeccionista  y de sus 2 hijos menores, juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Desde hace 1 año, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de ropa y la modalidad de su trabajo es la siguiente: compra ropa al por mayor en un gran emporio comercial de la ciudad y trae por pedidos a los  clientes de su zona. Esta muy satisfecha por su trabajo ya que no tiene un horario fijo lo que le permite no descuidar la crianza de sus hijos; además ofrece algunas prendas que confecciona su esposo en el taller donde labora. Sin embargo no le gusta cuando sus clientes le hacen pedidos y luego desisten, lo que le ocasiona que debe colocar su mercadería a otras personas; pero a pesar de las dificultades sigue adelante pues quiere progresar. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el fututo quiere instalar un negocio propio ya que desea mejorar sus ganancias. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y promete cancelar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que les permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso; también esta muy contenta con el desempeño de su grupo pues esta integrado por personas solidarias y responsables como ella. Mitzy tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería de ropa, pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes por cumplir y espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Mitzy is 31 years old and she lives together with her husband and their two young children. Her husband Juan is 32 years old and he is tailor.  Together they work hard every day to make ends meet. For the past year, this enterprising woman has been selling clothing. Her business is conducted in the following way: clothing is purchased in wholesale at a large shopping district in the city and buys merchandise to fill orders placed by clients in her community. She is very happy with her work because she doesn't have a fixed schedule which is very useful while raising her children. She is also able to sell some of the clothing items that her husband makes in his shop.  She doesn't appreciate it when orders placed are then rejected by the clients, forcing her to sell to other persons. But despite the difficulties she is able to progress in her business. She is en enterprising person and in the future she wants to have her own store in order to improve her earnings. This is her first loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to making her payments on time. She does not want to cause hardship for the other members of the team especially because it is through them that she is able to continue her business. She is also very happy with her group because they are team players and very responsible, like she is. Mitzy plans on investing her loan in the purchase of clothing to fill various outstanding orders. She hopes to see an improvement in her income.

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol” ubicado en el distrito de Paucarcolla, provincia de Puno, departamento de Puno, tiene 61 años de edad, de estado civil casada, con seis hijos y tiene grado de instrucción de tercero de educación secundaria.
La señora, nos cuenta que del departamento de Tacna trae diferentes mercaderías para llevarlo a la ciudad de Cusco, entre ellos buzos y polares; de la misma manera de Desaguadero trae cubrecamas, sábanas y muchos otros para también llevarlo a la ciudad ya mencionada. Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual le permitió incrementar la mercadería de su negocio.
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 1700.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá aumentar la mercadería de su negocio.
Su sueño es seguir adelante con su negocio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son los meses de gracia y los intereses de los ahorros.
texts.en:
Teodora is a member of the “Santiago Apóstol” community bank which is located in Paucarcolla district, in Puno province, in the department of Puno.  She is 61 years old, married and has six children.  She studied up to the third year of her secondary education.

Teodora tells us that she brings different merchandise from the department of Tacna to the city of Cusco, including sweatshirts and fleeces.  She also brings bedspreads, sheets and many other things from Desaguadero to Cusco.  She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles and it allowed her to increase her business' merchandise.

She is now requesting a new loan for 1,700 nuevos soles which she will again use to increase her business' merchandise.

Her dream is to continue on with her business.  What she most likes about her community bank is the months of grace which they offer on payments and the interest she makes on her savings.

loans.use: To increase the merchandise in her business selling bedspreads, sheets, etc.

loans.name: Lidia Mercedes

texts.es: Lidia Mercedes tiene 33 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 12 años que busca la forma de mantener a su familia ya que es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Es una mujer muy luchadora y que disfruta de su actividad y así disfruta de interactuar con sus clientes, fue por una amiga que inicio este medio de vida pues al ver que proporcionaba ciertas ganancias a su hogar. El destino del crédito es para la compra de materia prima como ropa en general, toallas, sabanas, calzado y cosméticos.
texts.en: Lidia Mercedes is 33 and has sold general merchandise for a living for 12 years as a way to support her family since she is a single mother of 4 young children.  She is a spirited woman who enjoys her work and enjoys interacting with her customers.  She got into this business because of a friend.  She saw how her friend earned some income for her home.  The loan is to purchase raw materials like clothing, towels, bedspreads, shoes, and cosmetics.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Maria Auxiliadora tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación. Es una mujer muy emprendedora por lo que siempre ha sido una persona muy responsable. Pues siempre le ha gustado busca la manera de sacar a su familia adelante. el motivo de su crédito es para la compra de sabanas, adornos, ropa en general, perfumes entre otros.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora has a business selling general merchandise. She has been this business for more than three years and has been working with Fundación Leon 2000 for a long time. Maria is an enterprising woman who has always demonstrated that she is a very responsible woman. She is always looking for ways for her family to get ahead.

The reason for this loan is to buy bed sheets, decorations, clothing, perfumes, and other items.

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase a variety of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his brother's wedding party

loans.name: Samson Chengo

texts.en:
Samson Chengo N. is a 52-year old businessman from Voi, Taru. He is married to Vallentina and together they have 8 children.


Samson owns a butcher shop and has been in this business for the last 26 years. With this loan, he plans to buy goats to add meat stock since many of his customers like goat meat because of it's softness. He will also buy hides and skins for sale. 

The anticipated profits will be directed to the expansion of his business. He hopes to succeed through subsequent KADET loans.

loans.use: To buy goats to add meat stock, and buy hides and skins for sale

loans.name: Sohibnazar

texts.ru: Холиков Сохибназар проживает в районе Яван. Ему 40 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Работает на рынке Мехргон. У него имеется пекарня, где он печет лепешки в печи (тандур). Этим видом деятельности занимается 6 лет. Кредит берет для покупки муки.
texts.en: Sohibnazar K., 40, lives in Yavan. He is married with four children. He has secondary education and works at the Mekhgon market. He has his own tandoor, a traditional oven, where he bakes bread. Sohibnazar has been in this business for six years, and is applying for a loan to purchase flour.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Jasmine's Group

texts.en:
Jasmine L. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Philippines. She is 31 years old. Jasmine is the group leader for a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jasmine is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jasmine owns and operates a business venture in the food sector.  The income for her business comes primarily from selling seafood such as fish and shrimp in the local community. Jasmine has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jasmine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jasmine is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jasmine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Ecelia

texts.en:
Ecelia P. is from the town of Banga. She is 48 years old. Ecelia is married and has 3 children aged 24, 20 and 18. To make a living, Ecelia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn and rice for sale. Ecelia does her best to support her children. She dreams of a bright futures for them.

Ecelia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ecelia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ecelia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 32 years old. He is married with four children between 2 and 17 years old. Theogene owns a business selling various products like beans, rice etc. This business is well organized. Theogene has been in this business for five years. He employs two persons to help him. The hours of his daily activities are from 8am until 4pm every day.

Theogene has now requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing more products for his shop. This loan will help Theogene satisfy his customers. With the profit, Theogene will be reinvesting in his business and paying school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet R. is from the village of Imbatuhon, Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Juliet is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling coconuts for copras (coconut meat for making oil) in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconuts to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 45 years old and married with 4 children.  She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Virginia is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Virginia has been fattening pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from a tricycle business and livestock raising (ducks).  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly V. is from the village of Paradise, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 51 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Shirly owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, detergents, instant noodles, shampoo, soap, and beverages in the local community. Shirly has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Shirly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shirly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. Shirly is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, detergents, and  beverages. This loan will be Shirly's fifth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, detergents, and beverages

loans.name: Viviana Felisa

texts.es: La señora Viviana, madre soltera con una niña como hija es buena la satisfacción saber que es una señora que lucha en la vida por valores de crecimiento en mejorar la educación de su hija, la actividad que tiene es la producción de comida en una pensión propio y fijo ubicado en la zona de Colcapirhua frente y gracias al apoyo de emprender con el dinero del crédito comprara insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas, como abarrotes, papa y aceite por mayor, es una actividad sacrificada pero rentable, inicio su negocio hace mucho tiempo atrás de manera muy simple obteniendo buenos resultados debido  a esta razón solicito crédito en la institución  siendo este un emprendimiento de una señora que tiene como meta en la vida mejorar su calidad de vida gracias al esfuerzo que realiza durante 6 días de la semana y asi de la misma manera pueda mejorar su forma de vivir de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Viviana is a single mother of a daughter.  It’s quite satisfying to know that she’s a woman who fights in life for values in growth to improve her daughter’s education.

Her business is producing food in a fixed eatery she has in the Colcapirhua zone.  Thanks to help from Emprender she will use the loan to buy ingredients with which to prepare her dishes like, groceries, potatoes and oil, at wholesale.

This is very demanding but profitable work.  She started it a long time ago very simply but obtaining good results.  Because of this she asked the Institution for a loan since this woman had the goal of improving her quality of life through the effort she puts into her work six days a week as well as improving their and her family’s way of living.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like groceries, potatoes and oil.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 53 years old and widow with 3 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lolita has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca weaving business.

Lolita has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius, 54 years old, is married and has two children. He repairs bicycles for his living in Marereni town in Malindi. The business gives the client a monthly income of about KES10,000 and it has been in existence for the last four years now.

Julius has been loaned KES10,000 by Kadet Limited and this serves as his first loan cycle from the company. He intends to use his loan to purchase spare parts needed to operate his business. The items he will purchase are spanners, spare wheels, tubes and grease for the wheels. From the anticipated profit from his business, he would like to continue looking after his family and continue educating one of his children, who is still in school.

In the future, Julius hopes to own a garage for motorcycles.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his bicycle business like spanners, spare wheels, tubes and grease for the wheels.

loans.name: Carlos Tulio De Jesus

texts.es:
Don Carlos es cultivador de legumbres en la vereda El Porvenir, el cultiva en su casa lulo, fríjol, tomate y otros, sin embargo en algunos momentos trabaja como jornalero en otras fincas.

Él con este trabajo sostiene su familia y para poder mantener su negocios necesita tener un crédito para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos y así la producción nace de excelente calidad y la puede vender a buen precio y así se incrementa sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Carlos grows vegetables in El Porvenir district.  He grows 'lulo' (a native fruit), beans, tomatoes and other crops.  However, sometimes he also works as a day laborer on other people's farms.

Through this work, Carlos supports his family.  In order to be able to keep his business running, he needs a loan so that he can maintain his crops and ensure an excellent-quality production which he can sell for a good price and thereby increase his income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julián de 53 años casado con Constanza de 50 años con quien tiene 5 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de puerto mayo del distrito de Pichari. A Julián le encanta su trabajo por que ama la naturaleza, desde hace varios años tenía en mente tener su propio negocio, desde entonces se dedica a la agricultura, es ahí que pone en práctica las técnicas para poder obtener una buena producción, en este caso cultiva y produce cacao. 
Julián para lograr su objetivo, trabaja desde muy temprano hasta que el sol se esconda, solo de esta manera podrá tener una producción de calidad. En su negocio le va muy bien, ya que con las ganancias obtenidas, podrán su familia prosperar. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de su apoyo para poder concretar con sus plantes. Por otro lado se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1.500 nuevos soles podrá invertirlo en la contratación de peones para que le ayuden en la limpieza y  mantenimiento de su parcela.
texts.en:
Julián, 53, is married to Constanza, 50, and has five children with her.  They live in their own house located in the community of Puerto Mayo in Pichari District.    

Julián loves his work because he enjoys nature.  He wanted to have a business of his own for several years now and since then has been farming.  He puts into practice there techniques to have good crops.  In this case, he’s growing cocoa beans.

To reach his goals, Julián starts to work very early and goes until the sun drops out of view; only thus can he obtain a high quality harvest.  He does very well in his business because profits obtained make it possible for his family to prosper.

This will be his third loan with MFP so he hopes to get your support to be able to make his plans a reality.  On the other hand, he commits to being punctual with his installment payments.  He will use the 1500 new soles to hire day laborers to help him weed and care for his plot of land.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, who is 58 years old, is a divorced mother of three children. Her children range in age from 22 to 32 years old. Jane owns a boutique as her main business. For the past 17 years, she has also run a cafeteria. She earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the funds to buy more utensils, tables, and seats for her cafeteria. She intends to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her grandchild. In the future, she hopes to own a modern restaurant.

loans.use: To buy utensils, tables, and seats for her cafeteria

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. Sarah has a retail shop. She has been in this business for over 10 years and she works seven days out of every week. Sarah sells her products in a shop at retail.  Sarah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal, cartons of salt, jerycans of cooking oil and boxes of soap. She generates additional income through tailoring. The main business challenges for Sarah include transportation, defaulters and the ever-increasing price of commodities in Uganda.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and a delivery van to ease in transportation. Sarah lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal, salt, soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 50-year-old married man living with his wife and three children. He has been working as a professional taxi driver for the past 20 years. In 2009, he bought a car and proceeded with his business operation independently. Despite his old age, he works hard to satisfy his family needs. Today, he is asking to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform the needed maintenance on his car. At his age, finding a job is such a difficult mission, so his car represents his only source of income. In the future, he is hoping to earn a higher income to be able to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his car

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia nació en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 42 años de edad. Actualmente, ella vive junto con sus tres hijos en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de menestras en el centro comercial el Molino II de la ciudad del Cusco,  ella tiene su propio puesto de venta y abre el local desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. En esta oportunidad Alicia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo pallares, lentejas, frejoles, soya y muchas cosas más. 

El Banco Comunal “El Molinito II” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Alicia was born in the city of Cusco, in Cusco department, Peru.  She is 42 years old and currently lives together with her three children in the same city in which she was born.  This is also where she carries out her business.  Alicia sells vegetables in the El Molino II shopping center, in the city of Cusco.  She has her own sales location which she opens from 6.00am to 8.00pm.  On this occasion, Alicia needs a loan to buy merchandise such as butter beans, lentils, kidney beans, soy beans, etc.

The 'El Molinito II' community bank meets every month in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is a very touristy, commercial area.  It is known for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta and is also home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machupicchu).

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as butter beans, lentils, kidney beans, soy beans, etc.

loans.name: Oloishuru

texts.en:
Oloishuru is 31 and married with one child. His monthly income is KES 8,000. He has been a farmer for the past five years. 

He was introduced to KADET by a registered client.This is his third loan, and he plans  to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer  and also pay labor for land preparation. He intends to reinvest the anticipated profit from the loan in other business and pay school fees for his child..

loans.use: buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer  and also pay labor for land preparation.

loans.name: Turwanyinzara Group

texts.fr:
Damascène fait partie du groupe TURWANYINZARA. Le nom du groupe signifie « Lutter contre la famine». Il est marié avec 10 enfants de 1 mois à 18 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. 

 Damascène est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de cultiver une race améliorée de riz dans un petit espace et récolter une grande quantité. Dans les prochaines années,Damascène voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs de riz au Rwanda. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer ses enfants jusqu’au niveau de l’université et s’autofinancer.
texts.en:
Damascène belongs to the TURWANYINZARA group. The group's name means "fight against famine." He is married and has 10 children, aged from 1 to 18, of whom 3 have received schooling. Damascène grows rice. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers and to pay for labor costs to grow rice. His strategy for expanding his business is to grow an improved type of rice in a small area and harvest a large quantity. In the next few years, Damascène would like to become one of the best rice growers in Rwanda.

With his profit, he intends to pay for his children's education up to university level, and to become financially self-sufficient

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and to pay for labor costs to grow rice.

loans.name: Muhereza

texts.en:
Muhereza is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is widowed and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past three years, Muhereza has been working hard to manage a garment shop where she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Muhereza is requesting a 2,000,000 KES loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more clothes to sell. Her loan will help Muhereza generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. She hopes to expand her business in the future. 

Muhereza is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Muhereza who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Musasa Group

texts.en: Lucia, 36, lives in Mucheke Masvingo with her husband and her two children, who are in school. She and her husband do the same business and have no other source of income. Lucia has been operating the business for the past eight years and she wants to buy more clothes to meet market demand. She is looking forward to taking her children to a better school as her business improves with this loan. In the next five years, she wishes to own a shop and buy a delivery car to make it easy to get orders.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Cita

texts.en:
Cita is a responsible and goal-oriented entrepreneur. She is 48 years old, married and has three children. Cita works hard to provide her family with a better living. Her family is happily living in the village of Turud Sur, Cordon. 

Cita operates a mini-grocery in her local community. She has had this kind of business for five years and she is able to earn about PHP 15,000 a month. She uses her generated income for her family's daily needs and payment of the electric bills monthly. She hopes that through her business, she can improve the standard of their living and save some amount for her emergency purposes. 

Cita is aiming to increase the volumes of her merchandise due to the demand of her customers. So, to make her goal come true she is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 which will be use in buying groceries such as cooking oil, beverages, snack foods, soft drinks, milk, coffee, sugar, canned goods, instant noodles, shampoo, biscuits and other products needed within their local community. She hopes that she can attain success through her patience and hard work in managing her business.

loans.use: buy groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señoras Lidia vive en una ribera muy bonita en la que siempre se estas nublada, ella es casada don el señor Delfino y con quien procreo siete hijos de los cuales todos están casados.
 
     Ella es ama de casa y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  ingredientes como son:  queso, aceite, royal, huevo, entre otros para la elaboración de panes  en la que lleva trabajando hace  cuatro años y nueve meses y le va bien ya que ha logrado agrandar mas su horno para coser los panes.

      Desde muy joven su mama le enseño a elaborar panes y cuando se caso  dejo de practicarlo pero hace cuatro años de nuevo inicio con la misma actividad y le va bien ya que le ha dejado buenas ganancias en su hogar.

 Lo que más  desean es que con esta actividad ella  puede seguir trabajando  hasta que dios le preste vida y así seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Lidia lives in a very pretty community where it is always cloudy.  She is married to Delfino, with whom she had seven children, all of whom are married.

She is a housewife, and she requested the loan to invest it in buying ingredients such as cheese, oil, Royal yeast, and eggs, among others, to make bread.  She has been doing this work for four years and nine months, and it's going well for her since she already has managed to enlarge her bread oven.

Her mother taught her to make bread from a very young age, and when she got married she stopped doing it.  Four years ago, though, she started again with the same job and it's going well for her since she has produced good profits in her household.

What she most wants with this work is to be able to continue working and so continue getting ahead as long as God gives her life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Nurhayati

texts.en:
Nurhayati, a 53-year-old lady, is married to Arif, a 55-year-old man. They are blessed with three children from their marriage:  Andri, 27 and married; Munarti, 21 and working in a bread company; and Torik, 18, studying at the 3rd grade of Senior High School.

Nurhayati is known as a hardworking woman in her family. She took over the responsibility to meet her family needs after her husband became ill and resigned from his job as a public minivan driver. Nurhayati commenced a kiosk business 14 years ago using her own capital. She sells daily needs items, fried cakes and cold instant beverage and she hires out a coconut rasping machine as well. 

Nurhayati is thinking of improving her business by adding more items to sell, but the limited capital that she has led her to seek a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. She would like to spend the loan on rice, coffee, sugar, milk, cigarettes etc. She hopes that TLM will assist her in improving her business through the loan assistance.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such rice, coffee, sugar, milk, cigarettes etc

loans.name: Venerandah

texts.en:
Venerandah is a 26-year-old married woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She owns a retail shop where she sells general merchandise. She used to only grow cabbages and after a good harvest she sold them off and started a retail shop.  

She faces the challenge of price fluctuations and inflation, customers not paying on time and the seasonal weather.  

Her dreams are educating her children, building a permanent home and buying a car. Venerandah needs the loan to grow cabbages and to buy soap, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to grow cabbages and to buy soap, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is a married woman who has three children. Mary Jean is 33 years old and resides at Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 
Mary Jean owns and operates a farm, planting & harvesting rice for sale to earn a living.  She's been 2 years in this business. Each month, she earns 6,000 doing this type of business.
