She requested a loan of 25,000 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. Mary Jean is been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Mary Jean wants to make improvements to her house and to help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Benjin

texts.en:
Benjin is 28 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Benjin is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Benjin has been raising pigs for 9 years and also earns additional income from banana retail.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Myrth Jane

texts.en:
Myrth Jane is 29 years old and married with two children. She is peacefully living with her husband and two children at the village of Oscariz Ramon. She established a water-refilling service in their village, which she has been operating for six months. She earns about P30,000 a month. Her earnings go to their daily needs, school fees and payment for the monthly electric bill. 

Myrth Jane is asking for financial assistance amounting to P50,000, which will be used to buy more plastic gallon containers for her water refilling service. She is hoping that her business will be more profitable so that she could save some for the future of her children as well as improve their living conditions. In addition, she also aims to provide her customers with quality service to obtain greater profit.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic gallon containers for her water refilling business.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Juana Maria es casada, tiene 19 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa tipica, lleva 1 asño de experiencia en este negocio.

solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para ampliar su capital de trabajo en la compra de mercaderías, consistente en ropa típica, reboso, cortes, fajas, chalinas, etc. Espera en el futuro tener un capital amplio y mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Señora Juana Maria is 19 years old and married with one son.  She works selling traditional clothing; she has one year of experience in this business.

She is requesting a loan which she will use to increase her working capital by purchasing merchandise consisting of traditional clothing: shawls, skirts, belts, scarves, etc.  She hopes to have greater capital in the future and to improve her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Leang

texts.en: Leang, 26, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a Chinese translator. Additionally, she runs a business selling cosmetics in the market. Her husband is a "Tuk Tuk" (a motorcycle with a side car) taxi driver. In order to improve her family's living conditions, Leang is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase clothes and more cosmetics to sell to generate extra profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a beauty salon, build a new house, and support her child to study in higher education.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen es una persona que a pesar de las adversidades que le ha presentado la vida, ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante junto con su familia. Maria del Carmen se encuentra casada y es madre de 4 hijos donde 2 son jóvenes mayores de 20 años y los otros 2 tienen 13 años y 5 meses de nacido. Maria del Carmen, debido a que los ingresos que genera su esposo no son suficientes para el sostenimiento de todos los gastos de su hogar, ha venido trabajando en un bar el cual montó hace más de 2 años y con el que genera ingresos para contribuir en su hogar. Debido a que su último embarazo se complicó, poniendo en gran peligro la salud de Maria del Carmen, esta se vio en la necesidad de cerrar su negocio y quedarse en su casa reposando y cuidando de su salud. Ahora que Maria del Carmen se encuentra recuperada de salud, aspira reiniciar su negocio para contribuir a su esposo con la generación de ingresos para el hogar. Es por esto que Maria del Carmen busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos para su bar como licores y la adecuación de su bar para reiniciar su funcionamiento. 
Maria del Carmen espera que su familia vuelva a gozar de mejores ingresos para poder salir adelante, además, de ofrecerles a sus hijos una buena educación. Actualmente Maria del Carmen genera ingresos con los cuales les paga el estudio universitario a sus 2 hijos mayores, por lo que espera seguir ofreciéndoles este estudio a sus hijos para que en un futuro puedan tener un empleo bien remunerado.

loans.use: Compra de productos para su bar como licores y la adecuación de su bar para reiniciar su funcionamiento.

loans.name: Djiguisseme C Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe DJIGUISSEME C sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Werekela, un des villages de la commune de Guegneka,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, ALISIKE  première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare d’arachide et de haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 80.000F CFA environs par campagne.

loans.use: Labour, semence, engrais, herbicide, sarclage et petits équipements

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
This is Regina. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan to buy more stock of mineral water needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy an additional stock of mineral water for her business. The more mineral water displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Regina dreams that her business will continue to grow, and hopes to always have good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of mineral water to increase her product inventory.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is a Sari sari store owner from Villaba in Leyte. She has been in this business for ten years. Her business is thriving and with this, Joan decided to expand her business to include selling meat like pork and chicken. She is asking a loan to buy pork and chicken meat to sell in her store. She will also use some of the money for sacks of rice to sell. Joan dream that someday her husband can finally settle home and stop working abroad once her business will become stable. In the future, she hope that her business will earn enough and her spouse can help her in the business and be near each other together as they grow old.

loans.use: to buy pork and chicken meat

loans.name: Sokrorn

texts.en:
H. Sokhorn is requesting a $500 loan to build a proper house in the plot she was recently allocated by the government in Phnom Penh far suburbs. H. Sokhorn is not employed; she stays at home and takes care of her children, while her husband is self-employed as a mason. He learnt his skill when employed by a Chinese company, which ceased its activities 4 years ago. He sustains his family with around $5 daily but his income is not steady. He has to propose competitive bids to be in charge of the works, but as he is a gifted worker, he is not worrying about unemployment.

With the $500, H. Sokrom will purchase materials and her husband will built the house in addition to his casual workload.

Hom Sokhorn would like to start a business of catering for the neighborhood, if the village becomes more populated.

loans.use: Building a new house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy hotel equipment

loans.name: Cu

texts.en:
Mrs Cu and her husband have 8 children between 25 and 8. Her second child, Hung, is 22 years old. He became paralytic after falling from a tree.

They only have a little land, about 6,000 m2, to plant cashew nut trees but the land is very poor and they have no capital so they can’t gather the harvest.

Mrs Cu used to sell chickens and pepper at small market but the poultry contracted bird flu which ruined her business. Huong, her husband, only works on their cashew nut garden, and the income from this land is not enough for their family.

The four eldest children stopped going to school and have to work as a day laborers but they only enough money for their own living. Their average income is $9/person/month. Now, she asks to borrow a loan of $100 for her pepper selling and to buy fertilizer for their cashew nut trees.

loans.use: Sell chickens and pepper

texts.en: Mrs. B. is 43 years old, and her husband is 45. They have 3 sons, who are 18, 16 and 14 years old and are all at school. They live in Nghe An province, a rural province in the upper middle of Vietnam. Together with her husband, she makes yogurt and candies, and during the summer she also makes ice cream. She needs the loan to buy more ingredients and to pay the suppliers promptly, instead of buying on credit with very high interest rates.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her ice cream and candy factory

loans.name: Mariela Pamela

texts.es:
Mariela is 29 years old and has a 5 years old son. She currently lives at home with her parents, where is is developing a bookstore / bazaar. Mariela's husband left his family when he went to Spain to find better employment opportunities, but unfortunately, he never returned and doesn't send any money from Spain.

Mariela has been working in her bookstore for 5 years. In order to make best use of the retail space, she also sells presents. She counts with the help of her mother, who takes care of the store when Mariela has to go out to buy products to restock the bookstore.

In her neighborhood, there is no competition and this is the only bookstore / bazaa. This helps a lot and enables her to earn a good income.

With the current loan, Mariela wants to buy presents of 5 Bs to 50 Bs., architectural books of 20 of 200 Bs, and other materials for the bookstore.

Her credit history is excellent. Mariela has shown both to Agrocapital as well as to other financing institutes to be a responsible person with a good repayment history. Please note that the photo with this loan description shows Mariela separate from her business. The latter is because Mariela wasn't home when we went to make the picture: only her mother was.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original loan description in Spanish:

Mariela tiene 29 años y un hijito de 5 años de edad, actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres donde desarrolla el negocio de la librería-bazar. El esposo de Mariela dejo a su familia para viajar a España y encontrar mejores oportunidades de trabajo, lamentablemente no volvió y tampoco envía dinero desde España.

Mariela trabaja en su librería desde hace 5 años, también vende regalos en el mismo lugar a manera de aprovechar el espacio y la clientela, ella cuenta con el apoyo de su madre, quien atiende el negocio cuando Mariela tiene que salir a comprar productos para reabastecer la librería.

En la zona no existe competencia es la unica librería-bazar, esto le beneficia en gran medida ya que percibe buenos ingresos.

Con el presente crédito Mariela comprara regalos entre 5 Bs a 50 Bs, material de arquitectura entre 20 a 200 Bs y otras variedades más de materiales de librería. Sus antecedentes crediticios son excelentes, Mariela demostró tanto en Agrocapital como en otras financieras, ser una persona responsable en cuanto al pago de sus cuotas. Se hace notar que en la foto adjunta la librería y Mariela están separadas debido a que cuando se fue a sacar la foto del negocio Mariela no se encontraba en el mismo, solo se ubicó a la madre.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the bookstore

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es:
Monica is a single mother. She lives with her two children, who are students in a small education center in their city. She decided to begin her business work outside her own home. Noticing the business opportunity offered by the location in front of the health clinic, she did not hesitate in moving her food sales to that space. In little time she was sought by a large number of people who daily go to the health clinic to receive medical attention to alleviate their problems. The delicious dishes she prepares and sells since very early in the day have become a favorite of many of the people who visit that place until the afternoon. This drove her to buy a tent to protect herself from the hot sun and also to offer comfort to her clients. In addition, she can count with the support of her children in giving attention to her clients in the busiest times. She requests US$ 350 to buy a new tent, kitchen utensils and products to prepare her dishes, which will allow her to increase the quantity and variety of dishes she offers daily. Let's make it possible for this hardworking mother to continue cooking her excellent dishes and decorating each one of them with her family's dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Mónica es madre soltera, vive con sus dos hijos, los cuales están cursando estudios en un pequeño centro educativo de su ciudad.Decidió empezar su labor comercializadora en las afueras de su hogar y observando la oportunidad de negocio que se presentaba en el frontis de la posta de salud no dudó en trasladar su espacio de ventas hasta este espacio.En poco tiempo tuvo acogida del inmenso número de personas que acude a diario para recibir distintas atenciones con el propósito de contrarrestar sus males. Las exquisitas viandas que prepara y vende desde muy temprano se han convertido en las favoritas de muchas personas que transitan a diario por ahí hasta pasado el medio día, hecho que la condujo a comprar una carpa para poder protegerse del fuerte sol y también para brindar comodidad a sus clientes, además cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos en la atención al público, en los momentos de mayor afluencia de comensales. Solicita la suma de 350 dólares para adquirir una nueva carpa, utensilios de cocina y productos para la elaboración de viandas esto le permitirá incrementar la cantidad y variedad de platos que ofrece a diario.Hagamos que esta diligente madre siga cocinando excelentes platos y adorne cada uno de los mismos con los sueños de su familia.

loans.use: Buying a tent, cooking utensils and materials.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mr. Chin V., 28, is married to a woman, aged 28, and lives in Batambong province, Cambodia. He works buying and selling recyclable items, earning around $3.70/day. His wife works as a housewife looking after her two school-aged kids. Mr Chin V. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for his business’s transportation because he expects the motorcycle will make his business grow faster, easier, and more effectively.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his business transportation.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace N. has a beauty salon and, with a loan, wishes to purchase a generator, sitting dryer, and bigger mirror. She also wishes to buy cement to finish the floor in her house.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Kalungi D Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for eight months. Rebecca is 48 years old and married with eight children. She manages a bar. She wants to use the extra profits to re-invest in the pub business. Sarah and Sauda both sell raw foods and want to use the loan to increase stock. Jane sells charcoal for a living.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more alcohol drinks for pub business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a mixed pack of adult clothing.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace E. is 50 years old, married and has 6 children. She resides in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria.  Grace has been rearing and selling chickens since 1990. She learnt this business from her mother.  She needs a loan of $875 to buy more chickens to rear and sell.

loans.use: To buy more chicken for rearing sale.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 47 years old, married and has 7 children between the ages of 14 and 27. Imelda owns a small clothes shop, which she started in 2005. She works at her shop from 7am to 9pm every day earns a monthly profit of about $400 from her sales.

Imelda has requested this loan so that she can buy more clothes to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
Maria de Lourdes started her business because she wished to have an extra household income and to support her husband and children when they needed. She started the business also because she needed to be active and wanted to be feel useful. She has always liked to be busy with some productive activity and likes to be an independent person. This way, she will also help her husband with the household expenses. She started approximately 30 years ago selling shoes, but after a while this activity was not given her good profits since the shoe stores started to accept credit. She decided to change and started selling clothes and novelties in front of her house where she furnished a small lot. Afterwards, she bought a lot next to her house which she as well furnished to sell her merchandise. This was 8 years ago and since then, she has being doing well.

She wants a US $775 loan which she will pay back in 6 months. She will be able to buy seasonal clothes and also ceramic decorations, flower vases, backpacks and a display which will allow her to have more variety for this summer season and serve her customers better. With your support, it will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Maria de Lourdes, inició el negocio por los deseos de tener un ingreso extra para el hogar y apoyar a su esposo y sus hijos cuando lo necesitaran. Inicio el negocio porque necesitaba estar activa y sentirse una persona útil ya que siempre le ha gustado ocupar su tiempo en alguna actividad productiva y también ser una persona independiente, y de esta manera también ayudaba a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. Comenzó hace como 30 años vendiendo zapatos, pero después esta actividad dejó de darle buenas ganancias ya que las zapaterías comenzaron a dar crédito, por lo que decidío cambiar de giro y empezó a vender ropa y novedades en la parte de enfrente de su casa, en donde acondiciono un pequeño local, hasta que después compro un local al lado de su casa, el cual acondicioné para poder vender su mercancía, esto fue hace como 8 años y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien.

Ella requiere un prestamo por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses, para poder comprar ropa de temporada así como adornos de cerámica, floreros, mochilas y una vitrina, lo cual le permitirá tener mas surtido para esta temporada de verano y darles mejor atención a sus clientes. Con tu apoyo esto sera posible.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo Juárez is a taxi driver, working every day in the city of Chinandega. Despite the difficult circumstances he faces, such as the high cost of parts and fuel, he has been able to succeed and support his household.

Today Rodolfo faces another problem. His taxi cab is in disrepair and so he needs to be parts to fix it. This is why he is turning to Ceprodel for a loan which he can use to purchase these parts and continue with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Rodolfo Juárez se dedica a la labor de transporte teniendo su propio taxi el cual lo trabaja todos los días en su municipio en la ciudad de Chinandega. A pesar de las difíciles circunstancias que atraviesa como lo es el alto costo de los repuestos y del combustible, ha logrado salir adelante y llevar el alimento a su humilde hogar de habitación.

El problema que el señor Rodolfo hoy en día atraviesa es que el vehiculo taxi está dañado y por ende necesita de la compra de los repuestos por lo que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para solicitar un préstamo con el cual comprar los repuestos y así continuar con su negocio en su municipio.

loans.use: To purchase parts for his taxi

loans.name: Zenaida, Luicita And Isabel Group

texts.en:
Zenaida Luicita and Isabel are members of the Lirio Village Bank.

Zenaida is a married, thirty-year-old mother of four children. Zenaida sells food in different regional fairs and travels to different villages during their festival seasons to sell food. In addition, Zenaida sells homemade bread in the Pilacucho neighborhood.

Meanwhile, Luicita is a married, twenty-four-year-old mother of two children. Luicita sells fruit at regional fairs, where she also purchases cereal that she resells to different businesses in the Nery Garcia Market. In addition, Luicita has an embroidering service for different businesses.

Additionally, Isabel is a thirty-three-year old mother of three children. Isabel has a store in her house where she sells vegetables, home supplies, and meat. In addition, Isabel travels to different fairs, where she buys livestock that she resells to restaurants.

Zenaida, Luicita and Isabel need respective loans of 400, 400, and 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in vegetables, fruit, rice, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, and meat.

Zenaida, Luicita and Isabel’s dreams are that they further supply and improve their businesses, and their children finish their studies and become professionals.

loans.use: Zenaida, Luicita, and Isabel need respective loans of 400, 400, and 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in vegetables, fruit, rice, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, and meat.

loans.name: Fatha Mohammad

texts.en:
Fatha M. is married. He lives in a household of 7. He is an uneducated man but he has a small business selling fuel that he started 7 years ago. It is still going, but in the past 2 years his business has not been going as well as before because now there are a lot of fuel pump stations in Kabul. Fatha M. would like to open a small fuel pump station in Kabul, therefore he needs some money.

He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani with a term of 18 months to open a small pump station and buy more fuel to make his business like other business dealers' in Kabul. He is sure that he can do it with this loan.

He is happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan that helps people who want to further their businesses. He would like to thank Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To open a small pump station

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Tran Thi K. is 40 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 2004. During 4 years, she invested most of her loans in animal-raising. At present besides this business, her family catches fish. Therefore, they have a stable income of VND 3 million/month. For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow VND 9 million to buy some implements for fishing.

loans.use: to buy some implements for fishing

loans.name: Hadija's Group

texts.en:
Hadija has had a "genge" in Dodoma, Tanzania, for 13 years. A genge is a fruit and vegetable stand that can be a tiny plank of wood on a side street or as big as a fully-fledged shop selling a variety of food in a crowded city market. Hadija hopes that her first loan helps her to increase her inventory and sales. She is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $120 per month as a result of her 12-hour work days, but she hopes that her profits increase after taking the loan, so that she can pay for her children's school fees, get more food for her family, and pay hospital bills.

Hadija is 40 years old, widowed, and has six children. She also cares for three additional dependants. Hadija will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Jamila and Suzy.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, fish, coconuts and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Katebo Business Group1

texts.en:
A. Martin, a member of Katebo group in Buwama and a married man caring for his immediate family, is a fisherman at the landing site in Katebo. He owns a boat and a variety of other fishing materials including nets and hooks for use in his business. Martin is also a farmer with various plantations that are mostly in the care of his wife, children and helpers who are paid for their duties.

Martin has a plan to buy more boats to hire out to fellow fishermen, hoping to thereby increase revenue and savings. He is happy that with previous loans he was able to buy standard fishing nets and hooks that trap good quality fish, thus attracting a large number of customers. Martin is now requesting a loan in order to buy another fishing net for his business.

loans.use: To buy another fishing net for his business.

loans.name: Nun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Nun is the leader of a five-member group. The members live in Ta Lart village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Mrs. P. Nun has a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn money to support the family. In order to earn more income from this plantation, Mrs. P. Nun is requesting a loan to buy a piece of land to cultivate more rice. She hopes to increase her income to provide better conditions for the family.

Her husband, Mr. Dith CH., helps her on the plantation. Mrs. P. Nun is 50 years old and has four children; one is a guard, and the other three are employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: Buy a piece of land to cultivate more rice and increase income

loans.name: Nusrat Almas M. Irshad Group

texts.en:
Nusrat Almas baji is a 39-year-old married lady. Her husband is M. I. and he has a food production and selling business. He has 20 years' experience in this business. She lives in a city called Borewala, Pakistan. She is the mother of four kids: two sons and two daughters. All of her children are getting an education from a school which is located near their house.

Nusrat baji helps her husband prepare Punjabi food for sale. She is a very responsible lady. She provides Punjabi food on time to his hotel. Now Mr. I. has decided to start driving an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) since Nusrat baji is able to handle his food business very well. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her husband to use.

Nusrat baji is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Zahida Parveen baji wants a loan to buy bicycles to re-sell. Salma baji wants a loan to buy clothes to re-sell. Manzooran baji wants a loan to buy utensils to re-sell. Khursheed begum baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
El señor Andres vive en casa propia con su hija en la calle León M Loza de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene un auto el cual hace trabajar como transporte publico y con esta actividad  mantiene a su familia ya que no tiene otros ingresos.
El crédito que solicita es para la reparación de su auto (nuevos frenos y mantenimiento en general) y de esta manera poder seguir trabajando normalmente.

Su antecedente histórico es bueno y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Es cliente nuestro desde Abril de 2007.
texts.en:
Andres lives in his own home with his daughter on León M Loza street in the Tembladerani area of La Paz city. He has a car with which he provides public transportation (taxi service) and with this activity supports his family as he does not have any other source of income. The loan he seeks will be used to repair his car (new brakes and general maintenance) and in this way be able to continue working normally. His credit history is good and he can access this new loan. He has been our client since April 2007.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Change the brakes and general maintenance of his taxi.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 53 años y vive con su nieta de 3 años en su propia casa. Es agricultora y desde hace muchos años decidió quedarse en su tierra natal a dedicarse a la siembra de los principales productos que produce la zona, cada día trabaja velando el  crecimiento normal de sus plantaciones y que llegue el tiempo propicio para la cosecha, de esta manera va labrándose un futuro, en el cual piensa seguir dedicándose a la agricultura, ya que tiene la ventaja de poseer un almacén donde guarda los productos necesarios para su familia, y disponer de ellos, ella tiene planes de seguir trabajando y  mejorar la infraestructura de su casa. Es la primera ocasión en que  Elsa tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se compromete a trabajar  por el bienestar de su banco comunal. El dinero solicitado es para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizante para su campos de cultivo el cual está valorizado en aproximadamente 150 soles y la otra parte la invertirá en mejorar la infraestructura de su casa donde tiene el almacén de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Elsa is 53 years old and lives with her 3-year-old niece in a home she owns. She is a farmer and many years ago she decided to stay in the area she was from in order to farm the main products of the area. Every day she works watching over the normal growth of her fields and waiting for the right time to harvest. In this way she is carving out a future for herself, in which she plans to continue farming as she has the advantage of owning a storehouse where she can keep the products she needs for her family and store them. She plans to continue working and improve the infrastructure of her home. This is the first time Elsa is borrowing from MFP and she is committed to working for the well-being o fher community bank. She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizer for her fields at an estimated cost of 150 soles and the remainder will be used to improve the infrastructure of the part of her home where she stores her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Léa

texts.fr:
Née vers 1963 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin, A. Léa habite à Adjinan dans le 3e Arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo. Léa est mère de quatre enfants dont trois sont scolarisés. Léa est une vendeuse de glacières, une activité qu’elle exerce avec passion pour pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins. Pour accroitre ses sources de revenu, Léa vend aussi de tissus. Mais les revenus issus de ses activités ne lui permettent pas de répondre efficacement à ses besoins. Pour ce fait, Léa sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son capital d’une part et d’autre part constituer une épargne.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Born around 1963 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Bénin, Ms. A. Léa lives in Adjinan, in the 3rd district of Porto-Novo. She is the mother of four children, of whom three are in school. She sells coolers (insulated containers) that is a business she operates passionately in order to meet her needs. But the income from her work doesn't allow her to answer these needs effectively. Because of this, she's requesting a loan to one extent for bolstering her capital and to another for building up her savings.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coolers and some cloth

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna O. lives in Serei Sambatt village, in Kandal province. She and her husband, Nuth Nim, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice and vegetables. On this plantation, they face an obstacle because her field is infertile. In order to deal this problem, Vanna decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

She is a 49 year old mother of five children, one of whom breeds cows while another stays at home to do housework. The others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: But fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
M. Mavjuda is 41 years old, married and has three children.

Mavjuda has been running a grocery store for the past seven years. She sells sweets (candies), preserved food, juices, soft drinks and other products in her grocery. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. Mavjuda is respectful and patient with all of her customers which attracts people and brings them back to her store to buy groceries again.

Mavjuda is seeking to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of 4,000 Somoni to increase the inventory she has for sale. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Mavjuda reach all of her aspirations.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after Tajikistan’s independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit:  www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase the range of goods in her grocery shop

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria del Rosario es socia del Bancomunal Sol de Alegría.
Maria del Rosario es casada tiene 40 años, dos hijos de 16 y 9 años que están estudiando  en la escuela estatal.
Maria del Rosario es programadora de sistemas, no ejerció por que se caso se dedico a su casa y a cuidar a sus hijos, con los ahorros familiares que tenían  hace tres años compraron un carro de segunda el cual su esposo da servicio de taxi todos los días. 
Maria del Rosario necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de repuesto para su carro, llantas batería, para que pueda funcionar mejor.
Desde que esta en Finca Maria del Rosario aprendió como trabajar en el negocio, como ahorrar, también tiene mas amigas por que paraba en su casa.
El sueño de Maria del Rosario es comprarse un auto nuevo.
texts.en:
María del Rosario is a member of the Sol de Alegría comunal bank. She is married, she is 40 years old, and she has two children, 16 and 9 years old, who are studying in the state school. María del Rosario is a systems programmer, a career in which she did not participate because she got married and took care of the house and her children. Three years ago, using the family savings, they bought a used car that her husband drives as a taxi every day. María del Rosario needs a loan of 1200 PEN to buy parts for her car, tires, and a battery, so that it can run better. Since she has been with Finca, María del Rosario has learned how to work in her business, how to save, and she also has more friends because before she just stayed at home. María del Rosario’s dream is to buy a new car.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: María del Rosario needs a loan of 1200 PEN to buy parts for her car, tires, and a battery, so that it can run better.

loans.name: Madinahon

texts.ru: Мадинахон 26 лет. еще незамужем. Закончив школу, она стала работать на местном консервном заводе, который производит консервированные овощи и фрукты. Работа сезонная и сейчас завод начинает подготовку к летнему сезону. Работа тяжелая но хорошо оплачивается. Кроме работы Мадинахон и ее старшие братья занимаются откормом скота дома. У ее родителей имеется участок земли на которой каждый год они выращивают разные корма и поэтому проблем с кормом у нее нет. Мадинахон знает про КИВА и поэтому решила подать заявку на займ и собирается прикупить бычка.
texts.en:
Madinahon is 26 years old; she is not married yet. After finishing school she started working at the local canning factory which produces canned vegetables and fruits. The job is seasonal and right now the factory is starting to get ready for the summer season. The job is difficult but pays well. In addition, to her job Madinahon and her older brothers raise livestock at home. Her parents have a plot of land on which they grow a variety of feed every year and because of this she does not have problems with feed. Modinahon know about KIVA and because of this decided to apply for a loan and plans to purchase a bull.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bull

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita C. is from the city of Dipolog. She is fifty-four years old and married with grown children. To make a living, Marita owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Marita has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $68 a month from these activities. In 2006, Marita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to enable her to engage in business activities. Marita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. That loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Marita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her eighth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC (Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative):

PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Reina Maria

texts.es: Reina María V. M. tiene la edad de 33 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo y estudia. Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Reina recorre las calles, debido a la difícil situación económica, ella tomo la iniciativa por cuenta propia y ofrecer sus productos por la tarde con sus catálogos, para que sus clientes escojan lo que mas les gusta y es así que decide mantener este negocio. Ahora solicita este financiamiento para  capital de trabajo para la compra de perfumes, cremas, pinturas de labios, polvos entre otras cosas. El sueño de Reina es que su hijo logre prepararse con una carrera y le ayude con su negocio.
texts.en:
Reina María V. M. is 33 years old and married. She has 1 son who is in school. Her economic activity is selling cosmetics. She has worked in this business for more than 3 years. Faced with a difficult economic situation, she took the initiative of starting her own business. In the afternoon Reina travels the streets offering her products with her catalogs, which allows her customers to choose what they like the most; she has decided to stay in this business. Reina will use this loan as working capital for purchasing perfumes, creams, lipstick, powders, etc. Reina’s dream is for her son to prepare for a career, and that she can help him through her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Vicky

texts.es: Vicky tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y cumplida, vive es una cuarto alquilado junto a su hermana, ya que es natural de la ciudad del Cuzco. Aunque todavía no tiene hijos, ha encontrado en su desarrollo personal el incentivo que necesita para esforzarse en el trabajo. Se dedica a la venta de películas, documentales, telenovelas, dibujos, etc, en formato DVD, las cuales son muy solicitados en la zona de la mina la Rinconada, que es donde vende su mercadería. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que en sus momentos de aburrimiento puede aprovechar para ver una de las películas que tiene, lleva 15 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el intenso frió de la zona, ya que se encuentra a más de 5 000 m.s.n.m, pero aun así sabe que tiene que poner todo de su parte para que su negocio salga a delante. Para un futuro cercano espera que pueda tener una tienda donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes. Este es el quinto préstamo de Vicky con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo y para ello ahorrará poco a poco. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa y solidaria, motivo por el cual es muy respetada por las demás socias. Con los tres mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más DVDs y hará arreglar su pequeña carretilla donde vende su mercadería.
texts.en:
Vicky is 41 years old, and she is a very hardworking and accomplished woman. She lives in a rented room with her sister, which is normal for the city of Cuzco. Although she has no children, she has found, in her personal development, the motivation she needs to work hard. Vicky sells movies, documentaries, soap operas, cartoons, etc. on DVD, which are in high demand in the mine area of Rinconada, which is where she sells her merchandise. The thing she likes best about her work are those times of boredom when she can enjoy watching one of the movies she has. Vicky has been doing this business for 15 years, and the thing she thinks is most difficult is having to endure the intense cold in the area, which is more than 5,000 meters (16,404 feet) above sea level, but she knows that she has to put 100% of herself into the business in order to succeed. In the near future, Vicky hopes to have a store where she can better attend to her customers. This is the fifth loan she has received from Kiva partner MFP, and she understands the responsibility she has to repay it on time, so she will save money little by little. In her communal bank, she is a very active and dedicated member, which is why she is so respected by the other members. With this loan of 3,000 soles, she will purchase more DVDs and fix up her small stand out of which she sells her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her merchandise

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr: Bintou C. est une femme de 52 ans. Elle est veuve et vit à Vélingara avec ses deux (2) enfants. Ce crédit lui générera des bénéfices qui lui permettront de prendre en charge la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Bintou C. is a 52-year-old woman. She is a widow and lives in Vélingara with her two children. This loan will generate profits for her that will allow her to meet the food, health, and schooling needs of her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For buying and marketing five sacks of peanuts

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia J. is from the village of Lao Sta. Cruz. She is 46 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Virginia owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2001, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her 14th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is thirty – six years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, two sons and one daughter who are all in school. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Joyce is a trader. She trades in foot wears. She sells in her community market and treks to other towns to sell as well. She procures her goods from Kumasi. Joyce has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy foot wears

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is 32 years old she is married and mother with one child who is currently in school. She is a baker and bakes bread together with other pastries like meat pie etc. and supply to her loyal customers. For the past three years till now, she is been baking bread and other food pastries in taking care of her household. In spite of the challenges she faces she manages to handle demand of her customers and successfully meet their request on time. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are shooting up. She requests a loan support to remain in business. With the loan she believes she can provide for her family and save more for future eventuality. She said your help is much needed in her life and business.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc.

loans.name: Sonia Edith

texts.es: La señora Sonia Edith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia de El Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 49 años y 03 hijos, todos ya independientes.Lleva 20 años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, desde su juventud siempre le aficiono la costura y gracias al conocimiento que le brindo su mamá, ella no desaprovecho la oportunidad de aprender y hoy en día, eso le ha valido de mucho, para que hoy en día, cuente con un pequeño taller de costura, ubicada en su misma casa.En la actualidad, nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente. Una de sus metas por lograr, es implementar mas su taller de confección con maquinas industriales modernas, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. Sonia Edith, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.

loans.use: Comprará telas en metros, hilos.

loans.name: C3752 Group

texts.en:
Boniface N. was born in 1980. He is married and he has no children, but he takes care of one dependent who is 17 years old and is studying in school. Boniface lives in the Kicukiro District of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.  

Boniface runs a general store. He is a successful entrepreneur and his business has been operating for four years. His business is open every day from 7 AM to 6 PM .

He is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company to provide working capital to his growing enterprise. This will allow him to maintain a larger inventory of products for his current customers and, hopefully, to attract new customers as well.  If his expansion strategy is successful, he plans to save the extra money he makes so that he will be able to buy his own house some day.

loans.use: To buy products to sell

loans.name: Gloria Marina

texts.es: Gloria Marina R. reside en Santa Tecla municipio del departamento de La Libertad. Gloria tiene 56 años de edad vive con su esposo quien es empleado y su hija Ana de 20 años de edad estudiante de bachillerato. Hace siete años Gloria tuvo la idea de elaborar tortillas por las tardes desde su casa, ya que en todo su pasaje no había negocio como ese y es así como la Sra. Gloria cada medio día se colca a las a afuera de su casa e instala una bolsa platica suficientemente gruesa para cubrirse de la lluvia y el sol, ahora ya es muy conocida en la zona y su estabilidad de clientes es excelente. El destino del crédito que solicita es para invertir en materia prima para  su negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria Marina R. is a resident of the town of Santa Tecla in the department of La Libertad. She is 56 years old and lives with her husband who is employed and her 20 year old daughter Ana who is studying for her bachelor’s degree. Seven years ago, Gloria came up with the idea to make and sell tortillas since there were no similar businesses. She prepares the tortillas from her home in the afternoons. Every day around noon, she covers a space outside of her house with a plastic tarp in order to shield herself from the rain and the sun. She is now well-known in the area and has a stable clientele. Gloria will use her loan to purchase ingredients for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies for her tortilla business

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Mrs. Nelly M. is a native of Barangay Palaka Norte, Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. She is a 62 year-old widow with nephews that she has taken under her wing. She supports them in terms of food, education and their daily needs. At 62, she is happy and eager to help her family sustain their needs, especially in sending them to school, because she believes that sending them to school will equip her nephews in every challenge of life they will encounter. She has an adopted child who is also helping her in running her business. She started her business by selling condiments in their community until her business grew and later she considered selling vegetables. Now she has a block inside the local market place where she displays all her stock. As part of her business routine every week, she has a delivery of vegetables and spices, guaranteeing that she always sells fresh produce to her customers. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es: Ana Ruth V. D. M. D. 42 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango, ubicado en la capital del país. Vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos menores D. edad. Ella fabrica ropa interior para niños y adultos, la cual la comercializa a diferentes clientes, los cuales la prefieren por ser una persona muy responsable la cual entrega su producto siempre a tiempo y el cual se dedica a realizarlo con mucha dedicación. Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar aceite para el mantenimiento D. las máquinas D. coser, así mismo desea poder comprar hilos y telas. Ella espera mejorar las ventas D. su negocio, y D. esta manera incrementar su producción. Como toda madre comprometida, Ana Ruth espera poder brindarles una mejor vida a sus hijos, es por esto que se esfuerza a diario para poder ayudar  su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Ana Ruth V. D. M., 42, lives in the Ilopango municipality, which is located in the capitol of the country. She lives with her husband and their three minor children. She makes underwear for children and adults. She sells them to different customers. They prefer her because she is a very responsible person, and she always delivers her product on time. She works with much dedication. Ana is asking for a loan to be able to buy oil for maintenance on her sewing machines. She also wishes to buy thread and fabric. She hopes to improve sales in her business by increasing her production. Like all dedicated mothers, Ana Ruth hopes to be able to give her children a better life. That is why she puts forth so much effort everyday. She also does it to be able to help her husband with all of the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy thread and fabric

loans.name: Ngô's Group

texts.en:
C. Ngô Thị (20209050043) is a 53-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong-Bắc Ninh. C. is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Vọng Nguyệt 3 nhóm 01 (1).

C. is married and has three grown children. To make a living, C. owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector: it is a specialized retail store. While not her only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling confectionary products in the local community. C. has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, C. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,808,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,048,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be C.'s third loan taken out from SEDA.  C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị Sử (20209050044) is a 56-year-old female who is requesting a 5,600,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.

2.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20209050045) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 5,600,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  Nguyễn Thị V. (20209050046) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 5,600,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

4.  Trương Thị T. T. (20209050047) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 5,600,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

C. Ngô Thị (20209050043) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  C. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Vọng Nguyệt 3 nhóm 01 (1).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm bánh kẹo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  C. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, C. kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Vào 2008, C. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  C. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.808.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Nguyễn Thị Sử (20209050044) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.600.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.

2.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20209050045) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.600.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3.  Nguyễn Thị V. (20209050046) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.600.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

4.  Trương Thị T. T. (20209050047) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.600.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung T. hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc V. Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la señora ISABEL, ella pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, la socia es  natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 49 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos, (28, 26, 12) años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con  la administración de su combis, ella es empresaria tiene sus combis en la ruta de Cusco Cabildo, prestan el servicio de transporte diarios a los ciudadanos, la socia tiene este negocio desde hace 15 años y lo conoce a la perfección su deseo es incrementar un par de combis mejorados. Nuestra socia socita el préstamo para hacer mantenimientos de sus carros y comprar algunos repuestos.

La socia agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Isabel was born in the city of Cusco and is a member of the Mujeres Unidas Communal Bank. She is 49 years old, married, and has 3 children, aged 28, 26, and 12. Isabel alternates her household activities with the administration of her rickshaw business. She operates rickshaws along the Cusco Cabildo route, offering daily transportation services to the citizens. Isabel has had this business for 15 years and she knows it to perfection. Her goal is to expand with a pair of improved rickshaws. Isabel is requesting a loan to pay for maintenance of her rickshaws and to purchase replacement parts.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY REPLACEMENT PARTS FOR HER RICKSHAWS

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly has a four-year-old child with her husband Reneboy. She is 23 years old and involved in rice farming. She helps her husband till their 1-hectare rice field. The farm is their only source of income. She wants the farm to be productive in order for there to be enough income for her family and also for savings. She wants to save for her child's education.

Shirly is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP. She said that she will use it for farm supplies like fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Bun's Group

texts.en:
Bun S. is 24 years old and married. She resides with her husband in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia and their three-year-old child. She is employed as a cook for an organization, earning approximately $3 in revenue per day. She has been with this job since 2009. Her husband operates his motorbike as a driver, and he also works as a construction worker in the city. He earns an income of $6 per day that helps to cover the family expenses. Their standard of living has been improved since they started these businesses, so they want to have a loan to expand their businesses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase construction tools and material to build rental rooms for workers at the garment factory. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva. (S.'s husband is pictured here)

loans.use: To buy construction tools and construction materials.

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.en: B. Odiljon is from Tursunzade, where he plants vegetables and raises cattle. Odiljon is married, with 4 children. He is a hard worker who has now doubled his efforts because he wants to increase his income to fulfill the needs of his family. Odiljon has asked for the support of Kiva partner IMON International through a loan that will allow him to buy materials for planting his crops as well as to invest in purchasing and raising cattle in his area. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It also has produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's history Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase planting supplies and cattle

loans.name: Evalyn

texts.en:
Evalyn is a 34-year-old married mother of two. She has been running an Internet café for four years. She previously worked as an accountant before she saw the need to invest in this business. She has previously taken out three loans from Faulu Kenya, which she used to expand her business.  

She plans to expand her business and open other outlets in the future. She believes that confidence and determination are what drives a person to success. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya, a Kiva partner, to buy a one PC (personal computer) and stationery.

loans.use: To buy one computer and stationery

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
N. Harriet is a resident of Yesu Amala, Nansana. She is a married woman blessed with two children.

Harriet owns a salon business and, at the same time, carries out tailoring services. She is using the loan to purchase beauty salon items and cloth for making different designs for her customers.

Harriet is encouraging and her dream is to improve on her salon and to have enough stock of clothes for her business.

loans.use: To purchase beauty salon items and material for making different designs for her customers

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita S. is from the village of Calaran Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Teresita owns and operates a beauty salon in her community. Teresita has been involved in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to to purchase materials. Teresita is requesting a new loan, her third, of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: C4362 Abahuje Group

texts.en:
Viateur is 34 years old, married with 2 children, the older one is 15 years old and the younger is 6 years old. Viateur owns a business of selling eggs in his region. This is his 15th year of success in his business selling eggs. Viateur’s business is open from 7 in the morning to 8 in the evening every day except Sunday. Viateur is the group representative for a group which is called ABAHUJE in the local language. This group consists of four members.

Viateur and his group are now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their business through purchasing more eggs which will allow them to satisfy their customers. In this way, Viateur and his group hope to earn more profits; with these profits Viateur especially will be able to pay school fees for his children as well as providing them with all their needs.

loans.use: Expanding his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of rice

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 45 años, vive con su madre en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la fabricación y venta de zapatos, que  vende en la ciudad donde vive, además también envía estos calzados a la capital del país donde son muy demandados. Gracias al empeño  y entusiasmo que le ha puesto a su negocio, este ha ido creciendo de a pocos  y ahora recibe gran cantidad de pedidos. Es por esta razón que esta muy satisfecha porque quiere expandir su negocio de venta de calzado, hasta convertirlo en uno de los más prósperos de la ciudad. Las ventas son buenas y trabaja incansablemente escuchando música, lo cual le da los ánimos para terminar los pedidos que tiene pendientes, al lado de sus ayudantes.Es su primer préstamo con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con los pagos de todas sus  cuotas.Rosa tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  mayor cantidad de material que necesita para elaborar sus calzados.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 45, lives with her mother in her own house. She has been making and selling shoes for ten years. She sells in the city where she lives. She also sends this footwear to the capital of the country where they are much in demand. Thanks to the effort and enthusiasm that she has put into her work, her business has been slowly growing. Now she gets a lot of orders. That is why she is very happy; she wants to expand her business of selling footwear. She wants it to become one of the most prosperous in the city. Sales are good, and she works tirelessly listening to music. The music encourages her to finish, along side of her helpers, the pending orders that she has. This is her first loan with MFP. She pledges to be very punctual with her payments. Rosa plans to invest the requested money buy purchasing a great amount of material that she needs to make shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials she needs for her business

loans.name: Sant Yalla Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SANT YALLA vient juste d’être créé, les membres viennent de faire leur adhésion dans le Banc Villageois et ont reçu leurs premiers prêts, un prêt initial de 50.000 francs CFA pour chacune des membres. Le groupe est composé de 14 femmes toutes issues du même village. Elles ont constitué leur groupe par proximité et par affinité, elles sont âgées entre 25 et 50 ans et sont au moins mères de 2 enfants. L’activité principale du groupe est le petit commerce de produits divers tels la vente de produits halieutiques, d’effets vestimentaires, de produits cosmétiques et alimentaires et de crème glacée pour les détentrices de réfrigérateur. Le nouveau crédit permettra au groupe de solidarité de renforcer ses activités économiques et de les diversifier en achetant les produits dénombrés plus haut. Les membres du groupe, en sus des remboursements réguliers qu’elles font, participent beaucoup aux différentes charges financières de leurs familles respectives et mobilisent également de l’épargne au niveau de leur Banc Villageois. 

Madame Fatou BEYE, debout à droit de la photo en deuxième rang avec un foulard noir sur la tête est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge dont 03 qui fréquentent l’école. Elle développe une activité commerciale et avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter et vendre des parfums, des produits cosmétiques, de l’encens, des pagnes et des draps de lit. Elle pratique cette activité depuis 03 ans et n’y a pas encore rencontré de problème. Son mari est en voyage et ne vient qu’une seule fois par an pour voir la famille, cette situation fait qu’elle assure une bonne partie de la prise en charge familiale. Par exemple : la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité des enfants. Et cela ne lui empêche pas de faire des remboursements réguliers et d’augmenter chaque fois son niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
The group SANT YALLA has just been created.  The members are here to join the Banc Villageois and have received their first loans, an initial loan of 50,000 francs CFA for each member.  The group is composed of fourteen women, all from the same village.  They formed their group by proximity and affinity.  They range from 25 to 50 years of age, and they are mothers of at least two children each.  The main work of the group is small-scale commerce in various goods, such as seafood products, clothing and accessories, cosmetics, foodstuff, and ice cream for those members having a refrigerator.  The new loan will enable the solidarity group to bolster its businesses and to diversify them by purchasing the goods mentioned above. The group members, in addition to regular payments they make, take part in covering the various expenses of their respective families. And they also raise money to save at their Banc Villageois. Ms. Fatou BEYE (who is standing at the right in the photo in the second row and wearing a black scarf on her head) is the head of the solidarity group.  She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of six children to support.  Three of the children attend school.  Fatou is developing a business. And with her new loan, she is going to buy and sell perfumes, cosmetics, incense, pagnes (colorful West African cloth), and bed sheets.  She has been in this business for three years and has not encountered any problems yet.  Fatou's husband is on travel and comes to see the family only once a year. As a result of this situation, Fatou makes sure the bulk of family expenses are covered, for example: food, health care, and schooling for the children.  This does not keep her from making regular loan payments or from increasing her savings each time.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering and developing the businesses of the solidarity group

loans.name: Ruth United Group

texts.en:
Joseph B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Ruth United. He is 21 years old, single and was only able to attend school through 10th grade due to lack of financial support.  

For two years, he has been selling used clothes in Harbel Market Firestone, outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

He plans to use his 4,000-Liberian-Dollars portion of this 20,000-Liberian-Dollars group loan to buy more used clothes. He describes himself as kind and determined.

His goal is to improve his business and go back to school.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes

loans.name: Paula

texts.en: Paula C.'s main source of income comes from manufacturing and selling clay products to local businesses and community members. She is 50 years old, married and has nine school-age children. They are from the village of Mozzozzin Norte. Paula has been in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Paula joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.
